Reviews.Title: “Good value & great location”
Reviews.Author: Lightys_Family
Reviews.Content: Cracking location - 10 minute drive to Disney! Big room with 2 double beds - sleep number Bathroom showing its age - needs a refit soon Staff friendly Good Starbucks coffee, didn't try food Pools almost deserted when we used them at 4-6pm. Lovely & warm, just needs a little tlc Would go back there, for a good price and spend our money in the parks !!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and great value!”
Reviews.Author: Overton1
Reviews.Content: Don't believe the reviews, we had a great stay. Check in was speedy and easy, hotel was clean, staff very friendly and worked quickly to resolve small issues....fresh towels, new iron, etc... Very nice resort with game room, children movie center, cafe, bar and two pools. This is the first time we've vacationed without a kitchen in the room, for this reason alone we may not stay at this resort again. Eating out gets tiring and expensive. Location in relation to Disney was EXCELLENT! Only problem I had was shuttle service to the parks, times do not compliment the average guest. Ex shuttle from the resort may leave at 10:00am headed to Epcot but returns at 5:00pm. Clearly NOT enough time, so don't count on riding the shuttle if you plan to get your moneys worth out of the parks.

Reviews.Title: “very mediocre borderline poor”
Reviews.Author: Sara P
Reviews.Content: We were part of a timeshare shpeel (which we didn't know about until we got there....) and arrived at 2:00am only to find that "we were lucky" to get a room--they'd had to turn 17 people with reservations away at that time of the morning. The staff was friendly and helpful, but the rooms were not great. The door of our first room was chipped and old, the room looked like it had been painted (poorly) and like they did a half-assed job at remodeling. The second room (the next night) was better but only had one lamp, no overhead lighting or chairs! We had to request another lamp so we could see. The staff were friendly and helpful,. but when you have little to work with you can only do so much. Wouldn't recommend it. AND...sleep number beds are horrible!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: yg1984
Reviews.Content: This place was awesome, clean rooms, friendly people and housekeeping did a great job... Room was spotless and I love the tile floors, Maintanance guy was very friendly an very quick when we called for service same for housekeeping. I would def recommend this place and thank you all for a wonderful experience at the Worldgate Resort we enjoy everything about this place! P.S If you need an updated unit request the North Tower Building...

Reviews.Title: “My 2day Nightmare at worldgate resort”
Reviews.Author: maggie6100
Reviews.Content: There should be a class action suit against this hotel for customers from expedia and hotwire who were turned away on April 2 and 3, 2012. I arrived to the on my first night to be told I had no hotel room along with other people who purchased through expedia and hotwire. They told us we had to find other hotel rooms for the night because of a power outage on the one floor which was desginated for customers who purchased through them and were not able to accomadate us because they were completely full. The first night we were simply told to contact expedia or hotwire for alternatives. I spoke to the young lady who assured me it would be fixed the next morning when the piece came in. I told her I would find another hotel for the night or sleep in the car as long as we were assured that we had a room the next day. We could not find a hotel in that vicinity so we decided to spend the night in the car. That evening about 2am my husband and kids in the car I walk into the hotel to find them giving out rooms. I was so upset I told the clerk my situation and he appologized and I was able to get a room but only for that night. It was 4am before we were able to get into the room to finally sleep. we woke up at 8am I spoke to a supervisor explained everything to her. She assured me I would have a room when I got back from the park that evening. She also stated that the resort was supposed to find accomedations at another hotel and not just turn us away and she would investigate. She even gave me the room number that would be blocked for me. That evening I arrive at 10pm and ask for the room by number and give my name. The clerks had me instead a piece of paper notifying me that the whole wing is down without power and that they have made arrangements with a sister hotel to accomadate me. They stated that I would have to pay for that hotel and hotwire would refund me. They lend me their phone and then totally disregard you. As I am standing there on the phone they are checking in OTHER CUSTOMERS!! unbelievable!! I again spoke to another supervisor gave her my story. At first there was nothing she could do until I explained I had already spoken to a Supervisor that morning and then she goes to check with another supervisor in the back and I suddenly get an apology told that the hotel fees would be waived (the extra 10.00 a day) and i get the same room number that I had originally requested in which was in the wing that apparently had no power. WOW!!! This hotel should not be in either website. should be removed completely. They overbook and totally disregard customers who do not reserve directly with them.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to sleep”
Reviews.Author: truk3000
Reviews.Content: Keep your expectations low, and you will do just fine. All I was looking for was an inexpensive place to stay, close to Disney, and have some sort of pool to jump into at night. The staff was wonderful, would do it again.

Reviews.Title: “A fine hotel”
Reviews.Author: TVTravelerHaugesund
Reviews.Content: Positive: A fine hotel, very good value for money, mostly friendly staff (especially the always smiling room maids), good amenities in rooms and in the rest of the hotel area. Negative: Our room was absolutely ok, but needs refurbishing. Looked a bit 1980'ies. Yet, everything worked fine. The staff in the shop were grumpy. The food in the retaurant was a bit expensive. We chose to eat at restaurants nearby, although we had to walk for a few hundred yards. All in all an absolutely fine hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Bed Bugs, Bad Room Service but Amazing Amentites”
Reviews.Author: Chantilliscious
Reviews.Content: I enjoy everything about this resort except for the service and my room. The amentities are fantastic, although there aren't always chairs for you by the pool and for a resort, this is odd. Some of the staff is extremey kind, and some are completely rude and unwilling to help you or act as if it's a big hassle. Room service is barely done, and I have had to ask for it to be done every day (4 days) once I have returned to my room at 5pm and it's still not done. When it was done without me having to ask for it, no clean towels were provided, one bed was made, the other not, and the garbage that was in the bin was emptied - but none of the garbage that we put aside to be taken. Great hotel amentities, but the room service is brutal (and barely existent) and not to mention, myself - as well as other guests that I have met that stayed here, have gotten bug bites from the beds. Other than the bed bugs and horrible house keeping service, the hotel is clean and well kept.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay! Great for the money! Super close to Disney World!”
Reviews.Author: CityGirl84
Reviews.Content: Some of the reviews below were really harsh. We had our doubts going in because of them, and let me tell you - I am a snotty brat when it comes to my hotels - I usually only stay in 3 star hotels and above when I travel to NYC and Beverly Hills. For the money and location and actual time we spent in the room - IT WAS WELL WORTH IT. Ask yourself this - would you rather spend $40 a night on a hotel (that is what we paid!) or $100 a night? I'd rather spend that extra $60 in the Disney park itself bringing home souvenirs. Check-in was smooth. There were 3 adults and 4 children in our room. My sister and her husband brought their QUEEN size air mattress with them for the kids (7 y/o, 5 y/o, 3 y/o 2 y/o) and my sister and her husband slept in one bed, the air mattress was on the ground in between the 2 beds, and then I slept in the other bed. Had enough room for the kids to run around in the hotel room. The bathroom was clean, the room appeared to be clean (the floors were filthy - we actually plan on staying here again and just throwing a swiffer in our car for the ride over and wiping the floors with some pinesol before we let the kids go wild) - The air conditioner did have a funky smell to it, but nothing our Scentsy room sprays couldn't handle. The room came with a mini-fridge which was great! Our room was in the North tower facing the Animal Kingdom, and we actually were able to enjoy the 10pm fireworks on our check-in night! The kids were in awe! We had pizza delivered to our room, as well as had a stroller to deliver to our room. We never made it INTO the pool, but my sister and I did browse by it and stick our toes in and it felt wonderful! All in all - there was an enormous amount of FREE parking at the hotel RIGHT by the room. Never had to wait more than 30 seconds when you called for an elevator. We asked for additional towels and received them within 15 minutes of request. All in all - this hotel will be used again by us! Leaving the Magic Kingdom to pulling into our parking spot at the hotel took a matter of 8 minutes! And that was with all that crazy traffic on US-192!

Reviews.Title: “Overall enjoyable”
Reviews.Author: Rosemarie60
Reviews.Content: We spent 2 weeks in March 2012 at this hotel.Firstly the negatives ...poor lighting in a very large room (1 bedside light ) Lots of schoolchildren staying for a few days ...first group very noisy ,they were still in the pool at 1.30 am ,we were on the 7th floor and they kept up awake ,second group were no trouble and very quiet.Fridge small and old sat on the floor when you opened the door it dragged on the floor.Safe was on the floor in the wardrobe so you needed to get on knees to operate safe code .Would have liked pool to be a bit warmer.We also had a problem with coffee machine ,after asking 3 different people to replace it we ended up swaping it with a couple who were checking out after nothing was done. Now for the positives ...room was very large and very clean ,we always had lovely white fluffy towels daily in our room and at the pool.The hotel is close to shops restaurants and Disney.If you like a drink two nice bars with Happy hour 2-5 pm 7-9 pm . Food in hotel is good and reasonable .Would recommend staying in the North tower,rooms have been renovated with ceramic tiles everywhere (it makes the corridor a bit noisy sometimes ) but overall is very nice. Would recommend getting a room as high as possible .We used to pull the curtains open at night so we could watch the early morning balloon flights from our bed.After 2 days we had a new flat screen tv installed .Overall it was a very nice hotel with very helpful friendly staff and I would stay there again .

Reviews.Title: “Fair”
Reviews.Author: Maud M
Reviews.Content: This was the most horrible vacation of our life. We checked in to this hotel on 03/26/12. The first night our room we were assigned was not done . The furniture was on top of the bed and there were dirty linens on the floor. We called the guy and he was shocked and moved us to a different room ,There is 2 adults and three kids. THis next room only had one large King bed. We called the guy and he apologized. eventually after 2 hours of this we were put in the one bedroom villa with two ver small beds for mom and dad and a pull out sofa for my 3 kids. We settled for that for the first night. THe promise was the next day we would be moved to a location that we had actually paid. The next day when we went to get keys for the actual room it had been assigned to someone else. Ok at this point we are very frustrated. Eventually again a late night for us. Were given the room with appropriate beds. Now the room had a dingy moist smell to start with. Well, the shower spills water all the way to the lounge so you must have towels on the floor to prevent this while you shower. There is no vent in the bathroom, the blankets and pillows stink. The finish of these new rooms were so poorly done like by an inexperienced handy man. The door locks appearr as if someone used a bread knife to smoothen them.We had a box of clinex with old or crumbled paper inside of it .I have pictures to prove it. The hotel staff and Management(Carlos and Jon specifically) did well to handle each of our complaints. They bent over backwards to make it right.However noone should have to deal with such issues while on vacation and rating complaint management. Overall if you care about where you lay after hanging out with Mickey don't go to this facility. Maybe in the future they will have better standards.

Reviews.Title: “pillow and blanket are disgusting!”
Reviews.Author: jhoanna2004
Reviews.Content: i had a bad feeling walking to our room because the smell is bad not renovated but they could've at least didn't charge us for "resort" fees but they did it's so unfair.. and the vintage style made it worst i don't know if its really vintage or the hotel rooms are just old at south bldg. when it's time to rest the pillow smells so bad smells like someone sweat dried on that pillow so i have to cover it with the blanket i brought. the blanket has stained and rough. i'll never ever going back to this hotel!! no exhaust in the bathroom too!!

Reviews.Title: “Thumbs Up!!”
Reviews.Author: Melanie C
Reviews.Content: This hotel was very nice for the price.Overall it was a sweet deal on the rate i received.Our rooms were spacious and very clean.Totally updated decor with comfy sleep number beds . I highly recommend it to everyone who prefer a touch of elegance on a budget.

Reviews.Title: “Spring Break”
Reviews.Author: Latoya M
Reviews.Content: Our stay at Worldgate was very disappointing. The pictures that they have online of the the rooms are false advertisement. The common areas were nice but my point in getting a room is for relaxation after a long day in the parks. The first room that I was given smelled like someone had peed in it and the bath tub look like someone had taken a mud bath in it. They did move us to another room and that bath room was wall was molded and the beds were not comfortable at all. When I looked at the pictures I must say I was very impressed but once I got there it was very disappointed. I am in the military also and the mwr recommend a lot of rooms to us but I am going to have to let them know about this hotel,

Reviews.Title: “Good value, comfortable, near everything”
Reviews.Author: DoctorWhere6
Reviews.Content: This isn't a resort, it's a hotel. That said it is very conveniently located to all the amusements in Orlando. It's affordable and very comfortable. All the staff were helpful and polite. Our double room had plenty of space for 4 people and all our belongings. There is a spacious closest, a bathroom with a large soak tub (so nice after a day at Disney!) with a shower curtain, two adjustable beds (which weren't the most comfortable, but were nice), desk, and mini fridge. The only thing I would like added to the rooms is a mini microwave on top of the fridge. We had good maid service all but 1 of our 6 days, and they did a great job making the room look inviting and clean. Plenty of towels, but you may need to ask for extras if you go swimming. The main pool is nice, the hot tub jets didn't work, but it was nice to soak in the warm water. The pool is open 24 hours a day, which is fabulous. I like the little touches which make this budget-friendly feel welcoming and a little more upscale than average.

Reviews.Title: “A great base for your Orlando holiday”
Reviews.Author: Wolf-girl1
Reviews.Content: We recently booked a late break to Orlando with Virgin Atlantic, which included 11 nights' accommodaton at The Worldgate Resort. We'd read mixed reviews on Trip Advisor ... but usually maintain that you should make your own mind up about places as different people have different expectations ... & we have to say that on the whole we were pleasantly surprised. The Worldgate Resort is located on the I-192 in Kissimmee, only about 10 mins away from all the main Disney locations, & within half an hour of International Drive, Universal, Sea World, etc ... There is also a good variety of eateries & gift shops within walking distance, plus a Target about 5 mins drive away. We really liked the layout of the hotel itself ... it has a central kind of quad-type area, with the foyer at the front, which includes a handy shop, car rental desk, & tourist info desk where you can buy all your attraction tickets. There is also a bar, which serves food & a diner/pizzeria, & all of this is accessible from the pool area which is located in the middle of the quad. Guest rooms are located in two towers, one on either edge of the quad, & due to the layout, all seem to have a reasonable view. When we checked in we asked for a King room on the 6th or 7th floor as we'd read that you could see the fireworks at Disney from these rooms, but as there wasn't one available, we were offered a Double room, however when we went to the allocated room, we were quite disappointed ... the room was extremely dark, with no ceiling or wall lights & only one table lamp. We also noticed that the bathroom was very compact, & that it would be necessary to stand to one side of the toilet to close the door in order to be able to access the shower/bath. We expressed our concerns about the lighting to the reception staff & they said that all of the Double rooms had been renovated in the same way & that they had received other similar comments ... so we asked to switch to a King room on a lower floor, & we were very pleased with the room we were allocated ... a much larger bathroom with no space issues & 2 bedside lamps, altho still no ceiling or wall lights. We also had a nice sized fridge too, which was very useful & coffee making facilities. The only thing we were a little unsure about was the fact that there are no carpets anywhere ... the floors are all marble-type tiles ... which in some ways is nice as it looks classy, & clean ... but it is cold to walk on & it does mean that the corridors can be very noisy at times, as there is nothing to dampen the sound. This was particularly noticeable on the 2 weekends when we had school parties staying on the same floor! The first weekend was a bit of a nightmare as the kids didn't appear to be being supervised to any great extent, & having rung down to reception twice to ask the hotel staff to have a word, we eventually went out into the corridor after 10pm one evening to find a group of students sitting on the floor outside our door chatting, & other groups congregating around the elevators to socialise. The following morning we tried to have a word with a couple of the adults accompanying the group, but to be honest, they were as noisy as the kids, when they were running up & down the corridor around 7am rounding the kids up to go on a trip ... in fact one of them told us that we shouldn't have been there as they'd booked the whole floor out ..! Having said this ... the hotel is very nice, the staff on the whole were very pleasant & helpful, the bed was, without doubt, the most comfortable we have ever slept in, & the location could hardly be better ... so we would definitely stay there again ... but we'd maybe check if they'd got any school groups in first ...! ;o)

Reviews.Title: “Not what I expected.”
Reviews.Author: Florida_Traveler1966
Reviews.Content: This hotel has potential, but it isn't there yet. Our first room was by the stairwell which was very noisy with it's slamming door through the night. The tub needed refinishing and during the night a puddle formed in the middle of the entry hall. We were ablke to switch rooms but it had issues too. I don't think we will be back there any time soon. But I do think they are trying to improve.

Reviews.Title: “Slowly being updated”
Reviews.Author: rstwilburn
Reviews.Content: The rooms were very clean and updated, but was dreary and cold. Seems like the resort is SLOWLY updating their rooms. New bathtub/shower combo, bathroom sinks, paint, floors (which were tile & VERY cold & uncomfortable to walk on), and nice new bedding. The mini fridge was old and dirty, and one of the locks on the door was broken. The new items were nice but seems like they should've hired a different company to install them as they didn't do a 3 star job! They got paint all over the shower/tub and the floor. It just looks like amateurs did the job. They should also invest in beautifying the room. There was just the furniture. No decorative effects like paintings and such. Very bland room. The only great thing about it is it was very clean feeling! I'm hoping they're not done remodeling the room, if not, they should finish before letting people stay in it. If they're not done, I'd like to see the end result. Certainly not a 3 star.......... yet.

Reviews.Title: “Wow... Great price for what you get”
Reviews.Author: Esnay A
Reviews.Content: After a long trip we arrived at the hotel which we booked with a travel agent and it was better than we expected. Rooms were large and clean. Lobby looked renovated and spacious. They had two pools and were very nice. We spent most of the time a the parks but I would definitely come back to worldgate.

Reviews.Title: “General Manager”
Reviews.Author: Marsha G
Reviews.Content: The GM Rob Lewis was a pleasure to meet. The entire staff seemed like they enjoyed coming to work! Customer service all the way. I would highly recommend that anyone with plans to visit Orlando, reserve a newly renovated suite. The rooms are very comfortable for whatever you little heart desires.

Reviews.Title: “Rooms and beds were horrible!”
Reviews.Author: Mag5605
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Worldgate resort in March 2012 for one night and we had 2 rooms booked . First of all, we would like to say that the hotel itself was clean and the front desk staff were friendly and professional. The problem started when we got in the room. We were in the south building and we were very dissapointed that the 2 rooms look NOTHING like what their website shows. The rooms and furnitures are old. Minutes after checking in, we discovered one room's toilet did not work (but maintenance did come up and fixed it), the other room smelled like cigarette smoke from the front door. Later that evening we discovered the water in the tub backed up in the room with the toilet problem, and there was a big roach in the bathroom of the other room and the sheets did not looked like they were changed. Not to mentioned the beds and pillows were very uncomfortable. One bed would flip up if a child just sat the end of the bed. We called front desk that evening for a couple of hours about those issues and got no one - the phone just kept ringing. We did contact the hotel to complain about the above issues after we got home and all we got was an explanation that the rooms in the south bldg were not yet renovated. Nothing more. Both families were very dissappointed - glad it was just one night

Reviews.Title: “Fun stay at Worldgate”
Reviews.Author: Jim C
Reviews.Content: I went for a weekend with my family at the begining of the month and we really had a good time. The check in was a little slow but the staff was friendly and acoomodating. Rooms looked like new and were very large. The room was cleaned very well everyday. The food was ok but again the staff at the breakfast were really great. The hotel is very close to the parks so thats another big plus.

Reviews.Title: “Worldgate Resort not a resort”
Reviews.Author: happycouple02
Reviews.Content: This resort is an old hotel that they have renovated but they cut lots of corners. All the carpeting was removed from all areas of the hotel- including the hallways and in the guest rooms. While this does make it seem very clean and is nicer than disgusting, stained carpets, sound really echo's. When you are trying to sleep and there are people walking in the hallways, their voices are amplified and the sound of luggage rolling along the tile sounds like a freight train. The staff was very friendly however we had booked and paid for a room with a king bed and when we finally got all our stuff to the room it was a room with two double beds so we had to go back to the lobby and wait on another long line at the check in to get the correct room. The room was very large and had a big soaker tub in the bathroom. Our bed was comfortable however I think they put the King mattress on a double bed frame because it seemed like the top was too big for the bottom to support properly. The pool area is a basic pool and was clean but they were always running out of towels and could use a few more lounge chairs. The location is great if you just plan on being gone all day at the parks. I don't think I would call this a resort more like a hotel. If you can get past the noise that having tile everywhere causes and you get a good rate than I'd stay here again but I'd check out other locations as well.

Reviews.Title: “A cluster you-know-what”
Reviews.Author: 0906ret
Reviews.Content: Knew things could go wrong while I was at the check-in desk. One person had been waiting two hours as they lost her reservation. Another had a bad leak somewhere in the bathroom. Another the phone and the remote did not work. So I crossed my fingers and stepped up to check in. The person in charge was intently working her computer screen and informing another clerk that she was "opening up" rooms that were being held for some reason. It took about twenty minutes for me to finally be presented with my room key. I could tell that the room I got was like her fourth choice. We trooped up to the 5th floor, tired from a day at Disney World. There was no one in the room but there was someone's possessions on the floor and the bed was unmade. We returned to the front desk and were immediately given another room key. The beds were sleep number and needed extensive adjustment to be semi-comfortable. I did appreciate a deep and spacious bathtub although the water smelled like rotten eggs. This was an extremely busy time for this resort. We used their shuttle to Disney, however it runs very sporadically (one trip back to the hotel at 10 PM from Epcot or else you find your own way back) and it was packed to the gills, all the way from back to front and aisles were filled. Perhaps this is what you can expect at a Disney area hotel during March, but I would not return for a second go-around.

Reviews.Title: “Ghetto Resort”
Reviews.Author: cjime008
Reviews.Content: The place has the look & feel of a resort, but falls short of its potential. The rooms are a nice size, the bathrooms are great, but corners were cut, & it shows. Of the two double beds we had to choose from, one had springs that jab you as you toss & turn, the other was hard as a rock. The tv was a dinosaur. The tub was huge, but felt small because the shower curtain was mounted in a way that cut your space in half. As a Florida resident, I am surprised that the Disney area "resorts" have not yet adopted central air conditioning. Our unit's fan made an awful noise while running. I thought it was about to up & fly out of there. It was so bad that we ended up running the a/c as cold as possible for about an hour before turning it off completely to go to bed. I will let management know to check it out. Hopefully it will be fixed. I booked this place on howire for a one/two star price. (It was just a place to crash after Disney.) I would have been upset if I had been charged any more.

Reviews.Title: “Nice room, great location”
Reviews.Author: Lucylou27
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 2 weeks last year whilst visiting Orlando and was really pleased with our room. The room was huge, had 2 double beds, tv, fridge, hairdryer and lovely bath. Air conditioning was quiet too. The view from our room was lovely too. The room was cleaned everyday and towels were changed every day too. Cleaners were friendly. There was a shop which sold anything you made need downstairs and also a pizza hut which was great if you just want to grab a quick dinner if you are late in. The only small problem I had with the hotel was that when we first arrived the man behind reception could not find out booking (not really what you need after a 10 hour flight). When eventually it was found he told us we had a resort fee to pay for each day we were there, which we were told had already been paid when we booked the hotel. When we told him this he told us we were wrong and we had to pay it. As we went away to get our suitcases out our car we realised we had left our room keycard at reception and when my boyfriend went back to collect it the man behind reception immediatly told him we didnt have to pay the resort fee as we were right we had paid it. Although we were pleased this was sorted I do wonder if my boyfriend had not went back to get our key if we would have just been charged this resort fee!

Reviews.Title: “Best Value Resort in Orlando”
Reviews.Author: FAV2
Reviews.Content: My wife and I live in Tampa and are Disney pass holders. Since purchasing the Disney passes we’ve traveled to Orlando roughly once or twice a month for the past three or four years. During that time we’ve stay at many Hotels and Resorts in and around the Walt Disney World property. Of all the resorts we’ve stayed at, The Worldgate is one of our personal favorites. It amazes us that for the price of booking a standard hotel we can book the Worldgate and get access to all the amenities they have to offer. We normally spend between $35 and $45 on the Worldgate and with that we get a wonderful pool area, hot tub, extremely awesome children’s area with Movie Theater, Food Court, Free WiFi, In room fridge, Sleep Number Beds, Disney Views from our window, recently remodeled rooms with tiles floors and above all else, very quick access to both 192 and Disney World. This hotel is literally every penny pinchers dream. While it is not the Four Seasons, you get a resort atmosphere for the price of a standard motel. The service at the Worldgate is amazing. We’ve stayed there so much we’re on a first name basis with the wonderful women who work the front desk. They are some of the most patient and considerate hospitality staff I have ever encountered in the Central Florida area. Once during a stay on my Birthday they placed us in a corner room on the top floor facing Disney. The view was amazing. You can see Animal Kingdom, Epcot, The Swan and Dolphin hotels and even the water tower at Hollywood Studios. Most resorts around the Disney World area cost three digits easily for a room with that kind of view. The Worldgate just makes you feel like you are in a fancy resort. Many times we feel like we’ve cheated the Worldgate for only booking it for $45 or less. It’s got a wonderful bar area where I’ve watched college and Pro sports many times. The pool area is actually a beautifully landscaped large pool with a hot tub, Ping Pong table and more located in the center of the property. Any other hotel in their price range would allow you access to nothing more than a standard square hole filled with water. The exercise room, while small, has plenty of modern equipment like a stepper and several treadmills. Personally I wish it had an elliptical, but that is only because I use one at home. There is a TV and towels located in the gym. One of the best features of the gym is that as many times as my wife and I have used it, it is never crowded nor has children playing on the equipment. The lobby has a large information desk and an above normal sized gift shop. My wife and I still giggle when we see the tea bag holders. While the gift shop has almost anything you need, the hotel is located right off 192 West. 192 West has all the shopping and restaurants you would need to save money. Located just a few miles from the hotel are Publix and Target. We wish there was a Dollar Tree closer (closest one is on Apopka-Vineland Rd) but besides Publix and Target there are plenty of other stores which shopping at could save you money compared to hotel and attraction prices. Perhaps the best thing about the Worldgate Resort is its location. As I previously mentioned, it sit just off 192 West which can save any traveler money with its unlimited supply of restaurants and shops. While the wife and I love to eat at Disney World, it tends to get costly. It’s nice having eateries close to the hotel which won’t put a hurting on your wallet. Another road wonderfully close to the Worldgate Resort is Sherberth Road. Sherberth Road connects 192 West with Disney World. This lightly traveled road can save the traveler a lot of time by quickly and easily transporting you to the Animal Kingdom area of Walt Disney World. It is less than a two minute drive from the Worldgate to Animal Kingdom Lodge. Sherberth Road never has much traffic on it and is a great way to access the Walt Disney World Resort area. No resort is perfect, and the Worldgate does have its flaws. Recently it remodeled most of their towers, adding tile floors. While the tile floors add a wonderful touch of class to an already somewhat posh interior, they tend to echo. This can make for some noisy evenings if families with small children are on your floor. In conclusion, the Worldgate resort provides a lot of amenities for one very low price. Its wonderful location just off Sherberth Road and 192 West provide quick access to both Walt Disney World and many great restaurants and shopping opportunities. If you are looking to save money on your Orlando vacation but still want all the qualities most major resorts offer then the Worldgate is the place for you!

Reviews.Title: “Fresh and clean rooms, great service, excellent value!”
Reviews.Author: Mark G
Reviews.Content: Wow! We were very pleased during our entire two week stay at the Worldgate Resort. The price was great and the location was very close to many attractions. We attended a function held at their Conference Center. There was ample room for the function and the air conditioning worked great. Parking was free and plenty of available spaces during the conferences. Check in was a breeze and the staff front desk staff was very pleasant and helpful. The newly renovated rooms were very clean and inviting. Housekeeping staff was very friendly and kept our room in immaculate condition. We noticed that even their maintenance staff employee's would say a greeting to us as they went about their work insuring that everything was well kept and in good working order. The layout at the resort makes it easy to get around and the atmosphere is very pleasant. Love the heated pools. The food and staff at the restaurant and food court were excellent too. Throughly enjoyed our stay and we look forward to staying there again!

Reviews.Title: “Decent enough for a quick cheap trip to Disney.”
Reviews.Author: Tom G
Reviews.Content: Just stayed here for a quick and cheap weekend getaway at Disney. We planned it last minute so we didn't have a lot of time to compare places so we rolled the dice on Hotwire for a 3 star hotel and wound up here. This was during President's Week so room rates in the area were inflated a bit. On the good side - we weren't looking for or expecting anything fancy, just something clean and comfortable to hang our hat at night. Overall, the hotel wasn't bad for what we were looking for. The room appeared to be clean, the beds were made and the toilet worked. We stayed in the North tower, which from what others have said, has been renovated. Overall, we would CONSIDER staying here again if we were doing another quick trip to the area and weren't planning to spend a lot of time at the hotel or in the room and if the price was right. On the flip side, I'm not a hotel guru but in its current state I would not consider this a 3-star hotel. Nor would I consider staying here if I had to pay regular room rates and I probably would not stay here again at the same rate I just paid thru Hotwire. Sure the Hotwire price was affordable (considering the time of year) but after the taxes and (let's make up some names for things that we can charge additional for like the airlines do) resort fees it added another 50% to the Hotwire rate. I will say that it appears that the hotel is trying to improve itself. From what I read, the renovations are fairly recent and we did see a handful of staff working on things but its an older building and pretty large so it will take some time. It would help if they would spend some time focusing and fixing some of the small stuff. There's just so many small things that add up that really take away from all the work their doing. It's a shame. Stupid things like redoing (OK, really repainting) the bathrooms and then reusing all the old fixtures. The mismatched colored wall plates over the electrical outlets. The cheap hangers used on the shower curtain. The bits of blue painters tape that weren't removed. The broken room door security lock. The old tube TV's in the newly renovated rooms. The air beds that barely work anymore. Put some pictures or art on the room walls so it doesn't feel like a dorm room. Empty the trash cans in the parking lots. Send someone out to pick up the trash left around the pool. Do some landscaping. I could probably go on for days if I thought about it more. I know some of the things like replacing the TV's and beds aren't cheap so start with the smaller things. Really, how much would it cost to replace the old corroded bathroom fixtures, have matching colored wall plates or even matching drinking glasses. Oh yeah, if you haven't done so already - get rid of whoever you hired to do all the painting.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay,excellent location.”
Reviews.Author: Katmommy5
Reviews.Content: Stayed I renovated room with my allergies it was great. Very clean. Excellent service.

Reviews.Title: “Not the Radisson”
Reviews.Author: frank2342
Reviews.Content: I did not book my stay through the resort itself, but the agency I booked it through still shows the resort as being owned by Radisson. Upon check in, I asked the clerk why I did not see the Radisson name and she stated that Radisson sold it back in June 2011. My stay was for 4 days and the price was certainly great. It appeared to have all the amenities that you would need and the resort staff were very friendly. Upon entering my room I noted that the card slide was backward. The room was clean and we were told that we were being roomed in the rennovated wing of the resort. No carpeting on the floor as I had been used to in many other hotel/resorts I have stayed in, but that was okay. The tile was a little cold to the feet. I was excited that I would be able to try out the sleep number bed that was in the room. I tried in the worst way to get the hand unit to respond to set the number that would assure me of a good night's rest. After jumping out of bed to check the electrical connection, I found that it and other appliances were plugged into a surge strip, which were working, but not the bed. Three nights of lousy sleeping even though I brought it to the friendly front desk staff the next day who said that they would have someone check it out. At the same time, I also mentioned to the front desk personnel that the folks that painted the room did not remove the masking tape from the sprinkler head in the bathroom. When I returned later in the day to my room, the bed was made up and the sprinkler head now was devoid of the masking tape. Could not wait to try the bed. Imagine my surprise when it still did not work and even after mentioning it again to someone else on the front desk the next day along with a receptacle that was not correctly fastened (pushed in when trying to plug my laptop cord in) and a toilet that did not shut off unless you jiggled the handle. Unfortunately, when things like that happen, you tend to get more critical of your surroundings. The bathroom door was splintered in the bottom corner. The shower curtain appears to be too short as water was everywhere when showering. Tiles around the wall in the bathroom were cracked and their appeared to be overspray of paint on the outside of the resort. Signage was crooked in the display cases that were not shined or cleaned and lettering was missing from the display case. All in all, the room was quaint and definitely clean. The bed was bad. The staff were very friendly, but maintenance response was bad. I would stay again though.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely - would definately recommend”
Reviews.Author: elle09_12
Reviews.Content: We've just got back from a stay at this hotel and i cant recommend it enough! Was a bit sceptical after reading some reviews but am so glad i dis-regarded them. Lady at the desk was very friendly when we arrived, room was very big, airy and clean, same with the bathroom. I requested a fridge which we got and a cot which we didnt get but they soon sorted that out for us. We only went to one of the pools but it was fine, hot tub was a bit too hot. Towels were available for the sun loungers, music was played but not too loud, pool was always clean. Cleaners were fab, even made up my baby boys cot every morning with his own blankets. Cant say we liked the breakfast, go across the road to Golden Coral - you wont regret it! Bar food was very generous in size and reasonably priced. We somehow got roped into some sort of meeting about timeshares in return for cheaper park tickets. They wouldnt take no for an answer and when we finally escaped felt like we were hounded down every time we went into the lobby. This is the only downside of our trip, but still we got cheap tickets from it! The location was very good for us, right off the main road with any kind of restaraunt you could want and supermarkets all within walking distance. Shuttles to "most" parks plus a shopping outlet. We asked what time we needed to check out as had an early evening flight home and were told "any time we needed!" fabulous! Overall i am chuffed with our stay here will recommened to everyone and definately stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Air mattresses for beds”
Reviews.Author: liamsullivan67
Reviews.Content: Pool was great. Friendly staff... They had "sleep number" beds. Worst thing I have ever slept on. The floor would have been better.

Reviews.Title: “Value for your money. Family-friendly. Location!!”
Reviews.Author: belman19
Reviews.Content: Arrived almost at midnight after driving all the way from South Florida and was greeted professionally and with a smile. I actually got the cheapest room on Expedia but since they had rooms available the front desk employees upgraded my two twin beds to a king bed for free without asking. I stayed at the South Tower which is the oldest one but the room is huge and everything was working. The carpet there triggered my allergies (i am hypersensitive, not the first time it happens) and they moved me to the North Tower (remodeled) which has tile floors. I was worried about the noise levels on the North Tower but i did not have any problems with people passing by or upstairs. The restaurant is closed during low occupancy days (according to the bartender) and they serve you the same menu but near the bar. I also had a pizza that night at the UNO concession. Overall, the hotel is old but getting remodeled, the staff is friendly and the rooms are perfect. For 80 bucks a night it was totally worth it, especially the midnight Jacuzzi!!! Highly recommended!!

Reviews.Title: “great resort”
Reviews.Author: cheila_torres
Reviews.Content: i went for the weeken for an event, the room was very nice and spacious. everyone was helpful and friendly. there is some remodeling but not to the point of inconvinicing any one, the event went smoothly and we enjoy the rest of the time by the pool. once they finish with all the fixing is going to be a great hotel. we are already planning to go back. i will surely recommend worldgate resort.

Reviews.Title: “AVOID if you care about basic service... like towels.”
Reviews.Author: shantravel49463
Reviews.Content: First I'll talk about the positive: The beds were comfortable and the pool area was nice. Now the rest: One day we did not get housekeeping service. OK, not a HUGE deal, but at 10PM that night we needed to shower after swimming and had no towels since we used them that morning. I called the desk from 9PM to midnight and no one ever answered... went to voicemail. I couldn't believe that no one was working so I kept trying and never got an answer. Tried again the next morning and tried for 30 minutes before I got someone. I've never stayed somewhere that was not staffed at night. The floors are cold tile, and there are dead bugs on the edges behind tables and stuff (you'll see when trying to plug in your charger. The grounds, besides the pool area, are run down and have seen better days. The road in is horrible, the grass around the entrance, the windows are horribly nasty, etc. I would definitely not stay here again, and I'm not a high maintenance person.

Reviews.Title: “Groupon trip - wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: Jessica O
Reviews.Content: We purchased the groupon a few months back for the two bedroom suite. When we arrived, we were really surprised to find it was two nice rooms, one room had a seperate king bedroom with a living room area, sofa sleeper, dining room area, and kitchen with fridge/freezer, two stove-top burners, sink, microwave, and dishwasher. The other room was connected by a door and had two full size beds. There were three flatscreen tvs, the biggest was in the living room area, two bathrooms, and plenty of room for 6-8 people. We had read some of the negative reviews before leaving for our trip, however what we experienced was on the contrary. The resort was very nice, staff was extremely friendly, and the housekeeping went above and beyond. We stayed in the South tower and everything was clean and well kept. The heated outdoor pool was nice and we also enjoyed the hottub! We would definately recommend this resort to others!!

Reviews.Title: “A decent hotel at a decent price”
Reviews.Author: keith l
Reviews.Content: I booked for 2 families, including 8 adults (4 of them 20 year old's) and 3 children. This is my 9th stay in florida and this hotel ranks as average compared to the others I have stayed in (including Disney hotels).It is ideal for families spending most of thier time enjoying the parks who are trying to economise. You get what you pay for. I would rate it differently if staying on business or organising very large groups who would require better dining facilities. For a family visiting disney and only using the hotel to sleep and to 'chill out' occassionally, it is decent value with some positives and negatives. What you cannot get in the hotel is available close by, even walking distance. Those mainly visiting parks such as Universal further up International drive need to be aware it does involve a lot of driving in busy traffic.

Reviews.Title: “Good enough hotel. Bad service.”
Reviews.Author: daniblossom
Reviews.Content: Went over to Mickey Mouse town with friends for New Years eve. This is the first time I don't stay on a Disney property in a long time while in Orlando and I have one thing to say about that-- there is a reason, and it is a very GOOD REASON, that you shell out hundreds of dollars a night to stay in a Disney resort. Let's discuss the property here first: World gate resort is very conveniently located. You are about 10 minutes from the Disney parks and Disney attractions. You are also close to International Drive and Universal attractions as well as the Outlets. Location is great. The building itself is nice, very big, newly remodeled. The grounds are ugly. All you see is parking lots. If nice views are something that makes your vacation better, don't stay here. There is also a hideous giant Mermaid attached to one of those tourist trap gift stores right at the entrance to this property. They sell fake Belle and fake Ariel generic Disney crap to tourists. The rooms are large, very spacious. But they are also bare bones. You basically get two beds (in the double room) and an old tv from 1991. The floors in the rooms are ceramic tile. THAT'S RIGHT, CERAMIC TILE. So get ready to hear everything that is going on upstairs while you sleep. There are no ground floor rooms so you will have an upstairs concert to deal with. I don't know what the people on top of us were doing but they seemed to be rearranging furniture at some point. I guess that is all there is to do when you have a tv from 1991. There are also supposed 'sleep number' beds in some of these rooms. Well the trick to that is that they don't work. So I don't know if they are just the mattresses and these people got em off Craig's list to fill their rooms or what but the ones in our room didn't work. And there was no sleep number beds in the second room we were changed to-- more on this event later. The bathrooms were clean and the hotel itself is pretty immaculate which is definitely an advantage to this hotel. It's so clean and so sterile looking that you're reminded of an assisted living facility. It doesn't really feel like a hotel or a "resort". It feels like you've checked in for rehab. They can't even slap a picture of a wine glass and some grapes or some other kitchy crap anywhere. There are no pictures hanging on the walls in the rooms. It's kind of sad and depressing. But at least it's clean! Only it isn't cleaned up once you check in and stay in the rooms. After 2 days, the maid service had not come by. That's a stark contrast to at Disney when you come in and you have flippin' towel animals awaiting your return. You know, you think, "well towel animals, that's lame". But when you come back to unmaid beds, no new towels and four walls with not so much as a flower vase anywhere, you long for towel animals. Even though we indicated that our room needed housekeeping by flipping the door sign, nobody came by. We had our room changed and in this second room, there were no sleep number beds and a smaller tv. The cooler was also right next to my bed so I had to hear a humming sound along with the people jumping about upstairs. The mattresses were like sleeping on packing peanuts. SO HERE IS THE WORST PART ABOUT THIS HOTEL: THE ARBITRARY AND RANDOM FEES THAT NEVER STOP COMING OUT OF YOUR DEBIT CARD!!!!! When you check in, they grab you for a $25.00 resort fee. Which is of course, B.S. They should add that into the nightly rate you pay up front but they tell you this quaint little story about how Expedia doesn't allow them to collect resort fees. This is a bold faced lie. There are many hotels which include resort fees in their nightly rates. They simply want to charge your card for 'incidentals' and leave a hold authorization they can keep open so they can charge you for anything you bust while you're up there. Unless you are traveling with Charlie Sheen, I don't know that you're going to trash your hotel room. So $25.00 should be all you're shelling out when you check in right? WRONG. They also charge you additional "self parking fees" and "wifi fees" and "pool fees" and it doesn't matter if you use the wifi or if you even had a car to park or if you use the pool or not. You still have to pay them. I had to shell out a total of $50 in fees in addition to my nightly rate. This money got taken out of my account on the first night and on the second night it came out AGAIN. I marched myself to the front desk, only to be greeted by a surly woman who hated her life, and she told me there was nothing she could do about the hotel double charging me and that I had to wait up to 5 business days to get a credit back. When we changed hotel rooms, they charged me ANOTHER $25.00 authorization fee. All in all, I was charged $100 extra in arbitrary fees, not withstanding the $44 in resort fees that I had to pay. The $100 was just from their system goofing up. And this was new years weekend mind you, so my bank was closed. I'm still waiting on whether or not these fees will be returned. Luckily, one of the employees there was very helpful when I checked out and she gave me her card and said she'd personally take care of it. I do appreciate that much. But it should have never happened. WORD TO THE WISE: If you are on a LIMITED BUDGET and you are using your DEBIT CARD with earmarked funds for your vacation, DO NOT stay in World Gate or any other so called "resort" that doesn't bear the brand of a reputable hotel such as Marriott, Hilton, etc. You will find these private owner places are basically ripping you off. I hate to say it about this hotel because the location was good and it was very clean, but they are charging you for services that should be free and or worked into the nightly rate already. They don't even offer complimentary breakfast. That is pretty lousy. DON'T STAY HERE WITH KIDS. It is definitely a business/conference style hotel. No signs that that you are in Disney except for the kitchy Mickey stuff in the gift shop. The kids won't enjoy staying here and honestly, neither will guests enjoy hearing kids screaming and running in cavernous hallways and rooms with ceramic tile. Also, get ready to pay $1 for a soda can in the vending machines, have poor to no housekeeping and experience bad attitudes from some of the employees. The employees in the coffee shop were very nice people and so was the lady who took care of me at check out. Bottom line? I recommend this for people who aren't watching their pennies while on vacation and c an afford a screw up from a hotel with fees and has no kids and just wants a place to sleep-- uncomfortably.

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointed!”
Reviews.Author: Lamota
Reviews.Content: Nothing good to write about this hotel. I booked it when it was still "radisson", but no surprise it's no longer under the chain. i can go on and detail, but its just not worth - find another place to enjoy your Orlando stay.

Reviews.Title: “Almost 3 Stars ... still a ways to go”
Reviews.Author: Yodyrap
Reviews.Content: Pros: Based on previous reviews I was hesitant to stay at the Worldgate. I can say that I was surprised. They have done a lot of work on the North Tower and have completely redone the hallways and rooms. They removed all carpeting completely from everywhere and replaced with tile. The bathrooms are clean, walls repainted and doors redone. They also took the old furniture and either replaced it or re-painted, this include the bed frames. The pool area is clean, plenty of towels. The lobby is redone, gift shop/store, bar and arcade. Rooms are quiet and dark if desired. Many of the problems other travelers have reported are now not applicable to the North Tower. Cons: What do you come to a hotel for? to sleep ... right?! The sleep number bed are horrible. They are two doubles; there is plenty of room for queens. The TV's have not been replaced and there is no decoration. Windows cannot be opened, no balconies at all. We had friends in the South Tower in the TimeShare units. These hallways are still old and musty; the rooms have not been redone, old furniture. However the electronics have been updated with nice large screen TV in each room. The kitchen was small but clean, and nice large table and all the kitchen appliances and dishes etc. So it was small and comfortable. Overall the place was much improved over previous reports, the staff was friendly and on Xmax weekend 2011 had plenty of staff. Sure there are more improvements possible but this is a step in the right direction and this place is not closing its doors with the new ownership investing in the upgrades.

Reviews.Title: “This place was the worst!”
Reviews.Author: John H
Reviews.Content: The hotel was dirty, the rooms and hallways are tile so if you plan on sleeping don't stay here. The room furniture is mismatched, dented, the curtains were not ironed. The shower did not work and "security" came to fix it. The bottoms of the bathroom door was shredded. The security box did not work so we had to carry our valuables and electronics with us everywhere we went. The TV was from the 80's and no batteries were in the remote on arrival. 2nd day here, the hotel did not have enough towels for us. Waaaaayyy overpriced! Stayed down the street at the Radisson Celebration for $10 more per night whice is a beautiful hotel with complete staff and room service.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: Joe L
Reviews.Content: I went with my wife to Orlando for a couple of days earlier this December. We were really surprised at the hotel we stayed at. We took a chance and stayed at this hotel even though it does not have a famous name. The rooms were completely new. They had tile flooring which my wife loves. The lobby of the hotel also looked like new and everything was clean and fresh. The staff at the froint desk and the restaurant was nice and helpful. The hotel is right around the corner from Disney. I believe we paid less than $70 a night and it was a really good value for that price.

Reviews.Title: “Thanksgiving at Disney”
Reviews.Author: Flair4GoldBranin
Reviews.Content: This hotel was nicer than I was expecting based on the past reviews. The room was nice and large, everything worked, there was minimal aging apparent and the grounds were quite nice. One thing I did notice was that there insufficient staff. The small kitchen/cafeteria rarely had anyone manning the area, so you couldn't get anything. In reality, I was really surprised about the lack of people in general. It seemed that I was one of the only people in the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and Fun property”
Reviews.Author: mike y
Reviews.Content: I would definetly recommend this hotel. I stayed in the hotel a couple of weeks ago with my wife and kids and we had a great time. The hotel is a minute away from the entrance of Disney. The pool in the hotel was awesome. The rooms were clean and comfortable. The new renovated rooms looked even better and i was told they would be ready by mid-november.

Reviews.Title: “New owners that are going to make a difference!!!!”
Reviews.Author: DekeShar
Reviews.Content: We recently were invited to stay for a free weekend for the owners of the hotel. We had a great time, We could not have been treated any nicer by the staff. The new owners are truly trying to get this establishment back in great order. They are completly redoing the rooms one by one. We were able to see a finished room and it was great!! They are stripping the rooms down to the pipes and boards and building each one back up into a modern beautifully furnished room. You can't ask for anything more than to have owners who care and are clearly putting a ton of money into renovations. On top of which the management on site are dedicated and really do care to help make this a gorgeous resort. Rob Lewis and Michele Parker are the icing on the cake, they want to make a difference and it shows in many ways. The chef truly knows what he is doing in the kitchen, our buffet dinners were excellent. We were made to feel very at home and welcomed and the sincereity fo the management to do the right thing is very evident. We for one hope that the hotel continues to renovate and bring this property back to a lovely property as the potential is great. It is a beautiful property and we hope to have many visits in the coming year. Deke and Sharon Dekin

Reviews.Title: “If this room was free I would not stay here ever again!”
Reviews.Author: FLalicat
Reviews.Content: The service was horrible! Our beds had little bugs crawling all over the headboard. we could not hear the guest speaker at our conference because they only had one microphone and the conference next door got it. We could hear the conference next door just fine. The lady running the breakfast was extremely rude! Our rooms were dirty. I would not stay at this hotel even if it was free!

Reviews.Title: “Honeymoon gone bad”
Reviews.Author: fldenise
Reviews.Content: To start off with, you need to know that this property has a new owner from overseas that is not only doing the customers wrong but the employees to. I spoke to a few employees that have been there anywhere from 5-20 years and when the new owner come in, he knocked everyone down to $8 an hour, no matter how long they had been there. The new owner has also taken microwaves and refrigerators out of all of the rooms and charges $15 a day if you want them in your room. We were checking in and first thing I see running across the floor in the lobby was a huge spider ( I am very afraid of spiders). They have to change my room 3 times because I kept getting a non smoking one and we wanted smoking (what is on the doors and what is in the computer do not match up). We finally get into our room and the room was nice and clean. The beds they have are the sleep number beds which the first nigh was like sleeping on a brick because the controller was messed up, I finally got it to work by holding the button down for a couple of minutes. The other issue was, on my reservation and confirmation we were suppose to get a buffet breakfast for 2 everyday. When I checked in they only gave me 2 and said the new owners said to only give 2 no matter what the reservation said. We happened to check our credit card statement online only to find that the resort had charged us over $300 (the room was paid for a month in advance through bookit.com). The next day there was a charge for $127 from the resort. Needless to say that this totally messed up our honeymoon. I spent a lot of time on the phone with bookit and a lot of time trying to talk to the hotel to get it straightened out. We finally got the charges reversed back onto the credit card and got the other 2 days of breakfast, but the manager did not care one bit that we were on our honeymoon and missed going to Universal Studios because of all the mess going on. We ended up having to leave with unused Universal tickets. The manager would not even comp us another night, he said that he had the charges reversed and that was enough. Oh I almost forgot the 2nd day we were there, we had a lizard in our room. I do have to say that the staff was awesome (all but the manager). They are very knowledgeable, nice, and try to help you anyway they can. The manager and the owner needs to take lessons from the employees on how to treat customers. If it had not been for the employees being so nice, we would have checked out and went somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Timeshare Owner's Reunion”
Reviews.Author: Cheryl N
Reviews.Content: The property is under new management as well as construction for remodeling/upgrades so there was alot of commotion etc going on. I didn't really mind because the service was excellent and the staff really went out of their way to make us comfortable. As an owner I'm excited about the renovations and look forward to the new and improved Worldgate Resort!!

Reviews.Title: “RUN!!”
Reviews.Author: momsays
Reviews.Content: It takes a lot before I will write a negative review of any hotel, but I have no hesitation doing so with this one. We stayed for only one night (thank God), and still shudder. When we initially made the reservation it was under the Radisson name. Then we were told of the name change. We were still under the impresstion that it would still be a Radisson class hotel. Boy were we wrong. We arrived just before dark, and our misgivings started as we noticed the unkempt and rundown appearance of the approach road and grounds. Lights in the parking lot by the south tower were out, so the whole area was dark. How unsafe is that?? The lobby looked downright sad, with a neglected and worn air. Desk staff were peremptory and not particularly friendly. I had serious reservations about the elevators. The air conditioning did not appear to work in them, and one displayed a safety certificate that had expired in 2009!!!!!! We had a Handicapped Accessible room on the 5th floor of the south tower. The laminate flooring near the door had buckled. The carpet in the remainder of the room was dirty. So were the windows. Water stains on the curtains and ceiling. Mould and mildew in the bathroom and the fan did not work. The whole place smelled musty. The thermostat in the room did not work, and we had to call maintenance. He told us that the only way to adjust the temperature was for them to do it from the maintenance room. What???? There was no fridge in the room. Since I need one to store medication, they sent one up to the room after telling us that there would be an additional charge for it. The security deadbolt on the door would not close. Cable TV was a joke: we only had 3-4 channels. They provide a breakfast (extra charge) which we did not attempt. Frankly we couldn't get out of there fast enough in the morning. And they have the nerve to charge an additional resort fee??? We were told that the resort is undergoing a major renovation. Well good. It's either that or it should be condemned. Until this renovation is completed I can only recommend that you avoid this place at all costs. Heaven knows there are enough decent alternatives close by.

Reviews.Title: “Greate new Renovations”
Reviews.Author: Dbk1661
Reviews.Content: It is amazing how they are turning the place arrown new rooms, lobby looks like is going to be like a south beach hotel and best of all so close to parks

Reviews.Title: “Don't waste your money”
Reviews.Author: foster480
Reviews.Content: Before you read on can I make aware that im not picky or one to complain but what I have to say below needs to be read. DO NOT WASTE YOUR MONEY ON THIS HOTEL! OR CHANGE IF YOUR BOOKED TO GO HERE! Where to begin with this monstrosity of a hotel. We booked our holiday through COSMOS who labelled this down as a 4 star hotel. On arrival we was expecting the "raddison" to find that the name has been ripped off the hotel sign or when actually in the hotel, it looks as if a child has scratched or scribbled the name out on phones with a black pen. We arrived late evening on the day we arrived to welcoming reception staff who were more than happy to fob off the room keys to their latest bunch of well traveled mugs. To cut a long story short, we didnt change our room just once, we ended up changing a further 4 times. All rooms there are a joke, they are damp, moldy, hairs within the bed sheets, carpets were torn, windows dont look as if they have been washed or wiped since the building was put up. One room we walked in and it was as if the floor was flooded and smelt of urine. Make sure when given a room you open and check all your drawers as inside they are damp and smell of mold. We complained numerous times to which the staff looked embarrassed, seems to be a key feature in this hotel, they didnt seem surprised. All this took place within the south tower of the worldgate hotel. We did ask however to be transfered into the north tower to which we was turned down bluntly as the north tower was apparently being renovated and was due to take months. The joke was on us though as during the end of our stay (end of september) we noticed more and more lights in the north tower were turned on at night whilst returning home from our dinner. Pretty much the top 3 floors had someone in, it just shows how they lie and happy to fob people off in order to get some calmness. If you find any problem with your room (believe me which you will) straight away with no regrets march to the front desk and demand a room in the north tower or at the top. However we was finally in the end put in a time share suite in the south tower on the fifth floor which was actually nice. Didnt smell, had a queen size bed, fridge and microwave, both free of charge. Other rooms you are charged daily for use of items. Rooms are meant to be cleaned everyday I think or every other day, this is a lie, after 5 days of being at the hotel and the room not being cleaned, we finally complained to which the lady at the desk would put us down on the hotels list for the room to be cleaned the following day, this however was another lie and it took another 3 days for the room to be cleaned. Bins are not cleared in room, towels are not replaced, we had to complain again in order for some bloke to come up in the night an deliver fresh ones. Be warey of the shuttle bus times, numerous occasions, if your a minute late you will find that the bus has already left. And if you are off to sea world or universal, be prepared to wait for 2 hours after the park has shut to be picked up which is tedious, spesh if raining. I would suggest to get a car if you are able to, in order to get to the universal and sea world parks, getting to disney parks is easy and once inside the disney park they have their own shuttle buses which are in motion every 20 minutes which take you everywhere. There is no shuttle bus to busch gardens, but if you go NEXT DOOR TO THE RAMADA! theres a shuttle bus that goes everyday there from 09:30am which is free, this was useful, just need to show them your park/flexi ticket. At reception we noticed a sign mentioning a resort fee was to be paid of $10 a day plus tax, to which on checkout the lady behind the front desk made aware that there was no charge for our stay there, however we are still to look at our credit card balance to see if the truth was told, --- probably not. All in all the holiday was really good but the hotel was a let down, If youve got the money, go to a disney hotel as you will be looked after and treated much better, this hotel is not the four star stated, everything has been downgraded and is falling apart, on arrival it was like a ghost town, we thought we was the only ones there. Dont waste your leisure time and money to go to this hotel, change with travel agency if already booked to get moved elsewhere, or if youve got the money, always always go disney! Which I will look to do next time!

Reviews.Title: “Please Read & Take Note!!”
Reviews.Author: Pesh_Mart
Reviews.Content: My partner and I were booked to stay at this hotel from 8th September until 22 September 2011. We had read the reviews on here and were a little concerned how bad the reviews were (however know some people moan over the slightest thing). Well all I can say is I wish we had listened to the reviews and acted on it before we arrived. We were told our room was on the 1st floor when we entered the corridor it had a VERY strong smell of damp/dirt. We then entered the room to find a heavily stained carpet, dirty bathroom and genital hairs on the bed. The sleep number bed did not work and when we looked to see if it was plugged in there were bare wires coming out of the plug covered in electrical tape! The smell in the room was unbearable. We went back to the check in desk and asked to be put in a different room, after a few minutes of the lady looking on the computer she stated they had only one other king room, we also added that the first room did not have a fridge in it (we were told all rooms had fridges) the lady stated that the new management company instructed them to be removed from all rooms a week back and that if guests wanted a fridge back in their rooms they were to pay an extra $10 per night! On top of the $10 resort fee!!! The second room was located in the same tower however on a different floor. When we entered the new room as well as the smell of damp there was also a urine smell to the room along with hairs on the bed and a dirty bathroom! We sat on the bed and just wanted to cry! The beds May I add were very flat and don’t know how people could ever get to sleep in them! With this we called our holiday company and asked to be relocated to a different hotel. They did this for us straight away and when we went back down the check out the lady at the desk looked very embarrassed and informed us we were not the first to refuse to stay! What has upset us is we were informed we would be staying in a 4 star hotel and to be honest it was not even a 1 star! Another small thing is that the Pizza Hut Express no longer carries the name “Pizza Hut” and it is no longer listed as a Disney Good Neighbour hotel! We guess both companies involved do not want their names affiliated with this dump! We booked this hotel using the travel agent COSMOS. Please please please listen to this review and if you are booked to stay here ask your travel agent to relocate you before you start your holiday! Even though we had only planned to use the room to sleep in, after all we were in the Magic of Florida we would have never been able to rest/sleep in this so called hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel at a fair price”
Reviews.Author: daniel r
Reviews.Content: I was there with my wife in August 2011 and we had a wonderful time.The hotel is very well placed very near Disney World, the staff was always on hand to help and the room was kept clean.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Area, Good Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Whitey_50
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel with 2 of my friends in June. We picked up our car at Sanford Airport and drove around 30 minutes to the Hotel. It’s situated in Kissimmee which is a nice area. The hotel room was perfectly sized for the 3 of us and had a nice bathroom and good beds. The hotel has 2 pools each side of the building so you can get the sun any time of day, there were plenty of chairs and very few people. There is a restaurant and Pizza takeaway within the hotel and also a shop to stock up on goods. There are supermarkets, gift shops and many restaurants conveniently located by the hotel. We chose IHop for our breakfast which is 2 minutes from the hotel and a supermarket round the corner for food & drinks. The receptionists were extremely helpful and showed us how to get to downtown Orlando which is 25 minutes drive away. International Drive is a 5 minute drive and Disney is 5 minutes also. The hotel was clean, big and with very helpful staff, I would recommend the hotel to anyone but I think you would really need a car to stay here to really make use of the location. This Hotel was booked beiong a budget hotel and exceeded all expectations.

Reviews.Title: “Great Price and Good Times!”
Reviews.Author: John B
Reviews.Content: Great hotel for a family of 4 going to Disney. I just got home from my vacation to Orlando/Disney and was pleasantly surprised about this hotel. I have stayed in budget hotels before when coming to Disney and none have had so much for an affordable price. When we (me,wife, and two sons) checked in we where offered and upgrade to a suite type room. Normally I stay in a budget hotel to save a little money so I declined. The girl at the front told us that if we changed our minds to come back. After two days at the parks running around I decided that we did need a little more space and it would be nice for the next few days to take it easy and spend time at the pool. So I checked out the upgraded room and wow! almost twice the size with a sofa and a kitchen. The price wasn't bad either so i got it. I should have gotten it when we checked in because the next few days felt like we where relaxing at home. The rest of our stay went off without a hitch. The wife got to go shopping while me and the boys stayed at the pool and watched a Disney movie in the theater area. I also saw they had an arcade and some video game systems for kids but we never used them because we where always running around the area to the parks or enjoying the pools. All in all a great stay. I will definitely be coming back here next year with the family.

Reviews.Title: “great location, shame about the hotel.”
Reviews.Author: steph04_11
Reviews.Content: my partner and I booked to stay at the 'Radisson Worldgate', we're both 25 and have been to good a bad hotels so far in our time away. we paid a 'Radisson' price. however at the airport and when picking up our car were told it was no longer radisson it was the 'Driftwood'. the hotel was not the easiest to find as the sign 'maingate' is so small. when we did get there the exterior of the hotel is very run down and not clean looking. a good paint would really help. the man on reception was very helpful and pleasant, however the lady on the ticket desk, very nosey and asked about 4 times if we were married(don't know why this mattered) and when we wanted to have a think about tickets she was rude and walked away. we got to our room and after reading bad and good reviews, we were not sure what to expect. the room was large and 'ok' it was clean, apart from a pillow having hairs on it.(i read this on a previous review so thought i would check) instead of complaining straight off i just put it on the floor and left a note for the cleaner to change it. the bath tub base was not very nice to stand in, but we made do. the overview when booking also says the room has a fridge, ours did not and when asking others theirs didnt either, however some other did. the air con was ok but extremely noisy which we put up with as well. the room was cleaned daily with fresh towels, the bed made and it looked as though is was hoovered. looking back i wish we would have complained to be moved to a room which had a fridge. the pool area was quiet which we liked anyway but needed looking after along with the sunbathing area. the bar was only open from 5pm migel was lovely and he couldnt do enough for you. the girl wasnt so friendly, when i checked my bill because it seemed very high for what we had, she clearly didnt like it. and low and behold it was too high. the reception desk staff were alsways happy to give us a little advice when we asked for it but seemed unhappy working there. on our last 2 days there was a leak on the north side of the building, (our side) so when arriving back after a day out there was a huge dug out hole right near the lift, dusty and just not nice to walk back to. got to the room and there was no water, which only means we had to move. this was such a pain as we only had 2 days left and didnt want to spend one of our evenings packing our stuff to move to the other side. the room we were given smelt very musty and damp and the bath tub was worse than our room, which made me think our room must have been quite a ncie one. i went back to complain and that we would not stay in that room and insisted on better, and so were given a room which had a nicer bathroom, with walk in shower, more modern furniture but awful colours on the wall! a microwave and a FRIDGE. seeing this we felt cheated in our old room. we also realised there was another pool, however, when we went to look i would never go in it, was not clean at all. as always we made the most of our time there, as we do on all our holidays, but paying so much for a 'radisson' when its not even that is very fustrating and we feel the need to review a hotel for the first time, and let people know what it is like. the location was actually really ideal and easy for us to get to and from once we knew where we were going, it is just a shame how run down it is. needs some attention and more atmosphere, especially on nights where is rains so much you cant really go out. oh and the girl at the bar used to pak all the drinks away and turn the lights off before midnight, when.......there were 10 people sat there including ourselves. migel on the other hand packed up when everyone was leaving. really nice, kind and friendly man. our holiday outside
