of this hotel was faultless......we had the most amazing time and enjoyed everything we did and saw. florida is clean, tide and fun. i recommend kissimmee to stay but s different hotel. hope this review helps! on all booking sites i have noticed it is still advertised as radisson worldgate. but its either worldgate or driftwood......who knows?!!

Reviews.Title: “Stay ANYWHERER but here!”
Reviews.Author: jwkranze
Reviews.Content: I hope reading this review you will heed my advice. This is NOT a Radisson despite it's name. It used to be a Radisson, as everywhere underneath the black magic marker scribbles you can read Radisson.... It is a dirty, disguising, poor excuse for a motel. The hotel stinks like mold, our room had a musty odor with an overlay of air freshener. The elevator did not work, the hairdryer did not work, the windows were so dirty you could not see out of them. There was strands of hair all over the bed underneath the comforter, which was colored brown at the top with so much grime the mattress was covered in stains. My husband needed to use the top of his belt to pry the shower on and the tub was stained with dirt. This place is really gross.. Stay ANYWHERE but here!!!

Reviews.Title: “good location good price”
Reviews.Author: daintym
Reviews.Content: stayed for a week in this hotel, we were a couple and really had a good stay.rooms were very clean bed made everyday and clean spacius bathroom the hotel offers shuttle services however we did not find this the best as times were either too late or too early to leave park.to be fair in orlando a car rental is a must infact we ended up renting one. for food couple of mins from hotel there is a huge amount of outlets were food is really cheap and of massive quantites i would recommend this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Radisson should be ashamed”
Reviews.Author: SAS707
Reviews.Content: This hotel does no lve up to the name Radisson or "Maingate." It is old, run down and poorly managed. It is nowhere the "main gate" of any of the local attractions. Radisson definitely needs to take another look at this piece of property. Their Internet listing is extremely misleading.

Reviews.Title: “Most definitely a hotel to come back to, we absolutely had a blast!”
Reviews.Author: JamesWhitehead
Reviews.Content: What a great hotel the service was great, the weather was perfect,the pool had kareoke evryone was having so much fun i recomend this place to anyone and everyone i wish all hotels were this much fun and the rooms were sooo nice and the beds to my surprise were comfertable even more so than my bed at home unbelievable i will for sure be coming back to this hotel no doubt about it.

Reviews.Title: “One of my best vacations ever!! for sure we'll be back!!”
Reviews.Author: soniatal
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel for 9 days with my family. It has very clean an spacious rooms and also offered other recreational activities. We loved it.

Reviews.Title: “EXCELENT HOTEL AND SERVICE”
Reviews.Author: Giselita_11
Reviews.Content: Very conveniently located near Disney, the service was awesome, the room was very clean and the price is affordable!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Stay”
Reviews.Author: Foomanj
Reviews.Content: The hotel I was going to stay at wad closed so I had to find a new place to stay. I wanted to be close to Disney and I came across the Worldgate Resort. What a great find. I chose the hotel because it was close to Disney but I will go back for the friendly staff and great service.

Reviews.Title: “Holiday disappointment”
Reviews.Author: ange44_11
Reviews.Content: We have just come back from Florida. What a great holiday we had , but what a big disappointment this hotel was. I read the reviews before we went and they were mixed, but we went with an open mind as the bad ones are usually overly picky. They weren't!!!!!! We booked the Radisson Worldgate because of the company's reputation and wanted something a little better than our last visit. What a joke!!!! On arrival in Kissimmee, we couldn't even find the hotel as the name had been removed. Apparently it is changing to privately owned apartments. This explains why they just don't seem to care. The room smelt fusty and was dirty. We booked 1 room for 2 adults and 2 teens and were not advised against this. We had 2 beds in the room which were just bigger than singles. Camp beds were an extra $15 per day. We asked to look at another room, but this was smaller and dirtier, so decided to stay put. The mattress on one bed had a ridge in it so you felt like you were falling off all night!! We asked for it to be changed, but this never happened. The bath was horrible and looked dirty. All the furniture was old and chipped and the carpet was stained. We were not told by our travel agent that it was no longer a Radisson. If we had been, We would seriously have considered changing hotels.

Reviews.Title: “run down”
Reviews.Author: jinty40069
Reviews.Content: the hotel was run down and the rooms and the beds were damp.On arrival we noticed a sign on the desk saying they charged a service fee,when asked we were told that didnt apply to us as we had book through a british travel firm...while were were there the hotel was took over and on checkout my husband was told he had to pay the service fee,he told them he was told he didnt have to pay it and that he wasnt going to pay it.....the answer he got was the hotel is under new managment and they would just take it out of our credit card,which my husband told the to try it....which they did £70....dont go near it

Reviews.Title: “Anywhere but here!!”
Reviews.Author: chicago_mattb
Reviews.Content: Hotel just lost its Radisson affiliation and seems to have some very significant maintenance issues. We had constant problems with the A/C not working - the hotel in general seemed to be keeping the temperature in the low 80s (it was 100+ outside during the stay) In sure it was a nice hotel at one point, but now, in my view, a Motel 6 would be better value.

Reviews.Title: “Go elsewhere!”
Reviews.Author: Mrs_Wish
Reviews.Content: Were here last week... I don't know HOW this is a Disney Good Neighbor Hotel. It was our first time in Orlando, but had I known better, I'm sure I could have found a nicer place to stay. Between the time I booked it and our arrival, the hotel was sold and my reservation was canceled. I had to call to reinstate it, which I did, but when I arrived, they said my reservation had not been reinstated. Fortunately, it was not a hassle to reinstate it then. The hotel looked like it was very nice in it's heyday, but it just needs a lot of repairs and renovations now. Our tub had chunks missing from it, the stopper was removed, the fridge was awkwardly placed to where when you opened it, the TV disconnected, carpets were stained, and I'm just glad there were no bedbugs. It had a high level of occupancy, but felt dirty, there was often trash in the elevators and smudges all over the glass doors, etc. It advertises sleep number beds, and they were, but very old and difficult to adjust causing us a poor night's sleep. The pool was huge and crowded, but it didn't seem like a resort. More like a roach motel. (Not that we saw any insects, I am merely describing the vibe.) I'm glad we only stayed there two nights before moving to Tampa to a much nicer hotel and will never stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely disappointing. Run down, smelly, wouldn't recommend to anyone.”
Reviews.Author: cheznee
Reviews.Content: The springs on the mattress jabbed me all night. The carpet was dirty and frayed. The bathroom was so scarey that my 7 year old grandaughter didn't want to take a bath in the tub. And there was an awful stinky sweet smell. Smelled as if they had sprayed something pleasant to try and cover up the bad smell of the room. We stayed at the "resort" a total of 7 days which we had booked through a Disneyworld vacation package and they were already paid for or we would have relocated immediately.

Reviews.Title: “Good -but watch for timeshare”
Reviews.Author: cheryllewis
Reviews.Content: Clean and tidy hotel,i never had any issues with dirty rooms ,linen etc as was mentioned in earlier reviews, we stayed for 10 days ,it was a standard 3* ,probably slightly better from what we saw. The staff were very friendly and helpful, some of the rooms in the hotel are timeshare owned. They sell park tickets in the lobby,but watch for the deals on the tickets -$100 or so off the tickets when you go to their presentation-which they state is not timeshare and only takes an hour -they say,i heard from another couple they were given the big sell for 4 hours. The particular lady behind this ticket desk is not very nice either , when we told her we didn,t want to go to the presentation she told us to buy the tickets at the park then. Its apparently under new management ,if this is the case then priority number 1 should be to send the woman with new york accent on a customer service course an intensive one,apart from her the staff are very good,her rudeness kind of spoiled our holiday for about 10 minutes,after that we thought "stuff her"(watered down)Usually when anyone is rude to us they generally get more than the both barrels back with interest but we had kids and she wasn,t worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Run down needs a refurb could be a great hotel again.”
Reviews.Author: Marco3303
Reviews.Content: Staff very friendly and helpful thanks to previous reviews we asked to see our room on arrival took the third room that was in ok condition. Kids loved the hotel and no real complaints about anything great location has been took over so hopefully it will get back to what I'm sure was once a lovely hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Run down......but staff made up for it.”
Reviews.Author: jessieng79
Reviews.Content: Expected more considering it was a resort. It was previously a Radisson and had changed over so there were no signs on the outside of the building indicated which hotel it was. The lobby was nice. It has a restaurant, a bar, pizza hut and a gift shop. We did not check in until 4 in the morning so the lady at the front desk did not charge us for our first night. I had booked the trip through a travel company and when I arrived I was told I did have to pay a resort fee (an extra $12 a night) since the hotel had changed from a Radisson to the Worldgate. The room was very run down. Carpet was stained and faded. Beds were uncomfortable, felt the springs in the bed. The bathtub was a garden bathtub but was really scratched up which made it appear dirty. The windows had hand prints on them. However, the staff at this resort was amazing! Friendly and more than helpful. My daughter has a scooby doo stuffed animal and some blankets that she sleeps with. Everyday when housekeeping came in they would fold her blankets in some unique way and place Scooby Doo to look like he was waiting for her to come back. We went to Disneyworld everyday but she looked forward to going back to the room to see what had been done with her blankets and Scooby Doo. They have 2 pools. One of them was extremely nice and open 24 hrs.

Reviews.Title: “HORRIBLE”
Reviews.Author: Kneena
Reviews.Content: The overall stay was horrible. I was bitten by ants or something in the room. I complained that I saw a few ants, bu tthe manager was not very customer focused. My last night I showed him the bites and he only offered me breakfast. Once I got home the pain was so bad I could not wear a shoe! Terrible, terrible! I would never stay in this hole again!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, spacious clean rooms...........would go back for sure”
Reviews.Author: Up_the_TICS
Reviews.Content: My wife and stayed here after getting a bargain with Cosmos Holidyas. We normal stay on Internationl Drive but decided for a change of location. We were not disappointed, for a stratyou dont go to Florida to sit around your hotel so this place is ideal. Rooms were spacious and clean we stayed on the top floor in the north tower great view on Expadition Everest at Animal Kingdom thats how close it is. It really is close to Disney ($20 cab) and there are ample eating establishments around too. The staff were friendly enough, there's a taxi firm onsite a decent shop, pizza hut express, a bar and we also got great Disney ticket prices from the concierge (cheaper than gate price). As it's changing hands at the minute I'm sure there will be a few renovations going on but please dont let that put you off. My one little gripe would be the shuttle bus service is handy for arriving to the parks but they are scheduled to come back early so we didnt use them and a 7:20am pick for universal makes it a long old day. Overall really enjoyed our stay and would recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Would return; grate location and even better price”
Reviews.Author: iGareth
Reviews.Content: Hayley and I stayed in this resort over Christmas and the New Year of 2010/11. The resort is made up of a south and north tower with a mix of timeshare customers and your typical paying guest like we were. The hotel is large in size with roughly 7 floors per tower with a shared lobby and pool. The lobby area is clean and welcoming with a well stocked shop, pizza hut express, brews Starbucks coffee and a restaurant also. The rooms were very clean, tidy and accessible via one of three lifts. Our room consisted of a bath/shower, two queens size beds, a table chair area, no balcony, CRT TV with 30 channels, air con and fridge. The beds are 'sleep number beds' which allow you to pick a comfort level for the mattress which was a nice touch. The rooms, while very clean, do show age in the bathroom. For example the plug hole on the shower was rusted but only a minor down point. All rooms have free WiFi access which worked well during the day however refused to work at all late at night (busy time of year so hotel was very busy). Location wise the hotel is perfectly placed for Disney. AK is right off the next traffic lights, follow the road, right and then left again... easy! The rest of Disney is also near by with very easy access to all Disney locations. There are also plenty of places to eat near by with a Publix & Target just down the road, Walmart is a 10min trip. The outside of the hotel does show its ages badly and is in a need of a re-paint but this seems to apply for many of the hotels on both iDrive and the 192. The outside of the hotel should not put you off as inside is rather nice. The resort fee is around $8 per day which we felt was very expensive so watch out for this! On reflection... great hotel for what we paid (£300 for 13 nights over XMAS/NY), great locations, free wifi, good maid service, clean rooms and easy parking. We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: xxhsxx
Reviews.Content: Myself and my Fiance hav just returned from our magical holiday to Florida! We stayed in the Radisson Worldgate, we read reviews online and saw some good some bad, we put this to th back of our minds and decided to see wha it was like for ourselves. The location is fab lots of places to eat and things to do ie mini golf in the surrounding area, if yu got a room on the top floor in the north tower of th hotel you got fab views of the top of Expedition everest ride at Animal Kingdom and you could also see the top of the Tower of terror at Disneys Hollywood Studios and every night we saw the fireworks from Hollywood Stuidos and also the amazing fireworks from the magic kingdom. The hotel has a nice bar and the food from there i lovely, the staff are all very friendly and always say morning, evening etc when you walked past reception. The rooms do need modernisation especially the bathrooms which were pretty awful the bath was peeling and dirty we showered in it because all we were doing was standing, if i had had a child with me i would not have bathed them in there!! Our travel operator told us we we booked that the otel had a shuttle service to and from the Disney Parks, Universal Studios and Sea World........yes they had a shuttle service but the times were awful! The shuttle to Universal and Seaworld left the hotel at 7.20am - it went to another couple of hotels before making the 30 min journey to th parks, the ONLY return shuttle from these parks picks up at 7:30pm from universal and then 7:45 from sea world.....how can a shuttle company expect people to spend approx 10 hours in one place. The bus to Disney was at 8:55am which took you to animal kingdom you then had to get one of the disney shuttle busses (which were excellent) to what park you wished to be at. The return shuttle was at 5:20 pm from animal kingdom, 10:00pm from epcot and then the LAST shuttle of the day is 10:45pm from the magic kingdom (ticket and transportation centre) this is a boat rideor monorail ride away rom the magic kingdom which at that time of night ar both ful as th fireworks show/parade doesnt finish till 10:30 so if you want to make the bus you have to leav the fireworks early. From observation many other hotels had shuttles that ran throughout the day at different times. I realise many families, couples etc will hire a car when in Florida i can drive but would not have been confident to drive over there, also if there is a couple going and neither of them drive they would rely on this shuttle bus service. I am aware i have gone on about this service a lot in my review but i feel people who are not driving need to be aware of this for their trip. I hope this has been of some help to people staying here this summer.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for money and conveniently located”
Reviews.Author: Traveller_Paul1985
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Radisson Worldgate for one week between 9th and 16th June and actually cannot find much fault with our experience. It was very conveniently located and the rooms were immaculate and cleaned on a daily basis. Fresh towels were also provided on a daily basis. There was also a courtyard area with a pool and plenty of sunloungers, a shop, bar and pizza hut express. The exterior isn't the most aesthetically pleasing and the decor somewhat dated, but I feel these aren't details that would stand to have a significant impact on your holiday. The most important aspects are cleanliness and convenience. These were certainly accounted for. We paid £564pp for flights, hotel and car hire for the week. At this price I was pleasantly surprised by the standard of service and hospitality we received at Radisson Worldgate. The only criticism I would have is that some, not all(!), of the reception staff were quite rude. When we arrived we were greeted (or not greeted should I say) by a man who seemed more concerned about answering telephone calls than tending to us as guests who had just arrived after a long flight and car journey. Otherwise, we had a positive experience and if we return to Florida would definitely consider staying again.

Reviews.Title: “good value, friendly staff, great location”
Reviews.Author: jms8842
Reviews.Content: Ignore previous reviews we checked out on the 17th june 2011 and here is what i have to say about it. Firstly it is excellent value for money, considering what you get in the uk for way more it gets my vote on the value for money section. On arrival feeling tired and drained we were made to feel very welcome by the front desk and answered all our questions and gave us some very good advise. Throughout our stay we had NO problems with anything. The room was clean on arrival. New towels and bed linnen. Fresh smell very comfortable beds. We had a twin double room on the north tower 7th floor. The room was kept clean daily, for those complaining about maids not visiting we vacated the room by 11am most days and always came back to a clean room. Fresh towels daily and beds made, bins emptied. Our room came with a/c, fridge and a safe. I thought the rooms were very well equiped considering i was paying roughly $70 per night. If you are expecting world class accomadation then look elsewhere and pay the difference! But for a simple room which evrything you will need is there then you cant go wrong. The pool was great 24 hour opening times and a spa pool which was hot! Always kept clean and tested twice daily from what i could see. This is perfect after a long day walking around the parks. Pool does get busy 9-11pm though day times it was like a ghost town which is great for a relaxing day off. Towels were always available on the poolside and it was always kept clean. We paid for bed and breakfast, and found the buffet (all you can eat) to be very good value and good quality food. The restraunt staff were always on hand for drinks and very freindly. Food ranged from hot to cereal and cakes along with coffee juice etc. We also ate at the pizza hut and the grill. No problems with service in the food court and the grill meals were very good and generously sized! There is a small shop that sells snacks, drinks, toiletries and alcohol etc which is open till midnight. We did the disney parks and universal with the provided transport (no car) and found it to be excellent. Although in disney you do need to sometimes catch the internal transport to other parks for parks such as hollywood studios, animal kingdom and the water parks. You get more than enough time in the parks with the provided transport times. For the price you cant really go wrong, we stopped in a villa the week before which was twice the price and found this hotel to be much better. Yes the rooms may seem dated to some (wood decour around tv and draws) but its not somthing that put us off at all. Taxis are slightly expensive we paid $30 to universal and around $20 to magic kingdom on the days we didnt use the hotel transport but car hire is available inside the hotel. Theres plenty of restraunts around the area as well (perkins, ponderosa, dennys etc) although on the 192 it is very quiet and the grounds are well kept. The only small bad bits were the windows were slightly dirty on the outside and the bathtub had a few chips in it but plenty of hotels ive stayed in have the same issues. We would definetly stay here again, Great for familys and people who want to do the parks.

Reviews.Title: “Kids loved this place”
Reviews.Author: Onedimpyl
Reviews.Content: The pools were fabulous and fun for both the kids and the adults.There was a nice restaurant, coffee cafe and bar right at the poolside. Rooms were clean, modern enough and the grounds were great for a stroll.

Reviews.Title: “Would not stay here if you paid me !!!”
Reviews.Author: maz050
Reviews.Content: This has been a nice hotel at some point maybe 10 years ago it is very run down and tired looking toilets back up even onto the floor cant see out windows as so dirty inside and out shower coming off the wall toilet coming of the wall couch burst they have 100% customer guarantee or your money back well thats just not true even the second pool area the tiles round the inside of the pool coming off the area around the direct outside of the pool the slabs are lifting its not very safe for small hands the hotel is just run down disapointing when you drive up and see it from the outside it doesnt get any better inside and you have to pay $141 for a 2 week stay to use the pool car park and wi-fi its called a resort fee but only one side of the hotel pays it cant work that one out as we had numerous rooms at both sides of the hotel and they were the same so its not free wi-fi or parking and i thought the pool would have been part of a normal basic thing at a hotel never heard of having to pay a resort fee to use it there is a very small gym also

Reviews.Title: “good deal not as bad as i expected.”
Reviews.Author: taffclarke
Reviews.Content: booked by my secretary over six months ago , we then read the reviews on the sight, i was tempted to cancel as this was the first time i took my family on a buisness trip, i am a H&S inspector, for a large company used to looking at hotels for the bugs and things that you dont realy want to know about and allthough this was a vacation part of the trip i did nose around a little, the hotel is up to code as you would expect, it is operated under license by dhl holdings, therefore not a radisson hotel as such. the pizza bar was overly expensive, and coffie machine made disgusting coffie, ( sample sent for analysis) pool was clean sample water sent came back within accepteble levels. rooms clean but old and again withing acceptable standards for this hotel class. the bathroom needs a little maintenance but towels soap sink and drain holes were all clean. variuse desks in lobby for tourist information, use at your own discretion. advice given here is designed to increase revenue ( commision) of the desk as you might expect. therefor not always the best advice. internet in the north tower 6th floor rm 604 was acceptablethrouout stay, you need to go through a sign up process ( i typed in micky mouse and it worked ) south tower wifi noy so goos 2 bars on my lap top no signal on my iphone. transport. hire car a must as the provided transport is just terrible, i spoke to several guests and all said the same. however i never used the transport so can not varify this. small shop on site ok for a bottle of bear if you run low ( $3) ihop dennys sizzler al within walking distance. restaurant. bellow acceptable standards. used once and as this was a vacation my wife insisted we never us again. however food below server temperature, serbers were slow and untrained in customer service. overall i would grade this with a score of 5.4. this is insuffisent to get it on our recomendations but it does mean that it is a good hotel exactly as advertised and acceptable for any stay. gerald clarke

Reviews.Title: “You don't even get what you pay for!”
Reviews.Author: dng1972
Reviews.Content: I read all of the reviews and considered switching hotels prior to arrival many times. After speaking with the travel agent, I was assured that the reviews are from disgruntled guests. I took a chance. I reserved 2 rooms for me and my family along with my father and his family. I was pleasantly surprised at check in and thought I was in for a decent stay. Very friendly staff in front. I had low expectations as I only payed 49 per night with no resort fee. The room was very dated and old. On a scale from 1-10 on cleaniness, the room was a 3. The fridge was in a cabinet and you had to pull it out to open the door. They need to do serious updates. The water pressure in the shower was non existent. The food court had odd hours and even when they were open, the service was terrible. The 1st morning of our 3 day stay, I was told the food court opens at 6:30. At 6:45, I went down and they were closed. At 7:10, I went down and someone came out and said someone would be right there. That someone came out and was texting on his phone and completely ignored me. I said forget it at this point and we headed out. The tub is as filthy and chipped as in prior reviews and the pool is as filthy as reviewed. I am not picky and just wanted to get what I was told I was getting. They need to change their listing as it is very misleading. I could go on and on... If I could do it all over, I would have paid an extra 50 bucks a night and got a real resort. Very dissapointed! DO NOT STAY HERE or you will be dissapointed. Most of us even left with a cold, bug, or something. Not sure why, but when we checked out, we started to feel better.

Reviews.Title: “Worth the money-Don't read too much into the poor reviews”
Reviews.Author: Gill503828
Reviews.Content: Having booked the holiday , then read previous reviews, we were slightly concerned due to having a 3 year old with us. Packed the antibac wipes as a precation! However on arrival, meet by welcoming staff, room on the 7th floor clean and spacious.Comfortable beds. The pools were checked daily for water quality, quiet hotel, no noise, after a long day ou,t bar food and pizza hut handy. Great location for a fly drive. Would definately stay here again. The only thing that lets the hotel down is the poor finish on the carpentry and the loud air conditioning units, but after a day at the parks, you didn't notice it! Value for money on a late booking. Tip - on finding the hotel - look at the markers along the 192, this hotel is between marker 5 & 6. Took us a while to locate it!

Reviews.Title: “does the job, convenient and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: warwicklad_11
Reviews.Content: great location on US 192, well stocked bar, we had room on 7th floor, could watch sunset and see disney fireworks. air con a bit noisy but effective, fridge worked, shower excellent. bed very comfortable with adjustable firmness. on site pizza great for late evening. pools were clean, staff helpful. Made an excellent base for a week.

Reviews.Title: “DONT STAY HERE.... COULD BE NICE, BUT ITS NOT!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Herakeles
Reviews.Content: letter to the hotel Many things I could talk about, porn on the business center computer, calling the front desk 5 or 6 times to get a wake up call cause know one would answer, the rust coming down the front of the outside, but what was most important to talk about is the cleanliness of the hotel room was horrible... there were stains on the carpet, maid service was not the best...when we walked in the room I noticed a beer bottle that was next to the bed... I thought "oh well mistakes happen" and I hid it from the rest of the group and threw it away...It started with the swimming pool, could not get any towels, but little did I know for the rest of the week stay we would have no towels left for us in our room either..., coffee, ice towels or shampoo... even after we left a note asking them to do so..... then no service at all for one day... no clean sheets or beds made,no towels, picked up or left. Our garbage was left there and there was some nasty sauce on the side of the chair that must have been there before we got in the room...since we ate out..The worst is after walking all day at Disneyland and coming in at 1130pm (3-18-11), and not having anything done... when I called the front desk thats when it got worst... the man told me we were at a resort and that they were only required to make the beds every other day ( I thought the resort fee paid for this) but could not explain why garbage was not cleaned up and towels not left (we had to share) said that I must have left something on the door making them not clean it....I told him the"do not disturb sign" was not on the door and was on the desk... he told me he could not explain except that it must have been something we had done... he told me he was sending security up to the room... In a threatening voice... I told him send them up... when the man who said he was security got there, he had towels... and said he was sorry but there was nothing they could do...I was given the resort fees refunded ... which I believe should not have been charged at all... I booked this room because it was the Radisson... a name I trusted to quality service... I don’t believe I have been compensated properly for such a horrible experience .... I really expected more out of the Radisson than this... if it was motel 6 or someone of that nature maybe... I would not call it the Radisson, I would change the name until you can get better quality in this hotel... I have plenty of pictures that I will post....If I dont hear back from anyone within a week I shall post what I have... Thanks for your time 3-31-11 James Update.. Got a call from the GM and they left a message... called back... left them a message with info... Have not heard from anyone and its been weeks... must not be that important so I will post what I have ... hope it helps the next people who decide to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “If you like cleanliness DON'T stay here”
Reviews.Author: chaney19
Reviews.Content: The wall behind the A/C was molded. The room wasn't cleaned properly. Room smelled like dirty laundry, hallways unkept, etc. Make sure you ask for sleep number beds. Could be a nice place if it was cleaned properly.

Reviews.Title: “Ummm...OMG...No!!!”
Reviews.Author: aspertame
Reviews.Content: This hotel provides wonderful pictures online but when we turned onto the street for the hotel we thought we were going to an abandoned hotel. The property is very much maintained in the front of resort but the back is left very unsightly. The two pools were not cared for due to the fact that they were both outdoor pools. When standing near the pool I never could ever smell the chlorine and the pool looked like the "PH" was no where in sight. There was dirt in the pools and leaves from the trees all on the floor of pools. The pool near the lobby is definitely taken more care of then the one in the back. The employees did not look happy at all to be working there either. It's like they all had to force a smile whenever they saw us walk by. The first night we put our sign on the door to have housekeeping clean room. Later in afternoon, I noticed that it was convienently turned the other way saying that we did not need service. This seemed really strange. The second day, housekeeping cleaned our room and when I pulled sheets back, hair all over sheets. I brought this to attention to housekeeping attendant and she blamed the women downstairs whom actually washed the sheets. And woudn't you think that it would be appropriate to spray some type of room freshner each time they cleaned the room? The rooms have wear and tear in them. Soiled carpets. Soiled tubs with stains that will not come out. Their sleep number beds, I'm sure were wonderful back in the 90's but they were so hard and worn. They do not have flatscreen. They have the old model televisions. They do not have central regulated air, they have the old wall units near the windows. They do not have microwaves in their rooms. This is a strategic tactic to force you to use their restaurants. I asked an employee where I could go to heat up some food and I was told to go to the Pizza Hut downstairs and have them heat up my food. The 5th floor smells completely full of mold. The resort has so much potential to be a great hote despite where it lacks at. They could make up for with great customer service and running a cleaner resort. The water pressure in the hotel is amazing. I swear I felt like I had a $100.00 massage. The pressure points were wonderful. The view was very nice if you get a room facing the front entrance. The bedspreads were nice and white along with the feather down pillows. The towels they provide are actually white. The toiletries they provide in the room are very nice as well. Nice large soaps, etc....... Closet space was plentiful.. I loved the lighting over each door as you put the key into your door to get into the room. The business center is a walk though. It is in the same area as the banquet rooms. I dont understand why the guest are charged a resort fee each day. What is that for? Parking is free.They have a nice castle Disney area for the kids that was a great idea. All in all, if you are looking for a sub standard hotel, this is it. If you dont care about amenities, wear and tear, etc... then this is it. I hardly doubt we will return again.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant location”
Reviews.Author: SarahLumley18
Reviews.Content: The hotel was located perfectly on the 192 for Disney, sea world, universal and eating. Also mini golf and shopping locations were close by. The staff were helpful and friendly and the main pool was open 24/7 and was very good. The pizza express and shop in the hotel were brilliant.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable hotel with good facilities”
Reviews.Author: hsmCheshire
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the hotel on April with 2 other family members. The rooms were a reasonable size with comfortable beds. Hotel pools are quite nice and reasonably quiet. The air conditioning is a bit noisy so can be a disturbance but wasn't that bad. The games room is quite good and the fountain at the front entrance a nice touch. The location of the hotel is very good for Disney and the usual attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Worst ever”
Reviews.Author: Shinbone
Reviews.Content: This hotel is not well equipped and well staffed to be called a "resort" or a hotel. There is a pool.. is that why it's called a resort? Room: musty smell, stained curtains and carpets Hotel Breakfast: you're asking for a repeated visits to the toilet in one hour.. I have a strong stomach but I wasn't lucky.. I was traveling with a large group on a school trip so wasn't too pretty.. one day, the sausage was a bit raw.. so made an announcement.. I ate at their restaurant for breakfast.. and can't believe I paid for the same crap.. I TOTALLY DIDN'T EXPECT THAT! horrible service.. and very slow The gym only had 2 tredmills and few weights.. very small.. somehow looked bigger in the picture Please don't go

Reviews.Title: “I'll never stay there again!”
Reviews.Author: JennDNC
Reviews.Content: The hotel pictures are misleading it isn't no where as nice as it looks.Since the day we checked in we had nothing but problems and would of changed places but we was down here at a bad time and their was no vacancies anywhere else and we was already paid up here for the week.we booked a room with sleep number beds got a room with broken down hard beds so had to move at 4:30 am cause we couldn't get any sleep.When we did get to the sleep number bed room they sucked wasnt comfortable either. Hotel was very noisy,our room was dirty and smelled like smoke we had to go buy Febreeze and it was a no smoking room.The pools and hot tubs was very dirty,staff was very rude,Their "Starbucks in the lobby" well good luck on getting any drink from there it is i with the Pizza Hut and they was out of everything but a Caffe' Latte the whole week I was there.This place locked us out of our room saying we owed them money and we was paid up w/ a receipt until the the next day. They dont know how to tell time we set a wakeup call @ 10 am and they called @ 7 am. Something ate me up in the room. And was forced to leave the room for 2 hours because the power went out all through the hotel and they had no back up generator only emergency lighting in the hallways so it was very dark in the room and it got very stuffy quick. Our veiw out our window was that of the backside of a building it was just overall one of the worst places I have ever stayed in and I will not do it again a big waste of my money.

Reviews.Title: “Very kid friendly and beautiful”
Reviews.Author: hazzey
Reviews.Content: The prices are excellent! The lack of rain had dried up the beautiful fountains in the entry way ponds.That was a disappointment because we come here every year and it really is breathtaking.I agree it takes away from what was their beautiful curb appeal,Although we can't control mother nature. My kids love it here. They have a childrens movie theater,3 playstation areas with t.v's built into the walls,an arcade room,areas to play checkers&chess.The kids loved the Pizza Hut in the hotel ,we liked the bar that was also right there along with a great restuarant that also catored to childrens food. The lobby was huge with beautiful tiled floors,huge vases with lovely flowers that brought an aire of class to this establishment. Are you kidding me?Who in their right mind could even begin to be dissappointed about anything?And then add on the unbelievable rates. This place is a steal.At night they light these extrordonary tiki torches that are huge and then they bring out this huge screen and projector and have kids movies right next to the pool. They call it the"The dive in theater"Cute aah? The rooms are average but clean ,some have a garden tub.Make sure you request a sleep number bed as a free upgrade.They have a nice little gift shop,a fitness cener,business center in case you forget your laptop,place to purchase Disney tickets,place to rent vehichles. They have it all.You can't ask for anything more and you're paying under 50.00 a night. Walking distance to all the little shops and a secret route out the back parking lot to Disney that is really fast (ask front desk). I would recommend this place to anyone who wants alot but does'nt have alot to spend. I 'm having a hard time reading these negative reviews by others,almost like their mistaken this hotel for a different one they might have stayed at during their vacation.Anyways we all had a lovely time,fourth year we've stayed here , and plan the next four here.You'll love it,trust me.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here”
Reviews.Author: lissiebeth
Reviews.Content: We were there for five nights a few weeks ago, the website claimed everything was new, the hotel had just been refurbished. Well, ill start with the outsie, there are two ponds out front that look like they are supposed to have fountains in them, they were mostly empty with just a little muddy water, the room has sleep number beds, but they wouldn't soften up past the "i'm sleeping on a concrete slab" firmness, the coffee pot leaked, the shower curtain was too short so everytime you took a shower the bathroom floor flooded, the tub plugger was broken, and paint was pealing in teh corners. The staff at the front desk were obviously wishing they were somewhere else, not very courtious at all, th einternet was down most of our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay for the price”
Reviews.Author: Nikkolatte
Reviews.Content: I traveled with a friend who had never been to Disney World and we stayed for 4 nights from 2/17 through 2/21. We booked the hotel through OrlandoVacations.com and paid $49 for night 1 and $55 for nights 2 thru 4. We prepaid for the entire hotel stay and printed out a confirmation letter to bring with us. I have to admit that I was a little wary when driving up to the hotel. It doesn't have much curb appeal. It needs a lot of landscaping and one of the fountains was drained and the other was dirty. Looking at the outside, you can tell that this is an older property that could definitely use some updating. But, once I stepped into the lobby, I started feeling better. The floors were clean and shiny - looked freshly waxed. Everything was very clean and I was immediately greeted by both of the women behind the counter. It only took about 15 minutes to check in (I had to check the WDW tickets that I ordered to make sure they were correct). I asked about a resort fee because I saw quite a few reviews that said that they were charged a resort fee without being told about it. I was assured that there wouldn't be any additional fees and then, it was off to the room. The elevator was a little slow and there was only one operating the entire time we stayed there. But, this wasn't a problem because the hotel wasn't crowded. Walking down the halls towards the room, I noticed that the hallway and floors were very clean. When I got to the room, I did my usual inspection tour. The room was pretty clean. I didn't find any dust bunnies, hairs, bugs, nothing. I pulled back the spread to check out the sheets and the mattresses for cleanliness and bed bugs. Again, it was very clean. We had Sleep Number beds. I think mine was broken - I was able to adjust it to a number that I liked, but unable to change it throughout the stay. We had 2 double beds and my friend's bed squeaked a lot. We didn't complain about it, so I don't know how that would have been handled if we had. The only dust I saw was in the bathroom vent and around the edges of the small fridge. The furnishings in the room are very dated, but for the bargain price that we got, I have no complaints. Oh, and the room was huge. There was so much floor space that we would have blown up a full to queen sized air mattresses and put it down and still had walking room. That was a pleasant surprise. The bathroom itself was very clean too. There was some scratching/stains in the bathtub on the bottom. Not pleasant to look at, but no big deal. The water pressure was divine. I didn't want to get out when I showered! The only complaint that I have about the room is that the fridge wasn’t very cold. It was old and needed to be replaced. The pool was clean from what I could see. I didn't use it while I was there because by the time we came back, it was closed (close at 10 p.m.). Didn't eat at the hotel and didn't use the exercise facilities either so can't comment on either of those. This hotel at the price that we paid was just what we needed: clean, safe, quiet and close to all WDW parks. It was also close to the highway as well as many restaurants. We left our hotel everyday by 8 a.m. and didn't return until 8 or 9 p.m. so it worked for us. We slept soundly each night and were able to relax when we were in the room. Like the title says it was an excellent stay for the price. Yes, the hotel needs updating and the furniture is old. But, this was not presented to us as a luxury hotel so we weren't expecting that. The pictures that I saw of the hotel were pretty accurate. I know it has the word “resort” in the title and that is misleading. It was definitely not a resort. I read some of these reviews and think that some people just need something to complain about! Anyway, you can stay in a 5 star hotel and still be disappointed - the only difference is that you will have spent more money! If you expect filet mignon but you paid for hamburger steak, you'll be disappointed here. Otherwise, it's a great place to stay if all you need is a clean, safe, pleasant and cheap hotel to sleep and change clothes in as a base for your WDW vacation. I enjoyed my stay here and will definitely stay here again. In fact, I am going back to Orlando at the end of June 2011 and I'll be making my reservations soon.

Reviews.Title: “the worst hotel in the us”
Reviews.Author: mikedebdunn
Reviews.Content: This hotel was the dirtiest I have ever stayed in and I travel world wide and to some pretty poor countries and their hotels were cleanier. Room service that never answered their phone and mistakes to the bill that they blamed on the new person. Please check your bill due to some people being charged up to 30.00 a day extra and some people not being charged the extras. The health department should check the pools. In 4 days we never saw any pool care being done. They have a pond in the back where you park that was stagnant water. No airation to it al all. I would of paid the extra to stay at the parks but swe were attending a wedding there so decided to stay at the site of the wedding. Absolute nightmare.

Reviews.Title: “Poor Hotel. Won´t stay there again...”
Reviews.Author: Luis_Vieira
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the hotel in January 2011 for 14 days, mostly because of the location and price. We made our reservations from Brazil 5 months before to avoid problems. We where four, me, my wife and two daughters, ages 8 and 10. There were two more families in the group, but I'll write only my family impressions. We arrived from NY at 4 pm, after that scaring blizzard, and the rooms where not ready. We all had to wait for about one hour. The manager was a very polite lady, but she didn't help and we had to keep waiting. The room was regular sized, with two beds, one table, tv, refrigerator, coffee machine (with coffee and sugar every day), cold and heat air conditioning, free internet access. The room wasn´t dirty, but it had a strange smell. The beds where small for a couple and they didn't have queen or king beds. So, there was no use in changing rooms. The mattresses where old and the bedspread had cigarette holes in it. The carpet near the beds had a red stain Old furniture. Few power outlets with two on the table (good) and two near the door (very difficult to use). The door lock wasn't very good, because my 8 year old daughter could pry it open with a bump of her sholder (we find it out accidentally). The bathroom was clean, but the bathtub had a lot of hair in the drain and was scratched, giving a dirty impression. The towel hangers were rusty. The shower was ok, but the water pressure could be stronger. The air conditioning was a little noisy and the coffee machine was dirty. Our room was in the end of the south wing. It was near the stairs (also dirty, with cigarette butts), that we used a lot to get to the car, but the internet signal was very weak there. The rooms closer to the middle of the building had a better signal, so we needed to go to the hall everytime we needed to access the web. It was very good to have a Pizza Hut in the hotel, but it wasn't serving breakfast (even though there was a sign that stated it did) and it started to close early when the hotel got fewer gests. The breakfast in the restaurant was good, but expensive. They stopped serving continental breakfast when the hotel got fewer gests. The location is excelent if you want to go to Disney parks. Only 5 minutes (really!) from animal kingdom. There are some good places to have breakfast or have a sandwich at walking distance, but because Maingate Lane is a little deserted, I thought it was safer to go by car. In the 11th day of stay, there was a problem in the room right above ours and a lot of water fell from the ceiling of the bathroom. The handyman who went there was very considerate and polite and got us another room, but we didn't get even an apology from the front desk. I rated 2 on service only because of the handyman. Otherwise I would have rated It terrible.

Reviews.Title: “Needs to be CONDEMNED!!”
Reviews.Author: Henre2011
Reviews.Content: We paid $49/night and believe me it was not worth $5/night, this hotel is so run downed it is totally ridiculous!! it smells, the mattresses look like they have been there since the hotel first opened, bathroom was nasty, tub was full of hair. We could tell as we drove on the property from the outside of the building how shabby it looked, the photos on the website of the interior of the hotel are BOGUS!! none of our rooms looked like that....NEVER AGAIN!!

Reviews.Title: “At best a LOW three star”
Reviews.Author: stjohnar
Reviews.Content: When approaching the main building there is need for some extensive ground upkeeping. The lobby upon our arrival was being stripped of wax and washed. The next day this area was in fine condition. The check in staff professional. The interior of the hotel is dull. The room was "basic:"without any redeeming quality other then it was not expensive due to a Skyauction bid. The bed was okay, but linen was not changed as often as we would have liked. One day the room was not cleaned at all and needed to call front desk at 6:00p.m. for towels and shower items... and these items were brought quickly. The room cleaning was poor at best with coffee ground left (as a test) on the window sill for two full days(I finally cleaned that area). The beige to brown rug had four major spots. The pool area was adequate, yet pool bar never opened, the Starbuck was hit and miss and not running at night so it would seem. At BEST a place to stay with family near Disney and IF only pay a very low fee(or win at Skyauction.com).

Reviews.Title: “Ok.”
Reviews.Author: liz954
Reviews.Content: This is an aging motel, but it was a decent, low cost option for staying outside the Disney parks. It is right off the main strip, very busy area. Shower was a trickle, no water pressure. Our room had sleep number beds, but they had the feel of an air mattress somehow, and not what I expected. The hotel pool was nice, however. When you visit Disney, you're not spending a whole lot of time in the room anyway!

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel for a frequent traveler”
Reviews.Author: Blackwell30
Reviews.Content: This was by far the worst experience that I have had in many years. I've traveled the world and stay in third world country hotels that were far more equip with up to date amenities. The first room we was given smelled of mold. The Second room the carpet was wet. The bathtub was dirty we have to go out and buy cleaning supplies before we put our kids in it. The reason why we stayed was because they told us we couldn't get a refund. So we decided we would be only here for two so we would stay in the room as little as possible and only use it as a sleeping quarters being that there was no other rooms available due to the time of the stay and it was only for two nights. The beds were worn out, furniture completely outdated. Even though this was may first Radisson experience I'm quiet sure I will be my last and return to the Hilton from here on out.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable rooms for fabulous value and customer service!”
Reviews.Author: ritzput
Reviews.Content: Fabulous location, Literally less than a mile to Animal Kingdom...I could see Mt. Everest from my window! I had great view of fountain and palm trees per my request. Small market and liquor store right across the street and have free busing to Disney and Universal. Rooms have been redone, very bright and comfortable with refrigerator and air beds that adjust to your liking. Strangely, being on the 5th floor, every time i pressed for an elevator, it was on my floor and opened immediately! Always seemed like there was one ready going up as well!! The manager was also quite amazing along with staff having one of the best customer service I've experienced in awhile. If available, he can offer you free day hopper pass!!

Reviews.Title: “Renovated older hotel very close to Disney World. Ok for price.”
Reviews.Author: practicaltraveler_10
Reviews.Content: Definitely an older hotel with renovations. Price much more reasonable than Disney properties or other newer hotels. Very quiet and the beds were comfortable. Heater was broken in our room but was fixed promptly when staff was informed. Refrigerator in room is helpful for storing milk etc for a quick breakfast in room. Stores are nearby to buy food. Restaurants are also nearby. Be careful to map out how to get to the different Disney parks because I think Disney tries to make it difficult to stay off property. Signage for driving in Disney parks and returning to the outside strip along the strip was not great. Once that is figured out, it is very close and convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value and Great Location”
Reviews.Author: mbskelton
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel online with bid for travel with Priceline. We paid $35 a night. You don't get the nice beds they talk about on their website at that price. You also have to pay a $10 a day resort fee which looked typical for the area. There were two pool areas we didn't use. There is a Pizza Hut and restaurant. There were also children play areas. The "Scheduled" transportation between the hotel and the parks is a huge rip. They only go once a day. You have to leave late in the morning losing precious hours at the park. Then they pick up before the fireworks. I suggest either driving or arranging separate transportation. Overall, for the price you couldn't beat it. We had a couple of complaints we brought up with the manager. He quickly resolved the issue and even compensated us. I would consider staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Cold, loud and uncomfortable”
Reviews.Author: scherzie
Reviews.Content: I was not looking forward to staying at this hotel because of past reviews however the room was booked for us by a family member. When we first got our room we were not very impressed... room smelled slightly moldy, curtains were dirty, hair in the bathtub and hair hanging out of the hair dryer. We were just using as a place to sleep for two nights so thought we could deal with it. Cool night in Florida so we turned on the heat and left to spend time with family. Upon our return to the room the room was still cold with a huge draft coming in from the hallway. There were kids screaming and running up and down the hall until after 3am (even after our calling the front desk to do something about it and the Sleep Number bed was the most uncomfortable I have ever tried to sleep on. The next morning we checked out early as we couldn't imagine another night here. Surprised to say the least that our room was over 100 a night, I could not imagine it being more than 60 and even then I would consider it over-priced.

Reviews.Title: “Not very nice but it is expensive :o)”
Reviews.Author: JimBuong
Reviews.Content: Booked the Radisson Hotel on Priceline (name your own price) for $50. With tax it came to $64, which I agreed to. When we arrived to check in, we were told that there was an additional "resort fee," of $12.43 per night. We had not been made aware of this by Priceline. This $12.43 was in addition to the $14 tax. The hotel said this was a standard charge that was always added on. If it is always added on, then why wasn't it included in the quoted price? So now, what started out to be $50 ends up to be about $78 The hotel smelled of mold, the bathtub drain was clogged with hair, the sleep number bed did not work, the TV had few channels and was not flat screen. There are hundreds of hotels up and down US 192. We changed hotels and moved up the road a few miles and paid half the price and had continental breakfast included.

Reviews.Title: “this hotel really lets radisson down. rude staff. not a great location. poky rooms.”
Reviews.Author: orlando_exprt
Reviews.Content: all i can say is that i've stayed in cheaper 3 star hotels than this that totally top the service i got from here. you would expect better by paying more but in this case i got worse. totally not worth the money.

Reviews.Title: “Good all roynd”
Reviews.Content: Don't be put off by some of the horror reviews. It's clean, friendly, in a good location and the pool is always empty! Eat out as it is quite expensive, but there are lots of diners and steak houses on the I192

Reviews.Title: “Disney family trip, had a good time.”
Reviews.Author: taylorgsmum
Reviews.Content: I liked the sized of the room, it was clean and quiet. Had two pools for the kids to swim, however they could have been a little cleaner. We were super excited that the hotel said they had sleep number beds, however ours was broken and wasn't very comfortable. We made due but would have rather had a regular mattress since the sleep number system was broken. It was August and very hot and as long as we kept the shades drawn and didn't let any light in the room stayed cool enough. Overall it was a good stay, however expected a little more from what I got on the website and what we actually experienced.

Reviews.Title: “good stay when visiting the parks”
Reviews.Author: oakleyz
Reviews.Content: we slept here for 4 nights when visiting the parks in orlando the hotel was clean and so were the rooms but a bit small and noise because of the airco- unit and the refrigirator...... i hated the sleepnumber beds (once it deflated itselves while i was a sleap) the foodcourt was nice and so were the pools the location was great , everything you could need was around the staff was oke , and a good business center

Reviews.Title: “Much Better than Exspected Would stay again Happily”
Reviews.Author: Spinkyminky
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Raddison on World gate for 14 nights in October and to say I was apprehensive was an understatement. From most of the reports on trip advisor and the cheap price we got (£34 a night for 2 rooms making is £17 each night) I thought I was going to walk in to a dump, but I can honestly say that I was massively surprised. The hotel is lovely, I’m not sure what all the negative reviewers were expecting for the cheap prices but the hotel was clean comfortable and friendly. They had free wi fi which was amazing and meant that we could check our emails and things daily which considering Disney charge $10 for 24 hours was amazing, they had a kids club and other activities. A resort fee was never mentioned to us not on check in or checks out and we were only 1 mile away from Disney, it never took us more than 10 mins to get to a Disney park. The rooms were very comfortable and spacious, yes they could do with a lick of paint but the TV fridge and safe worked well and there was always hot water available at any time of the day. I never used the pool but my farther did and he never had any issues. We used the pizza hut on our first night and it was as good as any pizza hut restaurant but there are many restaurants like ponderosa and shoney’s walking distance from the hotel. We only had our room serviced a few times but each time it was very well done and when we requested some more towels they were given to us straight away and with no fuss. We did get 1 call about a free breakfast for the timeshare but as soon as we said no thank you that was the last we heard. My only little niggle was the gym but it was just that it only had a couple of machines I would have liked to work out but it was a bit small. I would defiantly recommend this hotel for its close proximity to Disney and the I4 and we will defiantly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Much better than most reviews would have you believe”
Reviews.Author: Bigseve
Reviews.Content: We arrived after a 9 hour flight from Glasgow on Sat 16th October with some concerns about what we were going to be faced with after reading the mostly negative reviews this hotel has had in the last 9 months or so. We needn't have been. This was our 8th visit to Orlando (3rd with children) and we've stayed in 5 different hotels. This was one of the best if not the best. The room (629) was much bigger than any room we've had previously in Orlando. It came complete with 2 sleep number beds (which were fab), a big tub (not just a shower tray) which meant our young son could have a bath, a fantastic air conditioning unit (much needed after days spent at theme park in record high temperatures), a fairly decent sized fridge, safety deposit box (which I tried to lift out but this one was secured properly), hair dryer and an iron and ironing board. Fair enough the room looked out over the conference centre and a fair few air conditioning units which meant there was a bit of noise at night but you got used to it and after spending up to 8 hours wandering around theme parks we were tired enough to sleep anyway. As for stains on the carpet, show me a hotel (over a year old) anywhere in the world that doesnt have stains on the carpet. You've got to assume that most rooms accomodate over 100 different people over the course of a year, some of which will be kids, can anyone honestly expect hotel staff to keep the carpets stain free? I certainly dont. The staff at the front desk were helpful enough, the lady in the gift shop could have been cheerier. The arcade amusements were rubbish, much worse than those at the old Rodeway Inn on I-drive. But how long on a 2 week trip would you want to spend in them though? Not long enough for it to be a major complaint for us. Also, as someone else said in a previous review, a firm "No" works when it comes to the timeshare people. The cleaning staff were fantastic and I really want to single out Pam Munson for special praise. She was awesome. My son always looked forward to returning to the room to see how Pam had arranged his toys. I just hope someone from the hotel management (maybe Mark Johns if you're still there) reads this review and makes sure that Pam knows how appreciated she was by us. As for the distances from the hotel to the attraction it actually is only a mile until the exit off 192 for Disney World. It's a few miles more to get to the actual parks right enough. We left the car park in Animal Kingdom one afternoon and were back in our hotel room within 10 minutes. There were also plenty amenities in the area surrounding the hotel. We were a bit worried that the hotel was situated a bit out of the way if you like. Ponderosa, a supermarket and a liquor store were just across the road. Bob Evans, Perkins and Golden Corral and a few McDonalds and Burger Kings etc were pretty close by too. We weren't charged a resort fee either. One complaint I did have (but not about the hotel) was the cost of parking at the theme parks. $15 a day is ridiculous, especially at Universal where you still have a good 10 or 15 minute walk to the actual entrance to Islands Of Adventure or the Studios. At least Disney take you to the park entrance! Over a fun-packed 14 days this amounts to over £100 for parking your car, but I suppose you could use the shuttle service provided by the hotel but we prefer to be independant and hire a car. The hotel had 2 heated pools and a hot-tub which were surrounded by plenty of seating and a bar. We only used one pool but it was a perfect temperature at 9am in the morning. All in all, a pretty good hotel for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Well there are a few issues”
Reviews.Author: virtualgirly
Reviews.Content: We arruived after a long 9hr flight, got given room 514 walked in and and walked straight back out. Then this snotty receptionist said to stay in the room 24 hr and they would give us another room as the hotel was fully booked. reason i wouldnt stay in the room was because u couldnt see out of the window due to rust streaks running down the window, plus it was overlooking all the air con units for the hotel. (what a joke) So she gave me another key and asked for me to look at them. It was as tho i had walked into a pre 1960 room. So that was a BIg no. Then this girl called Lisa got involed. I have to say she is GREAT. Any problems ask for her she helps you !!! she gave us a room 612 overlooking the animal kingdom and hollywood studios etc. so you could watch the fireworks at night. We did however get constant phonecalls about buying from "driftwood" they didnt seem to like the word NO. They say in the brochures this hotel is 1 mile from Disney and 11 mile from Universal. dont believe them, its more like 5 mike from disney and 20 mile from universal. It didnt spoil the holiday tho. they only have one shuttle a day going to universal which is not good. and it leaves at 7.25 and picks up at 7.15 LONG TIME to stay out. But if you go to the road 192 and get on the bus 56 or the 55 and get a $5 ticket that will let you travel all day or $2 each way. they dolnt give change the buses either so beware!!! lol The taxi is really expensive in the hotel. $35 each way to universal or $14 to go to a flea market which was rubbish. But do go to the vista shopping malls, they pick u up every morning for free at 9am and bring you back, so you can get all your cheap stuff from for food, the hotel is rather expensive for the food, we found Ponderosa very good value, this is situated right across the main road. Not bad either. Pizza hut is good in the hotel. the amusements dont work, so dont bother getting the tokens to put in them for the kids. The guitar on guitar hero didnt work either for the kids and buttons were missing from the ps2 controllers. so pretty useless. We had a good time on holiday, but wouldnt go to this hotel again im afraid.

Reviews.Title: “Not what it was”
Reviews.Author: Veggiedancergirl
Reviews.Content: I stayed here 2 years ago and loved it, but something has happened. Stains on the carpet and towels, bath tub was grimey, the non-smoking hall smelled like cigarettes. Their shuttle was always late and only ran twice; and the pick up times were either early evening or late at night so after the park closes you ve to wait and hour and 45 mins to be picked up. The service was awful, their staff could care less about guest service, I had my personal pillow taken from my room on the second day. No one could find it after 5 days-if they were even looking. They acted as if me wanting my pillow back was an inconvinience to them. Watch for hidden fees-like the resort fee of $10 per day. I will never stay at this hotel again. Not worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Not too bad - but don't be picky”
Reviews.Author: goffinsmom
Reviews.Content: We checked in and were assigned room 313. We had an issue with the safe - the fact that you could pick it up and walk out of the room with it if you wanted to. We thought we would have a room with a sleep number bed as apparently not all the rooms have these beds. We spoke to the front desk and were able to upgrade on our 2nd day. Front desk staff were friendly and helpful. The hotel itself was not too bad - not a shining 4 star - but I can be picky about where I stay and I had no objections to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “ABSOLUTELY BRILIANT”
Reviews.Author: MSpearey
Reviews.Content: Having read the reviews, we were very aprehensive about our stay here, but all were unfounded. Staff were fantastic, nothing was too much trouble, and following a ticket mix-up. they even allowed telephone calls and did not charge us. The 3 rooms we had were very clean, nicely decorated and the beds are amazing. The location was exactly what we wanted and also the hotel DOES NOT CHARGE FOR CAR PARKING. I stayed at a 5 star hotel last year and it cost over 200$ for car parking. The swimming pool and hot tub were a big hit with my family ( teens to early 20's). Food is available but please be aware that the hotel is a victim of unpleasant people, in as much as they will put flyers under your door with offers of very cheap pizza, but they take your credit/debit card details and then clone or use the card. Overall the hotel, staff, and location were great. For breakfasts try the Golden Corral or Bob Evans.

Reviews.Title: “Very Enjoyable, exceeded expectations.”
Reviews.Author: LuvFlorida31
Reviews.Content: After reading all the negative reviews, on this this site & others we were a bit apprehensive about staying at this hotel, however these fears were proved unfounded. We were given a kingsize room in the south tower & were amazed at the standard of this room, very clean & spacious. The bed was a sleep number and very comfortable. Staff on reception, were very polite & friendly as were other members of staff we encountered. We were asked by timeshare staff if we would be interested but a polite & firm "NO THANKS" seem to work and we were not asked again. Did not use the shuttle or food outlets, so can not comment. Lots of big name restaurants and fast food outlets close by and within walking distance. Would recommend this hotel to friends & family.

Reviews.Title: “Not as bad as the reviews said”
Reviews.Author: jess108862005
Reviews.Content: I was very nervous about staying in this hotel based on all of the bad reviews,but I was pleasantly surprised. The outside of the hotel looks a bit run down and you can definately tell it is older. The lobby was nice. The rooms were nice and clean as well. They have sleep number beds which I have never slept on,so my back hurt every morning when I woke up although we changed the number multiple times throughout our stay. Someone at guest services also called multiple times while we were staying..twice early in the morning before we were awake. I was not happy about this. Overall for the price I payed to stay there I may reccommend to a friend, but think we will stay on Disney property next time.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, good value.”
Reviews.Author: DrBWirral
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from 2 weeks at this hotel. I was apprehensive after reading some of the bad reviews on here, but was very pleasantly surprised. The location is good for access to Walt Disney World. They offer a free shuttle bus which we used once and found reliable, but we did use our hire car for the rest of the holiday for better flexibility. The hotel is situated just off highway 192 which offers a lot of restaurants, some supermarkets, gift shops and pharmacys. Most of the restaurants in the area are chains, so reaonable food, but not fine dining. The room was pleasant, nicely decorated, clean with comfortable (Sleep Number) beds and crisp fresh linens. We had a TV, Coffee Maker, Fridge, Iron and board and plenty of storage.There are drinks and ice vending machines on each floor. Yes, if you look very closely there carpet is a bit frayed in the door way, yes, the skirting boards are a bit damaged in some areas of the room. Is this going to ruin my holiday? No. There is also a business centre on the ground floor with 2 computers available, these provide free internet access and free printing which we found handy for route planning. There is a guest laundry room on the 2nd floor with 3 washers and 4 tumble driers. Each machine needs $2 in quaters per cycle, but they are industrial size, so you get a lot in. The main pool area is nice, clean, well kept and plenty of seating. There are plenty of clean pool towels avaible to use free of charge. The staff were friendly and efficient and we didn't encounter any problems during our stay. We were expecting to pay an additional $8 per day service charge on check out, as stated in booking conditions, but we were not charged. The hotel is not comparable to Radissons SAS or Edwardian hotels, but neither are its rates. Excellent value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't have asked for anymore!!”
Reviews.Author: ShortyAndo85
Reviews.Content: I like anyone else who read the reviems for this hotel was slightly put off but I, after my visit can only assume these people want to pay next to nothing for a hotel but expect 5 star luxury!! The hotel itself is in a great location in kissemme, took no more than 10 minutes to drive to all the disney attractions! the staff were lovely, helpful and check in and out were quick and easy! the room was clean, it has a safe, the beds were comfortable, it has a tv with disney channels to keep the kids amused. The bathroom was clean and we had fresh towels everyday! its basic but what more do you want for such little money?? we had 2 courtesy calls from reception during our stay. The pool is clean and heated there is a small gym too. There is free wifi in the rooms and the parking is free!! It is honestly beyond how and why people complain about this hotel! Its a lovely 3 star hotel in a perfect location with anything you'll need in your room and clean! Ignore the bad reviews!

Reviews.Title: “Not a 4 Star but nice anyway...”
Reviews.Author: Ikimaru
Reviews.Content: When I booked for this hotel it stated it was a 4 star hotel, when I got there it looked more like a 3 star. However the service was very friendly and my room was always cleaned, fresh towels everyday. I wasn't too upset because I got the rooms for a really cheap price otherwise i wouln't have been impressed. The hotel is located right downtown so when it comes to eating that will not be a problem...you can walk to any restaurant! The hotel also states free shuttle to the parks. Beware!! It does have shuttle buses but in some park like Orlando Studios and Islands of Adventure you actually have to stay there for like 12 hours before you can go back to the hotel...it doesn't have shuttles coming in and out. It's one in the morning going to the parks and another one coming back at night... For Disney is the same thing...it only has shuttles for Magic Kingdom and EPCOT...however from magic kingdom returning it has 3 diff times to return and you can play around with this since Disney offers free shuttles from their parks so if you go to Animal Kingdom you would have to take the monorail to Magic Kingdom to catch your shuttle... Always be aware of the times!! Because if you miss those buses you will have to grab a cab.... Public transportation is non existent in Orlando soooo if your hotel doesn't offer shuttles you better be renting a car to get around!! Taxis are super expensive!! From the airport to this hotel it costs $60 US dollars!! The hotel is 15 away by car from Disney which would cost you about 25 - 30 dollars...and for Orlando Studios double that amount.... Also another thing about this hotel is that the a/c were old so the room kinda smelled...I had to spray perfume around to make it go away... The people at the parks, hotels and locals are super nice and friendly! I had many great experiences with everyone... oh and one more thing...they sell Timeshare at this hotel...if you have 1 hour free you might want to consider doing it since you get a free breakfast and $80 cash to spend...Just make sure you're saying no at the end of the presentation since it is a scam..;

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and Staff, would and will stay again!!!! Cayce South Carolina”
Reviews.Author: tyler29033
Reviews.Content: My son and I stayed there from Aug 21-28 and had a great time. My son is 11 years old and i am a female and we had no problems what so ever. They have pools to swim in, a ping pong table, and other things to do outside. Inside they have a pizza hut and a dinning area that was nice to have close by. We played in the video room they had and it was nice plus they show a movie for the kids to sit and watch and its on everyday and they also have video games there for the children to play (even though i seen more adults playing the video games and these are free to play). The hotel was clean and the staff there were great. When i got there I asked to change rooms since i was a smoker and needed a room for that the girl at the front desk took her 5 min and she changed our room over with no problems at all. My son loved the sleep bed and loved how u could set it to soft and the pillows were soft too, just a great bed (wished i could have brought it home). Our room was clean and huge and the housekeeping staff kept it that way for us. My son loved the fact that he could leave his dinosuar he made at down town disney there and the maid made the bed and placed his dinosuar in the middle of the bed, he thought that was so cool of her. We had nothing touched in our room or nothing missing, the housekeeping staff was great. We even had the front desk call and ask us if everything was alright and if we needed anything, what more could we ask for. The outside of the hotel was clean and beautiful with the water fountains out front. This is a nice hotel and don't see why so many people say bad things about it. Sure there might be a broken piece of wood here or a stain in the carpet here or there but u need to realize that many people stay here and that is a lot of wear and tear on a place. We paid $47.00 a night here and that was a great price for a hotel this nice. We stayed in Jacksonville for one night and paid 78.00 for a small room and that place was the dump, it was smelly, had bugs, and nothing in the room except a small bed and a old tv and u had to pay for channels to watch, so sometimes price is not a better hotel. If u want a great place to stay and that is close to all the parks, food and lots of other places then this is the place to stay. We hope to come back next year and if we do we will be staying here again. Thanks for making our stay the best........

Reviews.Title: “Way way better choices”
Reviews.Author: ltweasel
Reviews.Content: aside from the price, this is not a good value and should be avoided. The rooms are in disrepair, the grounds are dirty and the housekeeping is a joke. I have never written a bad review in my life but trust me on this one. Choose another hotel!!!

Reviews.Title: “DON'T STAY HERE.....”
Reviews.Author: Theyoung1
Reviews.Content: What a joke this place is. We needed a room quick so we borrowed our mom's time share, paying $129.00 exchange fee and thinking this was a world class resort as the name implies. Ha. what a lie. This is an old and broken down slum house. It was dirty, and had no maid service. My son and I noticed a piece of candy against the wall on the hallway the first day we were there. It remained all week. The stairs going outside were full of chewing gum, pigeon poo and old papers that were wet and smelled of urine. Some of the trees were still down in the parking lot from a recent hurricane or storm. The lobby was full every morning with a bunch of time share sales representatives and their unknowing family victims.
