They have two pools, one dirty and the other real dirty full of foreign tourist who didn't seem to mind the mess. Did I already mention this place is a dump? Don't go here, run away fast.

Reviews.Title: “Look else where, this hotel is a dump....”
Reviews.Author: lone_knight_watcher
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at this hotel for 4 days. It was the worst hotel I ever seen. The room was to cold and the thermastat did not work.Had to go to the front desk for the maintence to adjust it on roof. Even after the adjustment it was still cold. A the covers on the bed didn't help. We were sappose to be in a sleep number bed,Got o the room and no controler,called front desk and they said its there look.Had to call again to get some one in the room to look for it.They came when we were out and left a note.Called front desk again aand was on hold for 5 minutes,had to go to front desk.No,our room was not a sleep number bed room and they said we would have to move.It was to late at night to be moving.The exhaust fan in the bathroom did not work and the towels molded real fast. The refrigerator leaked and the curtain was wet. The room was moldy smelling and on the last day there we found mold on the carpets. This hotel is not worth the money to stay there. The best part of this stay was checking out!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Convenient hotel to Orlando Parks”
Reviews.Author: Eleomorsa
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed in this hotel for three nights; we were going to Universal Studios and Animal Kingdom. The hotel offers a shuttle to the parks and from the parks to the hotel; it was a good service. We booked it through Orlando Vacation, and it worked just fine, no regrets.

Reviews.Title: “Dont read all these bad comments,was a clean,friendly hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Tawesome
Reviews.Content: Just arrived back from Radison in Kissimmee...We read all these negative reviews before we left and was a little worried at what to expect,but we can all say as a family the hotel was very clean the room was cleaned every day if you wished staff here are very friendly and anything you are worried about is quickly sorted out.we flew with Monarch and the flight was great no problems at each end.Please dont read these negative reviews!!!! Road 192 is the main road and it leads you to all destinations not a far drive to any of the big theme parks.Pool clean and they put movies on for the kids whilst swimming.Bring sat-nav you can get lost and if you get hire car beware they try and sell you everything just say no...we did get the toll pass as we used the car alot.Have a good time and relax and enjoy .

Reviews.Title: “Would not stay here again.”
Reviews.Author: Paula056
Reviews.Content: Rooms need major renovations, Shuttle service was useless with only extremely limited times to Disney, couldn't even stay to see the fireworks at Magic Kingdom. The eleavators were saunas.

Reviews.Title: “For the Money, was a great value”
Reviews.Author: Dougnnm
Reviews.Content: We spent 11 nights at this hotel. I paid $53/night and would have been pleased at $80/night. The rooms could use some renovations but the beds were comfortable and the rooms big enough. The pool is great and never closes. I was dissappointed at the distance to any Disney park. THe bus service was limited to 2 trips each way per day. Some days the buses were crowed and miserable. However, the bus one way and cab back was about the same as parking. The rooms were clean and the staff was very helpful. If you don't want to spend the money to stay at a Disney property, this place would be great!

Reviews.Title: “Good Enough”
Reviews.Author: Zschaber
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a good hotel , not so classy , not so poor , this is the hotel. It has a good price. Rooms aren't brand new. A little bit old , but very clean. If you stay in this Hotel , probably you're going to Disney vacations , so you will stay at this Hotel just to rest and sleep. Good bed if you stay in a room for couple with king bed. There is a good Swim pool , very clean. A good point is , there is free shuttle to Disney parks and Universal Parks. The shuttle doesn't have a lot of times , but , sure , a good option to not going by car. They have free parking too. I could stay there again , but next time I hope find a little better one by the same price. I recommend if you want to stay close to Disney's parks and pay a good price for the stay. Bathroom is clean , good shower. Personnel are very easy going. They don't have a lot of vallet guys and bag carriers to have to pay tips all the time.

Reviews.Title: “Old and Hot - But the service was friendly”
Reviews.Author: MichaelFT
Reviews.Content: Just stayed for 4 days - VERY HOT rooms A/C problems and many other guests complained of the same problem. The elevators are too hot to be in. I believe the south tower is better kept than the north tower but go look at both and tell them to put you in the one that looks better. They aren't the same. A friend got a room on the 3rd floor and they had to move because the room had a horrible smell. The hotel is old and worn and the rooms have the same feel. Restaurant was fair at best but the service was friendly. The one thing I would say is that the options in that immediate area are few. Don't bother with any of them - stay at Pop-Century. You'll be happy you did.

Reviews.Title: “would not recommend at all!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: flower069
Reviews.Content: I'm with the other writers. My husband and two children were there from july 5th to July 7th 2010. The beds? that was a huge joke, they don't have any queens in the entire place. The beds were full. the buffet breakfast on the 6th was horrible. eggs not cooked, sausage rubbery, potatoes were hard, the coffee was gross. The next morning ( this morning) was better. Another writer was there this weekend as well and put the pools were nasty, i didn't see that at all. they were clean from what i could see. There are stains on the floor, they do not have "oversized garden tubs", The staff was friendly. We had stayed at the other radisson a few miles down the road a few years ago, we thought we booked the same one, boy were they different. This one is not a 4star hotel at all.....two at best. the other one down the road smoked this one. We tolerated the stay as we had already booked it and was tired but we will not do that again i can assure you. interesting enough they show huge king size beds on their pictures here....we were told there are none!!!!! what hotel is that kinda cheap not to have even queen beds....that is ridiculas! Sorry just really hung up on the bed thing.....Oh and the tv's did not get the channels that the flyer in the room said they got...so lets recap....full size beds for two adults to sllep in with 70's bedspreads, no tv channels, the food was horrible.....I'm thinking NO

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't have been better”
Reviews.Author: BigKahunaRon
Reviews.Content: Had a reservation at another Radisson for the next night for three nights, but they could not get us in when we decided to arrive a night early, so booked the Radisson Resort Worldgate instead. Arrived about midnight, but check-in was friendly, quick and efficient. Upon arriving at our room, gave it the check-over and was extremely impressed with the cleanness of the room. Housekeeping had done an amazing job. I could not find anything to fault. Sleep number bed was great after setting to the setting comfortable for me. Bed linens ere very crisp and comfortable. As a Travel Agent, I try to be very picky because I put my reputation on the line when recommending a hotel property to a valued client. I will not hesitate to recommend this hotel. The next morning, had a short time to quickly walk around and see the facility, looked well laid out and clean. Unfortunately, had to head out to attend a conference, would liked to have spent more time.

Reviews.Title: “Would not recommend it!”
Reviews.Author: trishlen042
Reviews.Content: My family and I booked this hotel on Tripadvisor for our trip to Disney. When we got to the hotel the lobby was hot, the elevator was hot, and the hallways were hot. The first room we were given felt very damp, we complained and were given another room, but the drain in the bathtub was clogged so badly they had to send someone up to clear it. I complained again and was given a third room which had a strong cigarette smell, and it was supposed to be non-smoking. I understand this was not their fault and and given a fourth room, which was better. I tried to get my money back and find another hotel but they said I reserved the room through a third party and could not refund me my money. I have to say the manager Gia was great and the rest of our stay was bearable. The staff was great, but the hotel needs renovating badly. I would definitely not recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly Surprised”
Reviews.Author: JJPigg06
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews on here, I reluctantly booked a week at the Radisson. I was very nervous that we were in for a miserable week, but the price was too good to pass up! With a military discount, we were able to get the room for less than $250 for the week. I figured we were going to spend most of our time at Disney, so it was worth the risk. Luckily, it worked out in our favor as the Radisson was amazing! The accommodations were very luxurious. The bedding and decor was very modern, and every thing was very clean. The bed was crazy comfortable, and felt amazing to sink into after a long day at the theme parks. The pools on site were always quiet and very clean. The tiki bar area had a nice relaxing atmosphere. One annoying thing was that house keeping did not come during our stay. Since this is set up as a time-share resort, they assume people will clean up after themselves. It does kind of suck, however, if you are staying in the hotel rooms. We just asked for towel service every day, and kept the place as tidy as we could. The only other complaint I had about out stay was that there was an alarm went off in the room next to ours every morning at 5 a.m.. We had to call down to the front desk every morning to ask them to come up and turn it off, so we could sleep. The shuttle service they offered was great! It was easy to use, and saved a lot of time and money. There are 3 or 4 scheduled pick ups a day that take you to Disney, and then 3 or 4 return times. These are scheduled times, and not suggestions. This isn’t a taxi service, so you need to make sure that you arrive at least 10 or 15 minutes before the shuttle leaves so that you aren’t left behind. Don’t get mad at the driver if you are late and he doesn’t wait for you. It is actually rude of you to expect him to considering you are then keeping every one else from getting on with their day. We did not eat at the restaurants, or at the Pizza Hut Express, but it all smelled amazing. I want to address people’s complaints about the Pizza Hut Express. Please note the EXPRESS at the end of the name. Yes, prices are higher, but you get your pizza faster. We were not in a hurry, so we ordered delivery from a Pizza Hut and got it at the regular rates. Don’t complain about extra services that are offered! This hotel is right in the heart of every thing. There are probably 40 restaurants within walking distance, and grocery stores are only a 3 minute drive away. For a busy go-go-go vacation like Disney, this is the perfect place!

Reviews.Title: “High quality for a low price!!”
Reviews.Author: SmartcookieArgentina
Reviews.Content: My husband and I loved our stay at the Radisson World Gate Resort. It felt as though we were on a tropical island. First of all..the staff were amazingly attentive..Our rooms had the most comfortable beds of any 5 star hotel. ..and the bathrooms were huge!! We LOVED the junior suite and will book those rooms again next time. In addition we had a choice of two pool areas. The main one is huge.with a Tiki bar and ..and a cafe. The smaller one ..near our tower.. feels very cozy and private. My family and I also loved the location..set back off of the main highway..and oh..so quiet. My husband and I along with our extended family and friends will never book any other hotel. We plan on going back again this fall. !!

Reviews.Title: “Had a great time”
Reviews.Author: teeni300
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Radisson for about a week while we were visiting friends and family. i found everything there to be wonderful. The rooms were very clean. The staff was so nice and helped us with anything they could. The pool area was so nice to sit by, I must say i can't wait to go back and stay again. we have recommend this hotel to our friends and family we loved it so much

Reviews.Title: “Not that bad.”
Reviews.Author: Velouaaj
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel with friends for about a week, and while it wasn't stellar it wasn't terrible either. Pros: Whoever cleaned our room was fantastic. Despite the huge mess we'd often leave whenever we got back to our room at the end of the day it always looked perfect and orderly. Free shuttle service to Universal Studios, Seaworld, and Disney world. Daily breakfast buffet. Sleep number beds. Helpful staff. had a pool and hot tub. Cons: Some maintenance issues. Some pieces of tiling on the counter in our room were loose and would fall off. The floor of the tub looked wretched -- as though they had sanded it down to paint it after having rust issues and just.. forgotten to paint it. The lock on the bathroom door was broken. Seating in the hot tub seemed like it was falling apart (very gritty and sandy feeling). The last two days we were there apparently their debit and credit machines were down in the food court and restaurant which was extremely inconvenient since we'd used up all of our American cash by then. So no on-site food for us unless we wanted to take out more American cash. No complimentary breakfast, the buffet was about 10 bucks per person. The shuttle service seemed a bit confused. There were specific pick up points but often times buses in the pick up points to either side would take you to your hotel too (except then sometimes they wouldn't). Once our bus went from a hotel literally a block from our own, to two miles out of town to a different hotel before taking us back to ours, which was quite odd and inconvenient. Only one usable computer in the business center. About the Area: Some cheap gift shops nearby if that's your thing and a small supermarket a few blocks away. There's an Ihop and McDonalds just up the road, but overall dining in this area is pretty impoverished. There are a ton of steak houses in the area, but really nothing else (I believe there was one very rundown looking Indian restaurant). If you have diverse food tastes you'll be out of luck without a rental car and map. Quite far from most shopping and nightlife. Overall, I would not be against staying here again, but it wasn't very impressive so I'd probably look elsewhere first. It was good enough for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Please do not book this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Florida923
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in many radissons in the states, this is the worst. After moving rooms 3 times the room was still very poor. The decor was shabby,ceilings stained, skirting boards missing, dirty, the bed linen was poor quality, the pillows smelt. As you drive up the grounds are not very inviting, The hotel from the outside is dirty, The hotel throughout had a smell of dampness and just a general unclean feel. We moved after 2 nights to a much better cleaner hotel and can now enjoy our holiday in a nice clean hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff in a run down hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Someboy1910
Reviews.Content: The outside of the hotel manages to create varied opinions dependant on where you look. It has a nice water feature at the front but if you look away from the entrance you can see the grimey walls and windows. The rooms are adequetly sized but are greatly in need of renovation and out of the three rooms we tried, all had a memento from previous guests with hair left in the bed sheets, bath and floor. The 1980's tv was also a drawback. The saving grace for the hotel is it's staff, they were very friendly and helpful. Had it not been for these friendly people we would have moved to another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Stay away!”
Reviews.Author: cober6711
Reviews.Content: I went here for my 21st birthday, and it was awful, just awful. For the most part, the service sucked, except for the lady who checked me in and gave me a new room instead of an old one, and also for the lady who checked me out when I abruptly left on my second day due to my bad experience. This hotel is poorly maintained. The room itself was somewhat clean although very stuffy and smelly, and the pools were nasty and full of dead bees, wasps, hornets, and other nasty insects. The take-out counter was out of products to make pizza! Not acceptable for a 3 star hotel. DO NOT USE THEIR 'GYPSY' TAXI SERVICE (Adriatic Transportation). Their service was bad and overpriced. I had to go to a nearby grocery store by taxi and for whatever reason they had to change drivers along the way, which took 10 minutes in itself. I ended up taking a regular Mears taxi back, which cost a lot less and was a lot faster! Beware that the front desk won't call one of these for you, so you'll have to call it yourself! I got stuck in one of the very hot elevators for 5 minutes, before forcing the door open. The final straw was when a huge leak started in the hallway; there was water teaming down from the ceiling, and at this point I wanted OUT. The very nice lady at the front desk understood my frustration, and after I called Priceline to inform them of this unsatisfactory stay, I was able to move to another hotel and get a refund for the remainder of my stay, and at that point I booked alternate accomodations at the Hyatt Regency Grand Cypress (an EXCELLENT hotel that makes this place look like the filthiest rat hole ever!) I called a Mears cab, and got away from this place as fast as I could! Management would not return calls or emails of complaint, and I only got somewhere after using a complaint website that sent an email to them every time someone looked at the complaint, at which point they begged me to stop the emails. I ended up getting almost all my money back. My point: STAY AWAY! Spend a few dollars more and you will get something much, much better!

Reviews.Title: “you pay for what you get”
Reviews.Author: AgapeLuv
Reviews.Content: I paid for 4 nights, the stay was so terrible I left on the third. This place needs a major cleaning. Bathroom was disgusting & carpet was nasty. The cleaning staff left toys in the room from the previous resident & did not bother to vacuum under the beds. Strands of hair from every nationality were stuck in bed spreads, left in the bathroom & on even in the linen (thank God I brought my own). Had I known what I was buying, (the pics online are deceiving) I would have gladly paid more money for a comfortable rest. Yes, bugs were biting. My teens & I were always on alert to keep my 2 year old from walking bare feet, sitting on or even falling on the carpet. Mgmt needs to bring in a second set of eyes toidentify & clean all the grime and dirt they obviously cannot see. I definitely would not recommend this place to ANYONE.

Reviews.Title: “it was okay”
Reviews.Author: geque1392
Reviews.Content: The good things first. The room was clean and the staff was friendly. The pool was heated but don't open your eyes underwater without goggles. The hotel is located near many chain restaurants so you don't have to eat in the pricey hotel. Since when is a medium cheese pizza from pizza hut worth 12 dollars. I don't know why we only got 3 wash cloths a day especially since we clearly checked in with 4 people and the cleaning lady saw all 4 of us almost everyday. The shuttle service is unreliable at best. And be careful because they will change the schedule on you as they did on us without notice. You may end up having to take a cab back from the park or worse. When they did change the schedule on us on April 1rst, the hotel staff left us outside wating for the bus for 30 minutes before they called cars to take all 50 people to the parks. One of the drivers actually told us that the schedule had changed and gave us a copy of the new schedule. Hotel staff never mentioned it. Be leary of the shuttle service. We stayed there for 6 nights. Room was cool for the price, but next time I am staying on disney. I'll pay a little more for the comfort.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Good Place”
Reviews.Author: reececup18
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Radisson Resort Worldgate. This hotel in all I would say it was a average hotel. Our room was clean the beds were comfortable and the staff was nice. The only negative things that I would say is the bathroom is too small and the tub floor is peeling a little, but the shower head flow was great. The savannah Grill resturant in the lobby area had great breakfast. The hotel is well kept up for the age of it. I would stay again and recommed it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Pleased with the Radisson Worldgate”
Reviews.Author: SunshineEastCoast
Reviews.Content: My sister and I spent 8 nights at the hotel in early March and we were pleased with the hotel and service. I have to say I was aprehensive after reading some of the negative reviews on trip advisor before I left for my trip but I tell you very honestly this hotel was a steal for the rate we got it for ($59.00 per night). I booked it through a vacation website. I am a very particular person and would never be able to stay in a dirty room/hotel. The rooms are definitely older and in need of upgrade but not dirty. The carpet looked fairly new which to me really counts because I cannot stand dirty carpet. . The rooms are like many hotels-after wear and tear they get run down. However, for the time spent in a room while on vacation they work. The bathroom was clean for showering and the bedding clean and comfortable for sleeping. The main pool is absolutely beautiful. Always nice music playing, tiki's lit at night, plenty of lounge chairs, etc. I also liked being off Irlo Bronson Memorial Highway where there is lots of restaurants and Disney is real close. I would definitely stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible Experience”
Reviews.Author: gottalovehotels
Reviews.Content: Older hotel in need of renovations and a thorough cleaning. Hotel had booked our stay on the wrong dates, and had billed my credit card for a no-show upon our arrival, and we had no room. When we finally got our room booked, we were shuttled off to a timeshare presentation by the Driftwood Resort people in the building who attempted all measures short of a hostage situation to force us into purchasing a timeshare at the hotel (very uncomfortable). Our room (top floor) was clean in the same sense that a teenager would say that his room was "clean", and there was significant mildew in the grout in the bathroom. We had sleep number beds in our rooms (we did not find them comfortable, but some people do). The soda machines in the hall were out of order, but still took my money. Leaves and debris seemed to only be cleared from the pools every second day (not very inviting). Front desk staff and timeshare desk staff were NOT helpful and service in general was terrible. My primary recommendation if you do use this hotel is to STAY AWAY from the DRIFTWOOD resort people and DO NOT give the timeshare people your credit card number (or you too will end up with unauthorized charges on your account... when I called back to question the charges, I was told that these charges would be my word against theirs. Does this sound like a reputable facility to you??????)

Reviews.Title: “Radisson was awesome!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Dale1969canada
Reviews.Content: This resort was awesome!! very good rates, clean and roomy!! DO NOT READ THE NEGATIVE REMARKS!! This hotel was great!!

Reviews.Title: “good clean hotel, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: SENSfan0
Reviews.Content: My wife and kids stayed at this hotel for 6 nights and we had our room on the first floor of the north tower. My in-laws also stayed there on the same floor. We were terrified at first because of all the terrible review. We enjoyed our stay at this hotel. I would recommend it to anyone. The black lady at the Pizza Hut was not giving good service and I could not get internet with my laptop in the room, only in the lobby. Aside from that, the pool area is gorgeous and it really is not as bad as they write about on here. I think people are too picky and complain a lot. We thought it was good for the price. We had to go on the second floor to do laundry and we did notice a smell in the hallways so it may be that other people's experiences were different. The shuttles to Disney parks were excellent and the drivers were all very nice to us. The front desk staff were very friendly to us. Our cleaner "Jawanda" was also very nice and had a great smile. The restaurant has a very good buffet breakfast too. If you are taking a family trip to Disney and looking to save money but want to stay at a reasonable place, this is fine! There are NO BUGS!

Reviews.Title: “Dirty and gross!!!!!!!! Hotel with many problems”
Reviews.Author: CONNIEANDTERRYFAMILY
Reviews.Content: Stayed with my family here for one night even though we paid for three night stay.Our room had so much mold and mildew that my kids got sick after being in room for only five minutes.After complaining to front desk was given another room which was infested with bugs.also massive dirt and grime in our bathroom tub.Was finally given a third room after a four hour wait and finally found one that was fair enough to sleep.The staff were HORRIBLE!!!!! They treated us like we done something wrong!! Also stay away from the hotel restaurant.Overpriced and subpar!!!! Rude waitstaff!!! I cant see how a place like this can stay in business.Later found out its not the Radisson Brand after all! Would not stay in a dump like this for free even.Ruined are first day in florida thats for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Sleep Number Comfort”
Reviews.Author: EarlP
Reviews.Content: If you sleep on a Sleep Number bed, you will enjoy the Raddison. We stay there when just the two of us travel to Orlando because of the Sleep Number bed, but the facility and staff also make the stay a little better. Also, if you're military, you can't beat their nightly rate.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Comfortable Stay”
Reviews.Author: ips28
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this resort for three nights (part of their disney package along with resport preview) in Jan 2010. I didn't find any issues as mentioned in some of the negative reviews. Stay was very comfortable, staff was really very cordial. Free shuttle to disney/universal parks is a bonus along with very cordial shuttle crew. They were really very economical while going to other attractions also. Nice pizza hut express outlet and Savannah Grill, awesome breakfast buffet. Only problem was that they don't provide microwave for free ($5 extra per night) Otherwose no issues at all.

Reviews.Title: “Nightmare!!!”
Reviews.Author: roadwarriorkris
Reviews.Content: This was my frst trip to Disney and I wanted to stay close to the parks. I made a big mistake selecting this hotel. Sure, it is cheap, but yu will repent staying there. I did not expect a worrld-class name like Radisson to have such a poor hotel. I travel to various cities on business every week, and I must admit this has been the worst hotel of them all. Except for a couple of staff who were decent, I have nothing positive to say about the hotel. It is a old one, without any renovation. No nearby restaurants. The pizza hut there sucks. The hotel's shuttle service is a joke. And worst of all, the rooms are shabby. The bedsheets and towels were tainted. The partition in the bathroom fell on me, on our 2nd day. The AC broke down. Oh yeah, be prepared for bugs in your room.

Reviews.Title: “older hotel...nice, but definitly flawed”
Reviews.Author: sctraveller10
Reviews.Content: my family and i stayed at the radisson worldgate resort from dec. 26th to jan. 2nd. let me start off by saying the hotel has several pros and cons. first off, the hotel is an older hotel, but it has been through some updates (interior anyway) . upon arrival, i was hit with a surprise $65 "resort fee". when i inquired what the fee was, i was told that no matter what company you book through, you still have to pay 7.95 daily to use the "free shuttle service, wifi, etc.. i had booked the hotel pretty cheap $375.00 including tax for seven nights, so i didnt mind paying the "resort fee". i was given a room in the south tower with fairly easy access from either the rear of the hotel or the lobby. the room appeared to be very clean and modern the bathroom also aside from an older shower head that looked like a sore thumb on an otherwise beautiful hand. the sleep number beds were extremely comfortable also.. the room also had a fridge that probably worked too well-lol-it froze some of our drinks which brought us to the next problem: there is a drink machine on every floor of the hotel, and six of the seven floors were "sold out"-floor six's machine wouldn't take my dollars. i ended up buying one drink at the lobby-area gift shop until i could get to walgreens to buy a six pack for a liitle more than i paid for the one drink at the resort. there is a steakhouse in the lobby-we never tried it, as we were usually on a schedule for our "shuttle" to disney. but we did try the pizza hut express a couple times. the black lady that worked there during the morning was nice, but when i asked her for some plastic silverware, she replied "if it aint out there with the salt, then i am out." i found that pretty hard to believe, so i approached the front desk, told the young lady of my predicament, and walla-the silverware magically appeared from behind the counter of the pizza hut counter. the next night, i went to the pizza hut to get some more silverware and the hispanic lady wearing glasses working told me she had some, but they would cost me .25 cents each. naturally, i had pajamas on, so i had to trek back up five floors, get .75cents from my pants, trek back down to the pizza hut only to find she was too busy for ten minutes to "sell" me the silverware. after ten minutes she slid them across the counter and nabbed the change without uttering a word...rude. next came the shuttle-lol-it has a very nice schedule as far as getting to and returning from disney world. with four times in the morning to choose from and four times in the evening to choose to return to the hotel. the lady that drove us each day was mostly friendly and prompt-mostly. tip: be there sitting at the exact time the departure schedule says because she only waits two minutes and then leaves. one night we had to wait fortyfive minutes in 38degree cold because we "came in the busiest time of year and should be patient with her." too bad she wouldn't return the favor. my wife looked forward to using her laptop and the first couple days was a breeze, until the third night in, it wouldn't connect and never did after that either. when she called the front desk they said there was nothing wrong that they knew about, but that she was the third or fourth person to complain and there was nothing that could be done. the hotel was quiet for the most part, south tower, anyway. and my three year old enjoyed the children's theatre in the lobby. would i stay there again? umm probably not. would i recomend the hotel? yes, if you can get it cheap enough, but beware of the flaws of this redone old grand hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Not what you'd expect from Radisson”
Reviews.Author: earthangel_376
Reviews.Content: We booked a room here through priceline at a fairly good rate. Being that it was a Radisson rated at 3.5 stars we were expecting something fairly decent. The room we were given was freezing when we first walked in since the AC was on full blast. I went to switch it to heat & it immediately smelled like something was burning. The sleep number bed was also not functioning well. I called down to the front desk to notify them of the issues and ask for a room change. I was told that I had to hold down the button on the sleep number bed (which I did) and that the AC/heat unit smells sometimes. These explainations made it sound like they weren't willing to give us another room. I insisted politely for a room change and got another roon on the same floor on the opposite side of the building. That room was also freezing but the sleep number beds were newer and functioned well so we called down to the front desk saying that the new room was acceptable. Then we went to wash up & take showers & discovered multiple hairs in the shower. The shower soapholder felt slippery like soap residue was still on it. The shower did not seem like it was cleaned. Also, there was hardly any water pressure coming out of the shower head. The shower head is one of those that you would expect from a dinky motel. Not only that, it was hard to keep warm with the water not adequately coming out and it also oscillated from hotter water to colder water....horrible! We decided to stick with the room, however since it was very late in the evening & we just wanted to go to sleep. But this Radisson is definately not what you would expect from a 3.5 star hotel...not only a hotel, but this place is supposed to be a resort! The only plus is that it is very close to WDW and right off of Rt. 192 which has plenty of eateries.

Reviews.Title: “very good hotel which we thought was going to be awful”
Reviews.Author: KatieF4
Reviews.Content: after reading the reviews on this hotel it said that the hotel was dirty and noisy and really not very good. we were all dreading it but when we got there it was excellent. there was a pizza hut express in the hotel which was handy. there was a good gift shop and there was also a information booth where you could buy your themepark tickets from etc. the pool was also very clean and so was the rooms. the air condition also worked well. i thought it was a brilliant hotel!!

Reviews.Title: “Good location for Disney & Celebration”
Reviews.Author: GlasgowTammy
Reviews.Content: Fairly good hotel , rooms well sized - go for the "sleep number" upgrade, but beware that in low season the "lavish buffet breakfast" does not exist despite being stated on the booking website - substitute "menu breakfast" was very poor alternative

Reviews.Title: “A Friendly place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: Twobucks
Reviews.Content: This was our second visit to this Radisson and I guess it won't be our last. It's an easy find off highway 192 and very local to all the theme parks in and around the Orlando area. Our room (as with our previous stay) was large and comfortable and the bathroom spacious too. We had a king bed room which also featured in room safe and fridge with the usual TV etc. Breakfast was also included within our rate and more than adequate for our needs. The staff were all extremely friendly, which is a must for us, as they can make or break your stay. However, if you're looking for 5 star accommodation this is not the place for you but if you want a good hotel at a reasonable price and a friendly face to greet you then you've come to the right place.

Reviews.Title: “A definite upgrade from hotels nearby”
Reviews.Author: threeviolins
Reviews.Content: Not a bad hotel for the location and the price. Friendly and helpful staff. Beautiful lobby, nice pool. 2 of 3 elevators were not functioning for the 4 days of our stay, both inconvenient and potentially risky. Rooms were not fantastic but definitely clean and acceptable. We moved from a neighboring hotel and the Radisson was both accommodating and helpful for us - definitely a big upgrade to other local hotels, and very conveniently located on 192.

Reviews.Title: “An ok hotel but it could be improved.”
Reviews.Author: Lily123Uk
Reviews.Content: The hotel was a nightmare to find. We arrived at 11pm after a long journey from the UK The hotel was poorly sign posted. Get yourself a decent map before arriving in Florida. The room was fine: Clean, good coffee, iron and ironing board, TV. The room was cleaned every day but there were a few days our coffee wasn’t replaced. The front desk staff were good. The guest shop was run by a grumpy lady. The timeshare people were also annoying. They offered you money off tickets for various places but you have to be willing to give up 90mins of your holiday. We were approached four times during our two week holiday. We booked with a travel agent that was selling this as a hotel feeding into Disney. The shuttle service was rubbish so we ended up making our own way in rather than having to stay in the park all day. This meant a 12 dollar charge for parking each day. The first shuttle back to the hotel was at 7:30pm. The last shuttle into the parks was 12:30 pm. So if you wanted to go into the park in the evening when it was cooler then that wasn’t possible. We didn’t want to go to the parks everyday and so spent a couple of days in the hotel. We appreciated the free towels beside the pool. The pools were good. However this hotel was not set up for guests during the day. The pool was very quiet. The bar did not open until 5:30pm and so there was no way to buy a beer. The “happy hour” between 5 and 7 was good. However I wouldn’t describe the girl bringing in drinks from the restaurant as running a pool bar though. I also wouldn’t describe an area where the kids can watch Disney movies and play with computer games unsupervised as a kids club. An ok hotel but it could be improved by increasing the shuttle service and by opening the bar during the day.

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: KGTravelers
Reviews.Content: Although just refurbed, there are some finishing touches that were overlooked. But for the price, you cannot beat it. We stayed in the timeshare section and did get asked upon check-in about attending a timeshare presentation. We are already timeshare owners so this wasn't a big deal for us. We attended the presentation the next morning and got free tickets to the Arabian Nights dinner and show. The shuttle was on time and convenient but often overcrowded on the return trips. A couple more pick ups from the Disney parks would be helpful. If I had a complaint, it would be that we never had housekeeping service. Our trash was never dumped and we had to go downstairs to the desk to get fresh towels. We noticed that other folks just put their trash and towels outside their door and it did get picked up. The best part of that was that we didn't get awakened by housekeeping when we wanted to sleep in!! Overall, this is a great value and we would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “This was just an "ok" place to stay....”
Reviews.Author: rbwildcat
Reviews.Content: We recently returned from our stay at the Worldgate Resort. We were in the timeshare portion (south tower)....managed by Driftwood. The staff was very friendly and we had ample room, however, we have stayed in much nicer places in the past. The south tower has been converted to timeshare units with various floor plans. Our unit was nice & recently remodeled. However, we felt there was a lack of detail......the crown molding was put on upside down, switch plates were crooked, the hall lights were crooked, etc. We also noticed a smell from the water. Maybe this is a Kissimmee thing? The tap water always smelled funny. We did NOT drink it. The unit did not have central air conditioning. Instead, we had "hotel" type air conditioners. We noticed a lot of humidity in our unit We did complain & a maintenance worker came right up. However, we didn't really notice a difference in the humidity level. There are two pools....both fairly small. One is right outside the south tower & usually wasn't very crowded. It also wasn't very clean. The larger pool is off the lobby/north tower. It was the nicest of the two, but was usually very crowded. It was neat at night.....lots of tiki torches. We would have liked a washer/dryer in our unit. There is a laundry room on the 2nd floor, but I felt it was fairly expensive. The resort is very close to Disney & not a bad drive to SeaWorld or Universal. They do offer free shuttle service to the parks. They have several drop off & pick up times for Disney, but just run once a day to SeaWorld & Universal. We enjoyed our stay....we mainly were just there in the evenings once we came home from the parks. We probably wouldn't stay there again. I would prefer something a little nicer.....

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay here unless you want to be harassed your entire stay!”
Reviews.Author: maryhawn01
Reviews.Content: I know Orlando is in the business of timeshare, but this hotel really takes it over the top. The room was fine and clean. The front desk staff was friendly and very helpful. That's where it ends though. The "Guest Services" staff are just downright rude all the time. Every single morning we were there, we received a sales call around 9:00am to try and get us to attend the timeshare sales meeting. We were very tired and told them that we were out late the night before and not to call again, but they called anyway. We could not walk in the lobby without them approaching us. We would be just going to grab a bite to eat at the Pizza Hut and they would yell at us from across the lobby. Once while we were having lunch at Pizza Hut, an older lady approached us at our table and tried to sell us! They even bribed us with money to try to get us to attend! Bottom line is don't stay here if you want to be left alone to just enjoy your vacation.

Reviews.Title: “We've never had better service anywhere else!”
Reviews.Author: Nolegirl68
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful time at the Radisson Worldgate. The resort had a couple different pools. At night there were movies for the adults in the outside bar and the kids got to watch a kid movie while they were swimming. They got to eat popcorn at the poolside. That was so much fun! I've never seen movies on the pool deck before this vacation. The hotel staff was very attentive to our needs. During our stay we asked for a microwave to borrow and they had it in our room within ten minutes of asking. We were very impressed and would love to stay there again in the near future! We would also like to Sean Bohanan for his wonderful hospitality during our stay!

Reviews.Title: “The Smiles Were Always There!”
Reviews.Author: JoanyBelle
Reviews.Content: I'm originally from South Florida and miss it tremendously! I met my lifelong friend and her daughter for a 2 day excursion at Sea World. I had stayed here before and remembered the pool (my favorite spot). What I had forgotten was those comfortable beds! I travel a lot and trust me, those two items are precious to me. I arrived very early and had to wait for my room to be cleaned. While waiting I sat in their lobby and marveled at all the quiet cleaning that was being done. Everyone had a smile and was busy! How often do you see that? They had put up a small castle movie theater next to the pizza hut inside the lobby - cute! If the chairs were bigger, I would have sat in there! The staff was helpful with requests, the breakfast buffet was excellent, on my last night they had a HUGE screen tv and were showing movies to watch while you sat by the pool or swam! Wow! I just can't say enough! Thanks for a wonderful, restful trip Radisson! I'll be back.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable Rooms, Excellent Meeting Facilities”
Reviews.Author: flxsunxchick
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Radisson Worldgate in Orlando for a State-wide conference as a staff member and attendee. The rooms were spot-less. The SleepNumber adjustable beds were nice to try, but I wouldn't buy one for myself. The bathroom was of good size and carried enough towels for all four guests. TV selection was good; Complimentary mini-fridge was nice, though we wish we'd found it sooner, (it was hidden in a cabinet beneath the TV - nice camoflauge if you knew where it was). Desk, coffeemaker, iron, ironing board, and hair dryer came standard. View was nice, except it was of a parking lot. We were able to hear the fireworks from Disney, but weren't able to view them from the room. Overall, EXCELLENT stay. I would highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “very nice”
Reviews.Author: redpoker
Reviews.Content: i stayed at this hotel with some friends just for a relaxing weekend not really paying mind to the horrible reviews i have read i still took the chance. i was checked in early by to very nice ladies one african american woman with a difficult name to say (i remember that much) and one girl with red hair all very nice and funny. they made our stay very comfortable. my room was very nice. loved the sleep number bed. food is good. the only people that seemed to annoy me where the guest service people persistent little buggers. besides all was great had fun at the parks and clubs with friends will definelty come back

Reviews.Title: “Cleanliness is a virtue”
Reviews.Author: madtours
Reviews.Content: Having stayed at Radisson's before, I gambled on booking this one, as the rooms were cheap and although I'd read some bad reviews, there had been one or two satisfactory ones. The hotel is a little dated, but not that bad. The pool area was ok, with clean towels, but the floor was full of spat out gum and sweets and needed a good clean. On first inspection the rooms seemed clean, but we only saw the maid 3/5 days and there were bugs on the window sill and I can't be certain, but there may have been bugs in the bed too. I have a very dotty back at the moment and the dots did bleed. Great location for Disney if you don't mind a few bugs sharing your room and less manic than I Drive. About 15-20 mins from Universal. We actually preferred the location to I Drive, which seems to have got really tacky these days. The bar area was great, as it was open and so if you fancied a couple of drinks, the kids could sit with you, so long as they were at a table away from the bar. The bar tender (Ray) was from Liverpool and had a great American accent. He liked to talk, but was very nice and kept us entertained. Ray was actually the best part about the hotel. I'm not a fussy traveller. I'm happier in a beach hut in Thailand than a 5* luxury. I expect a few bugs to be about when I'm in a hot climate, but I think there was one or two bugs too many in this one and I think Radisson will pull out if they do an inspection any time soon.

Reviews.Title: “A Vacation to Disney”
Reviews.Author: jmid678
Reviews.Content: This is a good hotel if you plan on not spending much time in the room. The staff was very helpful but housekeeping did not come and clean our room during the day. I called one day for bath towels and it took 3 phone calls before they actually brought them and our bathroom had black curly hairs stuck on the wall in the shower (use your own imagination) .

Reviews.Title: “Great Value for the Money”
Reviews.Author: bamasoutherngirl
Reviews.Content: We were allowed to check-in early and the front desk staff were very friendly. The park transportation scedule was a joke. We never used it. The taxi service at the hotel was adequate most of the time, however they were more expensive than the other taxies at the parks. Our room was very nice and housekeeping was very good. The main pool was great - south tower poolwas dirty. Everyone in the hotel was very friendly except the horrible girl in the overpriced gift shop. The area seems to be on the decline, however we did get out and walk without any problems. Great internet service. Overall this hotel is a great deal for the price.

Reviews.Title: “For the money it was wonderful”
Reviews.Author: imacooker
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed 6 nights and had no problems what so ever. The hotel personnel were friendly and answered any questions for us. If we passed any employee during the course of the day they generally spoke, people at the front desk didn't have a customer they generally spoke to us. We had breakfast 3 times in the Savannah Grille and 2 out of the 3 was a very pleasant experience. The food was always fine (it was a buffet) the server wasn't very good one time. He was nice enough just didn't d his job well. All together it was a good experience and I was glad we went there. I was very skeptical because of all the negative reviews. You must remember there are over 500 rooms in this hotel so there are going to be people that are angry for some reason and there is nothing you can do to please them and others have very legitimate complaints. Also this isn't a 5 star hotel it is a 2-3 star and you aren't paying 5 star prices. They are in the process of remodeling and our room was redone and it was fine. I wasn't crazy about the sleep number beds because when you have 2 people on a full size bed there is only 1 control and when one person moves at night the air in the mattress makes you move and it feels really weird. If no one moves its comfy. One thing to it is so close to the Disney parks its unbeliveable. Just drive to the parks the shuttle is very crowded and the times aren't aways handy. It is $12.00 per day to park at Disney and it is worth it. There is a $7.95 a day resort for unlimited local calls and unlimited WiFi and several other things there is also local and state taxes 13 percent to be exact so that figures about $13.00 a day in addition to the $7.95. The swimming pool is very nice and the area around it was fine. Don't be afraid you will be just fine.

Reviews.Title: “Maybe this hotel is okay for large groups...”
Reviews.Author: CSL63
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a trip with 130 teenagers for Spring Break, and we took over one floor of this hotel for three nights. If anyone has taken this type of a trip with a large group of teenagers, you know it's not easy, and you wouldn't trust them with a 4 star hotel... but a 3 star would have been nice, or maybe even a 2 star! The hotel has all the basic amenities, but beyond that... To start, the location is not great. There are some rundown $1.99 t-shirt shops in the area, an abandoned motel, and a nearly empty pond nearby. The landscaping looked a little rundown too. When we arrived the first morning we had breakfast in a large conference room. Everything was fine - nothing to write home about, but we were all fed well. That night, once inside, we realized the elevators couldn't handle this many people at once. Therefore, several of us took the stairs, only to notice that the exit door was propped open. Some security! It happened every day, so we had to be on the lookout to keep closing it. Once we got to our room, we found that four of us had been put in a room wth a king size bed and a twin pull out couch. A call got us another bed, and even though they told us there would be a $15/night charge, we must have complained loudly enough and haven't been charged yet. Once we tried to get that bed ready, though, we found out that the sheets were wet and filthy black, so that involved another call to the front desk to get a change of bedding. Once we started taking showers we found that we only had two towels - yet another call to the front desk. As for the condition of the room, we were lucky enough to get a Sleep Number bed, so we were okay for one bed. Neither the pull out or the rollaway bed were comfortable, though, and all our friends complained about their lumpy beds with springs poking them. The ceiling and walls needed painting, the bathtub plug would not hold the water in for a bath, the air conditioner was either too cold or ineffective, there were not enough outlets, and one of the outlets that was there didn't work. While looking for outlets we found trash behind a nightstand. There was a coffee pot with the fixins, but no outlet to plug it into! The carpet appeared to have been changed within the last couple of years, though. The maid service was mediocre at best. The second night we came home to find the bed made, but neither the pull out bed nor the rollaway bed had been made. While we did have 4 new towels in the bathroom, there was no new bar of soap - luckily I carry one with me, so we didn't have to call to the front desk again. We had a child get sick at a park one day, so that night we stayed in and ordered room service. While the food was generally fine, they did not give us any napkins or silverware. Also, after we looked at the tray we realized that one dinner was served with two plates stuck together, the bottom one still dirty with a lot of ketchup! The kids in our group did seem to like the Pizza Hut, but teenagers aren't known for their culinary tastes, though, so I don't really know how it was. I went down one evening to get some medicine at the gift shop for the same sick child and was treated to some wonderfully rude service. They seemed to have a fair selection of food for the families to save money to eat in their room, tho. When we first arrived at the hotel there was a large group of Gold Wing riders, and there was another high school marching band there too, so this must be the hotel's business model - discounts for large groups. We commented that for the kids, this was probably an adequate hotel, and they likely didn't notice all these things since they were having fun with their friends. To people who stay at hotels regularly, though, this place was really a mess, and I couldn't recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Good for the Value Minded, but better places out there”
Reviews.Author: Zyloman
Reviews.Content: We normally are very kind and lenient in rating hotels, and rarely do we even write but but we feel compelled to pass on that we would not recommend this hotel. Very bad first impression as we walked in to a somewhat chaotic environment. We arrived into the lobby around 11am after a long overnight flight and had to wait several minutes to get helped (hotel seemed very short staffed which could have something to do with the times). Once helped at the counter, we were told rooms would not be available until after 4pm (advertised check-in was 3pm). Although not being able to check-in at 11am is a convenience as opposed to a rule or must, this was about only the 3rd time in all our years of travelling, and first time at a Radisson or higher level property that we have NOT been able to check in at that time. The term "resort" really is misused here. While there is a nice pool, a Pizza Hut, convenience store, and Grill along with a nice play area for the kids (to watch movies and play free computer video type games), I would not classify this property as anywhere near the four-star property they pass themselves off as (or compared to other four star properties) and I what I would come to expect from the Radisson brand. Maybe it was just us, but we had that 2-2 1/2 star feeling here. Our room was average with only two full size beds (all properties of this name or caliber have been queen or larger size beds in the past for us). Room was reasonably sized with a frig, safe and desk, but no microwave which I think is kind of handy with small children. We continuously kept getting shorted towels and wash clothes and finally started hording them! We informed them over and again that we were with our two small children and needed 4 of everything but they kept bringing us 2-3 of everything the first four nights (and we are still here and counting!). The hotel advertises as providing shuttle service to the 4 major Disney theme parks. They provide shuttle service to SeaWorld and Universal, but to only two the Disney theme parks, EPCOT and Magic Kingdom. We were able to make due and get around once we got to EPCOT or Magic Kingdom as Disney shuttles can then take you to the other parks from there (ie Animal Kingdowm and Hollywood Studios). The advertising of the shuttle service to the four Disney theme parks was, however, one of the selling points and this is something I definitely let them know about as being false. The shuttle service itself was complete chaos with overfull buses and scrambling to get on them (these "shuttles" are in actuality city buses that make pick ups at several hotels in the vicinity of the Radisson and give the impression of making you feel like cattle given the overfilling of them). Shuttle pick up and return times did not coincide with park hours and were very limited so you had to plan a bit (only 2-3 to Magic Kingdom going and coming and only 1 to/fro to EPCOT). Maybe our expectations were simply to high about the shuttle service, but being so close in proximity to the Disney Resort area (only 2-5 miles to all Disney attractions) and advertising themselves as being THE closest non-Disney resort to the the Disney area would lead one to believe there would have been a nice, frequent, convenient shuttle schedule. There is an AVIS rental car desk on-site as well as an Adriatic Transportation service but I would not recommend either. AVIS rates were outrageous at $84 a day for a car (you can get one at Downtown Disney or the airport for WAY cheaper) and Adriatic kept quoting me different prices for transportation to the same locations and then lying and denying they ever quoted anything else (something I will be reporting). Overall friendliness of the staff was o.k. The hotel provides you good cleanliness and decent value if you are on a budget. You just have to temper your expectations a bit. It certainly isn't the worst place we have stayed at, but given the infinite options in the Orlando area, I would not stay here again with my wife and children when we come back to Orlando in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Don't be fooled”
Reviews.Author: Motth
Reviews.Content: My recent stay at this hotel, yes hotel was not the best. As you travel to my room there wasn't any central air circulating. Once I made it to my room it was very dusty and the decor was indeed faded. The room also had the pervious guest hair still located on the pillows cases. I immediately contact the front desk and ask for the manger. The front desk stated that the manger was busy and would call the room ext back. After waiting 5 min for a call back I went back to the front desk in and ask to speak with the manger in person. I will say the manger was apologetic and discounted the room and move me to another room in the 6000 building. This building was very different from the rest of the hotel. The view was nice and the air condition is through out the building, so if you must stay this Resort the 6000 building is where you want to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: cccccc7
Reviews.Content: A lot of people had bad things to say about this place, so I was very nervous when we got there. I was surprised. Our room was amazing. Very modern, updated. The hotel was great, the water was so warm. We loved the place. It was perfect for us. There were 8 of us that went, including 2 young children. Maybe we were just in a different tower than all these people that are complaining? I thought it was a great deal.

Reviews.Title: “Bad experience myself. Will never go again, nor recommend”
Reviews.Author: buddydavis
Reviews.Content: I encountered the following problems, some severe, during my stay in the Radisson resort hotel (near Route 192) in Orlando, which give me a very bad experience with Radisson's goodwill: 1. SEVERE - Room Security: Housekeeper left my room door OPEN (!!) along the day, after their services during the daytime when I were out. 2. Impolite check-in staff (x2) 3. Unacceptable humming noise from the machine room on the corridor (2/F) and the indoor fridge. 4. Housekeeping - very little toilet paper and facial tissue left. They never replaced after being used up even after housekeeping service. Likewise to the toilet amenity. 5. Security - Sales call during my stay in the hotel ! 6. Security - External advertisement materials drop in my room, when I am out. 7. In-room decor is faded and poor. 8. SEVERE - charge for RESORT FEE, without any prior notice from hotel staff ! 9. With a price tag of US$6x +++ and resort fee, there are plenty of better option around. Positive: 1. Indoor high-speed wireless internet is good and fast 2. Parking lots is available and accessible 3. The bed is ok. No comment: 1. Their facilities. Overall: Bad experience. Hurt the Radisson goodwill. Will never stay in, and not **recommend others to stay in their resort again !

Reviews.Title: “Hotel from Hell”
Reviews.Author: sooze23
Reviews.Content: Looks like the perfect hotel from the outside. In our room the beds squeaked and the toilet made a terrible noise after flushing. The lobby was beautiful, but the foyer to the back parking lot smelled like pee. We wanted to change our room, but when we returned from Disneyworld we were too tired. I think the hotel knew that.

Reviews.Title: “Good "budget" hotel”
Reviews.Author: g8rboy39
Reviews.Content: We made last minute plans to go to Disney World and needed 3 rooms for 2 nights. Check-In took 5 minutes, staff was friendly and efficient, arranging for all 3 rooms to be next to one another easily enough. The facilities (lobby, grounds, etc) were fine. The room and bathroom were clean and neat. Everything about the room was good - beds, pillows, rugs, bathroom, tv, etc - at least as good as the All Stars hotels at Disney. Each room had a mini-fridge in the cabinet under the TV. Cleaning staff did a fine job on the room each day. Didn't try the pool, restaurants, or shuttle. It's a little off the road and the surrounding properties aren't the fanciest (there are two huge "cheap" souvenir stores on the corners), but the area seemed safe and reasonable enough. It's not a 4 star hotel, and it's not quite as nice as the Radisson Celebration - but it costs less. Anyone who complains about this hotel is used to closer to 4 star accommodations - which typically cost at least 3 times as much as this hotel. We're frequent travelers to Orlando and I'd have no problem staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very Disappointing!!”
Reviews.Author: Farmer391
Reviews.Content: Do not stay here! We had issue after issue. Although check-in time was supposedly at four our room was not cleaned and ready until five. Other members of our party had to wait until 5:30 for the room to be ready. The hotel maintenance was very poor. They disconnected the phone to our room and so we could not call down to the front desk when there was an emergency and the phone in the elevator lobby did not work either. They were out of both shampoo and extra pillows. The worst part was that there was one night we got back after a day in Disney World to find that our room had not been cleaned. The bed was still not made, there were no fresh towels, etc. On another day, my sister-in-law shaved her legs in the tub and just thought the faucet was pouring in more water than the drain could handle, but when they got back to the room the tub still had water in it, which clearly meant the maid service had not cleaned the tub! Who knows how long it had been since they have really cleaned it. The room size was nice but I have never stayed at a hotel that had so many issues with housekeeping and maintenance before and I have stayed at many hotels. There are so many choices in the area. This one is definitely not worth it.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel gets a bad rap! Great Christmas week stay here...”
Reviews.Author: jaylesh74
Reviews.Content: So, I got this hotel for 50 dollars a night (for christmas week no less!) on Priceline and then went straight to tripadvisor.com to read the reviews...uh-oh. Mostly horrible reviews! People getting robbed in the parking lot, dated facility, horrible customer service. I was petrified... But then we got there, and the hotel was beautifully decorated for Christmas. I went up to the lady at the checkin and told her the following "I've read absolutely horrible reviews about some of the rooms here. Please give me a room in which I dont have to complain to the manager to change. I'd really appreciate a great experience for my family here" She upgraded me to a sleepeasy bed room, and it was great. We were in the tower that houses the smaller pool, and I have nothing but great things to say. The shuttles were convenient, the location was great, and the staff were friendly as anything. When the business center computer printer didnt work, they invited me to their office to print stuff out. Very accomodating. The only thing I wasnt cool with (and I Knew about going in) was the 8$ a day resort fee. I'd rather they build that into their rate ...but seriously, for 50 bucks a night at Christmas time, I cant complain too much. I'd give this hotel an A- overall, with no qualms about returning in the future. Keep an open mind when booking this! It isnt as bad as everyone says- in fact, its much better, Happy New Year

Reviews.Title: “Good Only if you get a discount on the Room Rate”
Reviews.Author: Sri_NY
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 6 nights, primarily due to its proximity to Disney and a special discounted deal (@ $79/night incl taxes). The Radisson Worldgate has an outdated room product with poor service, due to staff cuts and below average maintenance. The pro's are the shuttle service to Disney and Universal Studios and its proximity to Disney. The con's are slow and disappointing service, terrible in-house restaurants (Savannah Grill) and very poorly maintained rooms. Go here only if you get a great deal on the price and want a hotel with a decent shuttle service to all the three theme parks (Disney, Sea World and Universal Studios). AVOID the (always empty) in-house restaurant (Savannah Grill), which is not surprising given the bad service and distasteful food with flies all around you.

Reviews.Title: “Below Average Experience - Only go if you are getting for real cheap!”
Reviews.Author: busorap
Reviews.Content: We got the room for $63 and our primary reason for visit was Disney. The positives abt staying at this hotel were the cheap rate and the proximity to Disney. Apart from that, nothing else was memorable. The rooms were poorly maintained, badly in need of renovation. Food at the Savannah Grille was horrible and the staff/ customer service was terrible as well. Only go if you get a room for around $50-60 and free Disney tix along with that.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal for Disney”
Reviews.Author: Neil&Sue
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 4 nights at the beginning of 3 week Orlando holiday. Booked by brother using his points programme. We were there in the week leading up to halloween, when it was surprisingly quiet. Our rooms just ideal and offered all we wanted with 2 really comfortable double beds. I got the felling that we had upgraded or superior rooms as they were better than we had expected, and had some added priviledges in terms of fruit/chocolates, etc. The hotel is very close to plenty of good value restaurants, and close to the Disney parks. As we went to Disney each day during this part of the holiday, it was a question of out, breakfast, theme park, hotel to change, evening dinner, then bed as everyone was shattered daily. It means your experience of the hotel is limited, although the pool was used by everyone, and breakfast in the hotel was good. This struck me as a good family hotel well situated for the themeparks that woud certainly suit family groups. Given I didn't pay, I can't guage the value but if it is only $50 per night as some reviewers have said, then that is a really good price.

Reviews.Title: “Radisson Worldgate Gates Thumbs Up From Us!!!”
Reviews.Author: skyelilli
Reviews.Content: I was bit dubious after reading the reviews on here. Was expecting a pit to be honest, but was paid for so braced ourself, only to find its completely the opposite. No ants, mould, cockroaches to be seen. We're not fuss pots at all, but if I had to nit pick I'd say the front door was ajar slightly, as if it had been kicked at some stage!! But, nothing to worry about whatsoever, definitely not enough to change the room. Being British, one night was a bit nippy, so thought i'd use the heater on the air con!! Big mistake, stank to high heaven. Obvioulsy never used, and just incinerated the dust within LOL. Our beds were made every day, and the bathroom had towels nicely arranged each time, supplies constantly topped up. Reception staff were lovely. We only had to leave a $25 fee, which we collected when we left, this is just for breakages etc. They have a pizza hut inside, so that's handy. Didn't try the restaurant, so cannot comment on that. The pool area is great (main one). We were sitting in the hot tub 4.30am due to adjusting after jetlag!! Little lizards run about which is lovely to see as dawn breaks. Only thing I didn't like was the ticket sales people. GGGRRRRRR!!! Nearly every time we walked past, they'd say hi, and you make the mistake of replying!!! You're then snared and asked for the umpteenth time, 'have you got all your tickets!!' I thought they'd surely recognise us at some point. Having said that, all over Florida we had this. God I hate that. No should mean no surely??! Dont let this put you off mind, it is definitely worth every penny and I recommend it and would definitely stay again (if we were to ever go back to Florida, which is definitely not).

Reviews.Title: “Much better than expected”
Reviews.Author: bilbaino_2000
Reviews.Content: Excellent room. Large with a great view. Much better than we expected after reading the reviews. Only complaint: we were not told at check-in about the 6.95 $ "ressort fee". This reduced our delight about free parking, internet and heated pool considarably. Staff was very helüful: we got a second chair and another fridge within minutes. There is this already in other reviews mentioned phenomenon of the mysteroiusly all of a sudden nur more working passkeys: To us it happend twice in 4 days.

Reviews.Title: “Ok - needs a little more attention to detail”
Reviews.Author: BethAnnP
Reviews.Content: At $48/ night, there is not much to complain about. The location in relation to Animal Kingdom alone is perfect. There was a cockroach in the tub - gross, but the only one we saw. Breakfast was a little pricey - even with both kids eating "free". Pools looked nice, but was too chilly to use while we were there. There was a large stain on the carpet of something - looked like grease or something. It looks like the rooms being renovated will be nice - I checked them out as they were on the same floor as us. Bed was comfortable, but our kids ate poptarts in bed one morning & room service made the bed without shaking the crumbs out - gross. But, kind of our fault - so, can go unnoticed. The doors were not locked to the place from the side entrances, so if that is a concern - don't stay here. Otherwise - go for it, especially booking on Priceline for $48/night :)

Reviews.Title: “Stay away from this place.”
Reviews.Author: ycandey
Reviews.Content: Talk about a nightmare..My family was victim of armed robbery at this hotel parking lot. Security was non existent and all the entrances were left unlocked 24/7. No surveillance camera outside or guard on duty. After staff found out we booked through priceline, they said there is nothing they can do for us. They did waive resort fee after I reminded them what happen to us and we had no money or CC to pay them. So there we were with no money, credit card and no ID's...Worst thing of all our kids had to experience something no one should ever experience. How do you explain to 4 and 6 year old why this man is trying to kill us all? Response from priceline after our near death experice...."We are sorry, here is $50 coupon for your "trouble". Not that it matters but that "coupon" expires in 4 months. Folks, be careful out there. Be aware of your surroundings and keep your guards up. Talking with the police, we found out crime against tourist are fairly common. Ask about security measure of hotel you are planning on staying. Just carry around what you really need and leave wallet in the safe.

Reviews.Title: “Not my idea of a resort!”
Reviews.Author: julesingeorgia
Reviews.Content: Priceline insisted on billing this as a 3 star resort....NOT! It's ok for a family that wants a really cheap room for disney but a resort? Please. Our room was very dated but always clean. We did not have any meals at the hotel so I cannot comment on their food. Also did not use the pool as it looked totally mobbed with kids that had GIANT blow up pool toys in it. I don't mean like a beach ball or raft, I mean full on giant blow up vollyball nets and stuff, so no room for other guests. The front desk staff and management was very nice and helpful. Housekeeping was also very attentive and speedy to get us more towels when we needed them. The traffic outside the resort was absolutely unbearable. Every night when the disney parks closed it was a giant parking lot outside the resort, you were stuck and could not go anywhere or even come back. Spend the money and stay inside the resort that has their own disney transportation. Worth every penny!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Ok”
Reviews.Author: happyjude
Reviews.Content: Having read the reveues before we went we were going to change hotels but we are now pleased we didnt. We booked a king room with Travel City and when we arrived Travel City only book double rooms we were told and all the king rooms had gone. The receptionist was most helpful and fond us a king room housekeeping had just released. It was an inside corner room which ment it was quite dark and needed the light on during they day which did not bother us It was very clean beb was the most comfortable bed we have ever had abroad not a shabby room at all bathroom was large no bath only a shower which we were again very happy about.The staff were most helpful in every way we had a little problem with our car again the reception staff were most helpfull. There was never any mention of any resort fees infact we made phone calls to our car rental company and there was no charge. Now the down side we had breakfast first morning although the food was quite good and staff were atentive it was not very hot. Puplic areas need upgrading could do with bigger towels at the pool. But on the hole we were very happy no complaints at all we are sorry they are getting such bad reports after all you only get what you pay for

Reviews.Title: “Had to make a few complaints but the stay was ok”
Reviews.Author: Betttyboopfan
Reviews.Content: Well i must say that after reading some of the reviews about this hotel i was thinking oh my god but went there with the view of i hope it is ok. Arrived at the hotel and from the outside looked very nice and clean, went in to check in and like other people on here was not aware that they wanted to charge us $6.95 as a resort fee so that did not go down to well. We checked into our room and although we had clean towels and the room looked clean they are indeed a bit dated and in need of decoration. When we booked through Travel City Direct we had a hi fi benefit which promised us a free paper of which we had delivered outside our door mon-fri and also free breakfast and free drinks on the first day, we were not given anything on arrival so i had to ask for these of which i was then given coupons to use. Everything seemed ok until the 4th day of our stay when the room seemed to become really damp and mould built up on the wall and the ceiling became black so i complained to the manager as our clothes started to feel damp and he came to take a look in our room and agreeded straight away to move us to another room. I started playing my face and told him that i was not happy that we now had to pack everything up and that our clothes were damp. He then after i pressured him a bit said that he would clean our clothes of which he did and whilst we went out have our stuff moved if we packed it up, so we packed up came back later that day to find that he had moved us to a better room with sleep number beds such an improvement. Although you shouldnt have cause to complain about anything when we did straight away something was done about it. When we arrived there we also had to have a rollaway bed of which we did not end up paying for as did we not pay for the resort fee either as we complained to Travel City Direct and a rep came out to make a report. The pool area was okay although lots of little lizards running about day and night and the pool at times was not cleaned and taken care of as it should be.Also a tip for you when you do have breakfast there do not pay for it as the food is not very good and they will expect a large tip and if you do not leave one they will call the managers and start playing there face. So to round it up No i would nt stay here again but i have also seen worse hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Npt a 3 star! Not even a decent 2!”
Reviews.Author: fobstylez
Reviews.Content: Pros - Location, its a nice location. Cons - where to start, when i first pulled into this hotel, I noticed the long driveway between two gift shops. When I saw the hotel, it looked fairly old but figured it w as a 3 star so it should be decent inside. Front desk was eh, ok service. She kind of gave me attitude because I was a few hours early for check in. She had me sign an agreement because I had to pay a resort fee, it was somewhere around 6.95. I wasnt a happy camper, I already paid for my stay with priceline but this hotel is charging you on top of that. The elevator was soooo hot, no a/c and it smells really bad. Door key to our room (third level) took a while to work. Right away, I notice the room felt very damp and sticky. I still assume its the a/c at full blast that is leaving mist in the air and damping everything! Everything around me feels dirty. I thought because I checked in early I pissed off the front desk person but after reading the reviews, I think this is normal here. Bathroom was even worst, It looks so dirty. Dust around the edges, shower head felt slimmy to the feel, hair in the tub. It has a nice size desk with an executive chair but the desk felt sticky. Nice size frig under the tv but my fridge barely worked. This room is in very poor condition. I was very disappointed in my stay and felt bad for my company that came along. I would never stay here again if I had a choice, this hotel is no where near 3 star.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: Darlene97
Reviews.Content: After reading reviews, I was skeptical. I, however, was pleasantly surprised. Upon check-in, I asked and received an upgrade to a Sleep number bed (which was very comfortable). The friendly desk clerk also gave me a room (with a spectacular view) overlooking the fireworks at night. There was no extra cost for the upgrade. The room was spacious with a refrigerator. Parking was convenient (we could see the car from our room). The resort fee was nominal compared to many places. (At Disney it is $10.00 a day or internet, $10.00 for a refrig, etc). The room was clean, however the bathtub, which was all tile, was chipped in places. I considered this a great value for the deal I got on Priceline.

Reviews.Title: “Not great, but It is good”
Reviews.Author: EdmontonEdmonton
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel from priceline, 45/ night and I asked upgrade when I checked in. Plus 10$ /night, got number beds room. It is comfortable, About park tickets, If you ask "Good" price, you must join to timeshare about 2.5 Hrs.
