Do not have breakfast or lunch during timeshare, it will be spent you more time , you could save it (ask coupon) next day. breakfast is perfect service. Of course, you also buy regualer ticket without timeshare. the room is nice view, clear and funiture is old but very clear. it is good, A/C is not very noise. Pool is not good during night time, nobody did cleaning, next morning is better. Checking out had to wait online, Lobby staff only 3 ppl.

Reviews.Title: “A bit dated”
Reviews.Author: Sharpsh00ter
Reviews.Content: Booked into a standard family room. The rooms are dated and in need of redecoration., however were adequate. Understand that the hotel is to become timeshare soon. The beds are advertised as sleep number type but are not. The beds are quite small for two people and the matresses are hard. We had a noisy group in the adjacent rooms, told the desk but noise went on and on. When we complained the next day we were asked to move - not the group making the noise. Card entry system kept failing requiring us to go to the desk to re-energise the cards. Pool is o.k. if on the small side. Overall the hotel was probably once impressive ,but requires to be updated.

Reviews.Title: “This is no 3.5 star hotel...a 2 at best.”
Reviews.Author: FlyHorizon
Reviews.Content: The hotel room was moldy and smelly. it was rated at 3.5 stars which was a vast over rating. The bedding was skimpy and the furniture and walls were in need of replacement or repair. At the end of the stay we were given a bill for use of features that should have been included in the fee for the hotel - having a phone in the room, having a pool, having parking, and a few other random items. I would not recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “An ok time at the Radisson Worldgate Resort”
Reviews.Author: Luvmyyorkie
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Radisson Resort Worldgate the wk of July 7-12. We booked on line and booked a package deal with a 90 min (timeshare) resort tour. For our time we were given 2 disney tickets each to either of the 4 major theme parks. The Radisson was ok for the price we paid $79. We did have some A/C problems and were moved to another room and then moved back to our orginial room when the A/C was fixed. The only time we were there was to sleep. I'm not a picky person and as long as the room is clean, with fresh towels...I'm ok. The timeshare presentation was very pushy! But we knew going into this they would be. They are only doing their job. We had to say no several times before they finally gave up. We got our disney tickets and went on our way. It was fun vacation!!! Will I stay at the Radisson again? Not sure, only due to wanting to try out a different hotel.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel for the price”
Reviews.Author: tallytigersharks
Reviews.Content: We read all the reviews before we stayed here (after we booked though priceline for $45 per night, and we were worried. We checked in the holtel and the musty smell that was written about wasn't there, and the lobby was clean. The elevators didn't have air conditioning (one of the few bad comments, but very low on my needs for a hotel). We walked in and everything was clean and neat. The air conditioning was on the loud side, but never bothered us, or our 2 children 4 months and 23 months. We opted for the sleep # bed for additional $10 before check in, it was well worth it, we slept like rocks, and didn't bother each other to get up. The bathroom was needing of some attention, and the water pressure could have been better, but then again, @ $45 a night, it wasn't a great problem. Most of the staff were very nice. We went to eat at the resturant after a long and not a great day (rainy and a person who ruined, or tryed to ruin the day for us). We went in and told the waiter we were in a hurry to get back to WDW, and asked if it wold take long, and he said no, and then after no drinks in 15 mins of waiting, we left, which the manager saw and gave us each free pizza at the pizza hut, he was very nice as was the pizza lady. It made our night a little better. Overall our stay was good and would stay again in a minute, esp for that price.

Reviews.Title: “Do Not Stay Here”
Reviews.Author: philsoc
Reviews.Content: Checked in on Wed. July 9th 2008. Lady behind counter told us about there $6.95 plus tax ($7.80 a day) resort fee which I already knew about that by reading some reviews. BEWARE of the $125 deposit they charge to your credit card just in case you decide to order room service which we didn't. Lady told us we would get it credited back to our account 7-10 business days. In your double bed room you get 2 full size beds. It also had red stains that looked like kool-aid in a few places. My wife and I have a queen at home and it felt like we were on top of each other all night. We are not skinny people. We check in that morning and the rest was down hill from there. Wed. night: Did not clean tub. Did not leave new towels Did not vacuum Did not leave new glasses of the ones we used Did not leave new wash cloths Thurs. night: Did not vacuum. Did not leave wash cloths Did not empty out trash Did not leave new glasses Fri. night: Did not leave wash cloths Did not leave new towels Did not leave new coffee Did not clean up coffee grinds they left all over floor Sat. night: Did not leave new coffee Sun. night: Couldn't get into room with magnetic door key card Mon. night: No new coffee Did not leave new glasses Tues. night (last day) Couldn't get into room with magnetic door key card. After Friday night I couldn't take it anymore. I went down to the front desk and ask to speak to a manager. I did and they credited me 3 days worth of resort fees which totaled up to like $24 dollars. I guess thats the best they could do. So I took it. On Wed. morning us trying to leave to head to the airport we had to went 30 minutes for an elevator. WE WERE ON THE 3rd FLOOR. They have 3 elevators and only 1 was working. We called the front desk and the lady that answered acted suprised. An elevator came twice to our floor that was going down and both times they were full. This placed was full to its capacity with people because when I went down there to complain I asked for a suite and she said that there were no room available upgrades. They are going to convert this hotel into a resort, so I was told by the lady they was trying to get us to go on a timeshare of the new place that this will look like and I guess thru do not want to put any money into this hotel because of it. I only paid like $442 through Hotwire for the whole week which is good I suppose. The lady behind the counter also told me that if the magnetic part of the key card touches a cell phone or another credit card, it can come demagnitized. My cell phone was always in my front pocket and credit cards were no where near the room key. I have stayed in several hotels that use this system and never had a problem with there room keys.

Reviews.Title: “Love The Sleep Number Beds!”
Reviews.Author: ltlmsmfft
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel several times and love it. I always book a sleep number bed room and it is my favorite feature that sets this hotel apart from others. I get a nice firm bed and my friend has a nice soft bed. It is very close to the theme parks, in walking distance to convenience stores, other eateries and gift shops and it has it's own gift shop, counter food service, 2 bars and a sit down restaurant. The in room fridge was nice to have as well. We spent some time out by the pool on Saturday night and loved the karaoke. There were lots of kids and adults willing to get up and sing and there were also poolside movies for the kids. I was able to get a nice frozen margarita at the bar and our kids had a blast in the pool. In the past I have ordered room service and have been pleased with that. And my son loves the "checkers" tables they have in the lobby. It is a nice diversion while waiting for food. All in all I would recommend this hotel for conventions (there always seems to be one there) and families/ theme park goers.

Reviews.Title: “Get real people!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: huskerfansNebraska
Reviews.Content: Well, this was a great place to stay!!! We are from Nebraska and stayed down there for 2 weeks in not 1 but 2 rooms!!! They were in the north tower!!! We had no problems at all!!! We addressed all concerns with Rob the manager and he said that he would take care of everything!!! He did!!! So, people grow up and look at what you get when you are there!!! By the way, the pool stayed open 24 hrs, how many other hotels or resorts do you know of that do that??? They even put up a big screen TV for the kids to watch movies in the pool!!! They are renovating the south tower but big deal!!! It seems like half of the people that stay here are in need of a wake up call!!! The rooms yes, both of them were clean and had sleep by number beds!!! I might add I purchased these 2 rooms from Priceline for $45 a night and they upgraded us to the sleep by number rooms!!! So, to sum it up, grow up!!!! This hotel was very nice and I still would have not complained if I would have paid $100 a night for the rooms!!!

Reviews.Title: “Ok if your stay is short and not spent there too much”
Reviews.Author: jeannette2780
Reviews.Content: The hotel was not dirty, it was just sort of old and dingy. The room smelled musty, the ceiling in the shower had mold, the tub didn't look like anything I wanted to sit in (again, cleaned but still dirty looking) the carpet had stains, the double beds were uncomfortable (and the hotel claims to have Sleep Number beds in most of their rooms) and the mini-fridge smelled rotten. The shuttle to the parks was bad. 3 hotels worth of guests were picked up to go to Disney all on the same shuttle. Many people were standing. On the way back to the hotel, The shuttle was so smashed full of people that my husband, son and I were standing on the entryway stairs holding on for the 7 mile haul through thick traffic to the park. Overall, the 7 mile trip took about 45 minutes. There is a $6.95 resort fee (lol...resort). The only reason I won't complain about this is becuase it covers hotel parking and shuttle services, internet access and more...so it was a bargain. I can honestly say if you are looking for a cheap place to crash (priceline, $45 a night...on 4th of July weekend) this would serve the purpose. We live in Florida, so just came up to Disney for a day and spent very little time in the room. If I were on a longer vacation, I would not have wanted to be here. Not a great "resort"

Reviews.Title: “Loved the service”
Reviews.Author: Shorty14
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 13 days and it was overall really good. The room was not in the best shape however. The bathtub was chipped so we didn't want to bath in it, only shower. And the stucco on the ceiling in the bathroom was falling apart in areas. I think we got one of the older rooms as I seen they were renovating. But overall the rooms were clean and the cleaning staff did a wonderful job keeping the rooms cleaned and new towels every day. The pools were really nice and at night they would have live music and people singing so it was really nice to sit by the pool every night with a drink. They had the policy of no glass outside so I really liked that so no kids could cut thier feet. I found the staff to be amazing. They were so friendly. I don't think I have ever stayed at a hotel where the staff was this great. They were all very helpful with all our needs. They had free shuttle service to the parks so that was great and the driver was absolutly wonderful. We did have to do a resort tour as part of our package deal and that was nice to see the whole resort however we found that when we declined to buy a timeshare the saleswoman was very very rude! She seen us a few times after the tour and we got alot of dirty looks from her. So they are very pushy trying to sell you something. But I must say that over all our stay was good. I would maybe stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “not bad if you get a great rate”
Reviews.Author: jnb2375
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for $50 a night through Priceline. My boyfriend was in a golf tournament in the area that weekend, and the tournament was offering the same hotel at a "specail" price of $89. I would NOT have been happy if we had paid that price in the middle of the off season. The room was ok, actuallyu fairly spacious. The bathroom was tiny, and the tub was chipped, which made it look dirty all the time. The pool is small given the number of rooms. Overall, it is an ok stay, but definately not in the resort category, though there is a resort fee of $6.95 a night.

Reviews.Title: “I won't recommend it to anyone!”
Reviews.Author: freeridepoints
Reviews.Content: It's tricky that they have the so-called "Resort Fee" when it's not a resort. When I called and complained, they admitted that it was on the fine print when we booked the hotel. It is definitely not a 3-star hotel and let alone resort. Their so-called high speed internet is only 1mbps! That's very slow! Also, the room is old and not clean at all. The bath tub is terrible. With the resort fee they're charging, you can probably book a much better hotel else where. DON'T STAY HERE!!

Reviews.Title: “Horrible”
Reviews.Author: lynyang
Reviews.Content: I booked a room through Hotwire, thinking it was the 3-star they listed it as for our family vacation. Aside from the free bus shuttle to Disney World and the sleep number mattresses, everything else there was horrible. We spent one night at a relatives condo in the nearby area and the next day we returned, OUR ROOM WAS GIVEN TO SOMEONE ELSE! Yes, it was given away to someone else because they said they have the right to vacate rooms if there are no "major" personal belongings in there. I personally left a few shopping bags in the closet that thankfully no one took and books. We paid for 4 nights and only spent 2 nights there leaving us having to spend the rest of our vacation with relatives. I recommend that no one stay there. The front office manager CHRIS GOLDEN, wrote that we would be credited back one night, but even after contacting him, he simply ignored everything. I would rather pay an extra $100 for better service, quality rooms, and the insurance that my family would have a place to stay for the ENTIRETY of what we paid.

Reviews.Title: “This is not a resort...hotel is hit or miss and very tacky”
Reviews.Author: BellaDonnainDallas
Reviews.Content: I booked our room through priceline.com for $50ish/night for 4-5 days. This hotel as a whole does not represent a 3 star hotel. Of course, we were going to Disneyland. This hotel represents what tacky is. The place looks like it is from the 80s and needs desparate renovation. Our first room was old and very worn. I asked for another room and received a totally different room that was more modern and acceptable. The newer rooms represent a 3 star hotel. The pool is clean and it was great to go swimming in December. I think the pool is the best part about the hotel. There is a Pizza Hut located in the hotel. Service is slow. It took over 20 minutes to get our pizza. There is a gift shop that looked like a dollar store. Transportation to Disney is a nightmare. There is a specific schedule to each park and they run on a very strict schedule. The bus company will not wait one minute for you. I would highly suggest getting a rental car that allows you flexibility to go and leave from the parks on your own schedule. I have not had any pleasant or impressive experiences with the Radisson chains. They all need renovation.

Reviews.Title: “Bad Service. A lot of problems in the room”
Reviews.Author: Geraldoy
Reviews.Content: My family stayed in a room in a very bad conditions. There was a leak in the bathroom that was not fixed. The Shower temperature was crazy. Too hot or too cold. After reading the information on their website we were expecting continuous shuttle service but the shuttle service took you to the parks early in the day and did not return until late evening. The attendants were very unpolished and did not care about the customers problems. I do not recommnd this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Do Not Believe The Negative Comments On This Hotel”
Reviews.Author: amitreena
Reviews.Content: The Radisson world gate resort was awesome. I recently stayed there with my wife and we spent our 1 year marriage anniversary in orlando. With a lot of doubt from other remarks we booked this hotel thru a timeshare presentation. By the way checkout saveonresorts.com. You get excellent deals and the timeshare presentation myth is all bogus. Within 1 hour we did a tour and got our gifts. anyway.....this hotel was fantastic. the rooms were clean and big. we got a very nice sleep number bed. the bathroom was small but it was decent. the location was great many giftshops and restaurants in walking distance. disney world was very close and so was universal studios which made this hotel a great choice even though we were very scared booking here it ended being beautiful for us. the pools were nice and the restaurant had great happy hour specials. overall, do not believe what others say this was a great hotel

Reviews.Title: “Mediocore”
Reviews.Author: hattiedoll
Reviews.Content: My family stayed in a room on the unrenovated 3rd floor in the south tower. After reading the information on their website we were expecting continuous shuttle service and sleep number beds. Neither was available at the hotel. The shuttle service took you to the parks early in the day and did not return until late evening. You are stranded at the park for several hours if you use this service. Our bathroom was large, but the faucets on the tub were broken and hard to adjust. We found out that the hotel was being renovated into time share condos. Those rooms were amazing, but the unrenovated section is lacking. The major bonus of this hotel is that you are literally 2 minutes from Animal Kingdom.

Reviews.Title: “ok-ish”
Reviews.Author: travelmania208
Reviews.Content: Stayed here mid-May 2008. General area is ok, the usual chain restaurants, tacky gift stores, but it did'nt feel unsafe. Maingate Ln looks badly maintained but can't blame the hotel for this. From the outside the hotel looks jaded and dull. Inside is much the same. The lobby is bright and clean, food areas look tired, the pool area looks ok. Front desk staff very nice and helpful.We were given a sleep number bedroom so can't comment on the regular rooms. The room itself was clean but showed years of use: stained badly fitted carpet (gaps were present), dated well used furniture, patchwork overpainting on the walls, badly chipped bathtub. The beds were very comfortable and so were the pillows. One of the sleep number controls did'nt show the proper display....no big deal. Air-con worked efficiently if not a bit noisy. TV was ok. No noise from hallways or other guests. Parking seemed secure enough but we always parked in a well lit area. We did'nt use the shuttle to the themeparks. The location is good for access to major highways and to Disney. Overall, a lacklustre stay in an ok place. I did'nt feel we were ripped off but if the 'hotel experience' is a big part of your vacation, this is definitely NOT the place to stay. It seemed pretty quiet which may not suit some people. It's got everything you need but not much atmosphere. We did'nt get any hassle from timeshare / tour folk and only got two fliers under the door offering deals on pizza. If you get this place cheap ($60 or under) it's an ok deal.

Reviews.Title: “Watch Out”
Reviews.Author: NoVertigo
Reviews.Content: Radisson is an aging property that can be a good stay but I cannot recommend it. If they have problems, some things like a clogged drain they can take care of quickly. But if you show them insects and curtains that don't work right, a coffee try that is not cleaned, and an improperly cleaned bathtub, expect a running battle. Further, their locks on the doors are far too diffcult to get right. They should be upgraded or replaced. Enough said. Giving me a free night's stay is no way respond. After this failure, nothing could drag me back there. It will live in the annals of what customer service and quality control is NOT. Good "what not to do" material for every hospitality 101 course in the world. I gave them ample time and suggestions on how to remedy all of this and they still screwed it up!

Reviews.Title: “Fine”
Reviews.Author: cin123
Reviews.Content: Stayed here twice for business. I personally do not like this area but it was not my choice. Too many tacky shops and restaurants. Traffic is bad. But the hotel was fine both times. My room was clean, the bathroom very clean. Nice bed and new bedding. Everything worked. Had a small refrigerator. Room was a comfortable size. Lobbies nice and clean. Hallways quiet. Pool area nice. Did not try the restaurant it was always empty. Staff was pleasant but not very helpful. There's a Publix a little further west which was great to buy snacks and drinks for your room. Brought dinner back from there too and ate by the pool. Would recommend if the price was right.

Reviews.Title: “Lower than expectations”
Reviews.Author: sweepers
Reviews.Content: Purchased this hotel through Priceline for less than $50. The bed was hard as a rock. I remembered that Radisson's had sleep number beds, so I went back to the front desk to inquire. A $10 upgrade later, our new room smelled heavily of stale smoke. On the 3rd try, neither key worked. Finally gave up. After a long day of travelling and desiring to just relax in a nice, comfortable room, we made reservations at a nearby Homewood Suites and ate the $50 that was spent at the Radisson. (Got the $10 upgrade back.)

Reviews.Title: “I should have Listened”
Reviews.Author: iwilltellthetruth1
Reviews.Content: I read the reviews on this website and I did not believe them. I booked this hotel by way of Orlando vacations.com. This hotel is awful, the room was dirty, the carpet was nasty and it smelled really bad. I wanted my vacation to be perfect and I really thought that I got a good deal on a hotel but I was robbed of my happiness. I read the reviews and I was so afaird I called the hotel to cancel but the man told me I was getting a suite, so I stayed. What he called a suite was a double bed with a small refridge in the coner. There was old pee on the seat in the bathroom. I wanted to cry!!!!! Don't stay at this hotel....It looks like a pay by the hour hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Decent Value”
Reviews.Author: mefMaine
Reviews.Content: For the amount of money that we paid for this hotel, I thought that it was adequate. If you can get the hotel at a decent rate, then it is worthwhile, otherwise I probably wouldn't choose to stay here. The positives were: convenient location, friendly staff, nice pool area with a heated and an unheated pool, outdoor bar, pizza hut pizza available poolside, hottub with cascading waterfall. Downsides: hallways smell musty and have dated decor, lounge is tacky, restaurant is nothing special, rooms are nothing special...attracts a lot of teenagers and groups....probably because of the cheap rates.

Reviews.Title: “Better than I was prepared for”
Reviews.Author: jgonzkville
Reviews.Content: After reading some reviews I approached the hotel with more than a bit of apprehension. I was not looking forward to my stay here but since it was just for one night and my family and I were coming in very late from a day at Epcot I was prepared to make the most of it. To my surprise our stay was very nice. Now I do not call this a resort like they do, but it is a nice hotel. Positives: Wifi, bath amenities, safe, mini-fridge, quiet (I was in the North tower 4th floor), easy to find, near good selection of resturants, close to Disney World, friendly staff, two pools with one being a qiet pool and it is open late Negatives: Although clean and redone over still has slight signs of an older hotel, resort fee of $6 (ugh) So if you got a good price say on priceline (which I did) this is a nice hotel close to Disney world. Not a resort but a good hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: gia27
Reviews.Content: I read many bad reviews on this hotel. We booked through a timeshare and the hotel was great for the money! They are in the process of renovating. The room was fine, not dirty. We had sleep number beds. We were barely in the room so it was perfect for us. It was nice having the bar and pizza hut express since we got back so late one night. We did not feel like going anywhere to eat. It was in a great location, close to the parks. We did not use the shuttle. We rented a car.

Reviews.Title: “convention hell”
Reviews.Author: blue8
Reviews.Content: the holiday from hell. Booked a 4 star hotel got a three star convention/time share experience. First week biker convention couldnt get in the car park as all were full. Got rid of them 5 high schools had a convention! Screaming kids running around floors until 2am! Last night 1,000 guest wedding reception no sleep that night either! Got a drink in bar depending on whether they were too busy to bother with you. Some of the staff were lovely. Manager I complained too was sympathetic got a 25 dollar food voucher, not bad when u consider I spent £4,000 on flights spending money and hotel! Cleaner was brilliant. Dont get sucked into the Worldgate Resort glossy name. Worst place and most expensive i have stayed in my 25 years of visiting the states!

Reviews.Title: “We thought it was fine”
Reviews.Author: lovetogoI0wa
Reviews.Content: We just returned from Orlando, and stayed at this resort on a Thursday evening before our cruise, then Mon-Thursday following the cruise. The first night we had a double room (we had requested a king) with a sleep number bed (which we had requested) - it was clean and comfortable, the bed was very comfortable. Check in was efficient and the staff was able to answer our questions. The hot tub was quite warm, and the pool was nice with plenty of pool towels. They have a two-for-one drink special from 4 - 7 daily. We ate in the restaurant there one evening and has come great quesadillas and nachos. Our last 4 days were in the requested King size room. The in-room refrigerators have obviously been added since the resort was built, so don't fit really well in the space given, but kept the beverages cold, so we couldn't complain. The fitness room had 4 machines, I believe, but we did so much walking at Disney, etc., that we didn't need that room. The internet concection was sometimes slow. It is a fine resort for families and a few nights stay. WE did utilize the shuttle bus one day, but they had more people that really should have been crowded on the bus, and had 3 times going to the Disney complex and 3 later times returning, so you pretty much had to plan to spend a good share of the day there and not come and go, which would be a draw back with kids. The good part was not paying the $11 they charge each time you park at a Disney complex. Overall, we were pleasantly surprised. We only had 1 request of the staff, and they responded quickly and solved the problem.

Reviews.Title: “Only If You Get a Bargain”
Reviews.Author: web2110
Reviews.Content: Radisson Worldgate is an okay property if you get a bargain rate. As other reviewers have noted, it is a well-worn property and probably not up to 3-star standards. Its also not much of a resort - the fitness center is basically 2 old treadmills, the pool is tiny, and there are a couple of non-descript restaurants. Along with a couple of dog-eared tennis courts, that is pretty much all there is to this "resort". Also, I found the beds surprisingly uncomfortable. I regularly go camping and am used to sleeping on the ground, so hotel beds are normally not an issue with me. So, while I didn't lose any sleep as a result, the mattress/box springs at this Radisson were of the quality you'd normally expect at a Motel 6. On the positive side, the hotel is relatively clean, and the staff was quite friendly. Also, Disney World is literally next door to this hotel (Sherbeth Rd. by the entrance will take you to Disney property in 5 minutes).

Reviews.Title: “the beds are the only redeeming quality of this dump.....”
Reviews.Author: purplealegria
Reviews.Content: Me and my husband were driving up from south FL for a two night stay. We both work nights, and were coming straight from work. So we needed to sleep before we could go to the parks. I called the front desk and they told me that we could have a early check in. They told us that we could check in at 11:00 am. so we got there at 12:00. They told us that we could not check in, and keep trying. we came back at 2:00. 3:00, and it was that same. No check in. Thay finally told us that check in is at 4:00. We told them that we spoke to someone and they told us we could check in at 11:00. No dice. She just shrughed her shoulders and said check in is at 4:00. Needless to say we were LIVID!!!! We wasted a whole day at the parks because we were so tired, we had to sleep and did not make it to the park. If we would have known that there was no early check in, we would have went home and slept, then drove up later, as to not waste one of our precious vacation days. Don't believe these front desk people. they are liars. The staff is rude as hell, and the rooms are old looking. The beds are the only good thing about this place.

Reviews.Title: “First Time Radisson Stay”
Reviews.Author: wahoo59
Reviews.Content: Pros - I was able to switch rooms and basically upgrade to the select comfort beds at no additional charge. The first room was on the very end and had the most uncomfortable bed in the joint. If it wasn't for this upgrade, my visit and review would be even worse. Cons - I don't know about you, but when the door sits an inch and a half above the floor, do you feel safe. I had to use pillows at night to cover the gapping crack along the floor to feel semi safe at night. The other safety concern is access to the hotel. None of the outside Key Card Entries worked, so security was null and void. Housekeeping failed to clean my room one day and didn't restock amenities such as shampoo, conditioner, and lotion. The carpet was stained with pizza sauce and other food. Housekeeping did make an attempt to clean the carpet, but were a little to late in my opinion. Lastly, Radisson charged resort fees that were supposed to cover self parking, heated pool, and a bunch of other crap. I wasn't made aware of these fees at check-in. Basically, they had my credit card and didn't care what I had to say. Internet reception was spotty at best and the speed was slow. Hot tub was at a good temp, but failed miserably when turned on. Bottom line, I'd never knowingly choose to book a room in this hotel. Unfortunately my stay was not good at the property.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay, service, bed and price! Very pleased.”
Reviews.Author: PuppyTravels
Reviews.Content: We were a little worried after reading some of the reviews, but really wanted to try out the sleepnumber bed! We made reservations last minute and unfortunately only a non sleepnumber bed room was avail with 2 doubles (we wanted a king) It was a great price and perfect location though so we took it anyway. We checked in and there was only one person ahead of us, were helped within 5 mins. They UPGRADED us to a King sleepnumber bed room for free! The woman helping us couldn't have been nicer and actually apologized for the wait - which was so short! Room was extremely clean (not sure what others were talking about, nothing was run down, old, scuffed or rusted at all!) Maybe there are some bad rooms, but ours was not at all. Bathroom was spotless and tub was huge, the sleepnumber was GREAT, we had tons of channels to watch and there was a sofa/desk/fridge. Not one complaint (except that it was raining!) Checkout was quick and easy and the price was great. The hotel has tons of stuff - gym, shops, restaurants and room service which we didn't use but are great extras for this price. Would definitely recommend - but I would definitely make sure you get a sleepnumber room, they seem to be the better ones and possibly the ones redone. Also - location was great, only a few minute drive to Disney and tons of restaurants nearby (We went to Fridays, but there are all levels from McD's to nicer seafood places)

Reviews.Title: “Old, Neglected and Definately Not 3 Stars”
Reviews.Author: michtraveler1969
Reviews.Content: I suspect that there might be a wide variety of room qualities at this "resort" since there is no way that anyone could rate this property highly based on the room we received. When approaching the hotel from the road it appears nice and indeed the lobby is very nice and inviting. We were given our room and parked the car in the area recommended by hotel staff. While walking up to the hotel you could see the age of the building. Rust stains running down the building from top to bottom. The hallways were in good shape. Entering the room was like entering a different world. Cheap dollar store furnishings, carpet that had to have been ready for replacement in the 90's. The bed in our room was probably from 10 years prior to the carpet (no sleep number to be found in THIS room). The beds were uncomfortable and saggy with springs poking at you all night long. The bathroom looked like something out of a war zone. Scuffed, stained countertops, wallpaper peeling and paint cracking and chipping from the noticably water damaged ceiling. While the shower had good pressure and hot water was plentiful the tub itself was nothing short of a disgrace. The tub was warped, cracked and so old you couldn't begin to determine whether or not it had been cleaned in the last 10 years or not. This is nowhere near typical Radisson quality and to call this "resort" anything higher than a 2 star establishment is in my opinion close to an outright lie.

Reviews.Title: “It was functional”
Reviews.Author: weegl
Reviews.Content: We stayed just one night Saturday January 12 at this resort. The facility was fine for its age and the discount price we paid...rooms were clean, water hot, TV fine and the new sleep number beds were a nice touch. The young lady at the desk that checked us in was quite friendly and we asked and received a role-away bed in just a few minutes. Would I pay $120+ / night? Not likely. But for the rate it met our expectations nicely.

Reviews.Title: “Worth checking out”
Reviews.Author: AriesJ412
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews about the hotel I was a little edgy about staying here. Once my boyfriend and I pulled up into the hotel parking lot and were greeted by the hotels fountains, we knew that we made the right choice by staying here. The check in was a breeze, and as we made our way through the hotel we stepped outside into the pool area, which was surrounded by torches; very pretty! Our room was basic, no complains. We ate one dinner and a couple of breakfasts at their café; it was all good.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel, Excellent Location. . . JUST EXCELLENT”
Reviews.Author: GuyanaBoy
Reviews.Content: From the Moment I arrived, I knew I was at the right place. This is a beautiful Resort Hotel, just a mile from Walt Disney World. In fact, I could see the Animal Kingdom from the window in my room. Check in was a breeze, bell staff went above and beyond the call of duty, and the Room was WONDERFUL. I stayed here for three days, and could not have asked for a better place to stay. Free Internet, excellent room (with Select Comfort King Size Bed), even Marble tile on the Bathroom floor. Several swimming pools, a jacuzzi, several choices for eating (including a Pizza Hut in the HOTEL LOBBY), convenience store in the lobby, gym, and everything else you would be looking for in a fine hotel. EVEN WASHERS AND DRYERS for guests to use. I stayed here on business, but this is a GREAT Vacation spot as well. I highly recommend this Hotel and WILL be back. You won't go wrong here.

Reviews.Title: “Its not that bad.. but its not great”
Reviews.Author: dm1313
Reviews.Content: When i read the reviews on this hotel i really was concerned! I emailed the hotel to direct them to the reviews here and they didnt reply - this worried me more! I took the precaution of putting a request in via their website for one of the new rooms on the South Side. When we arrived all was in order and we got a "newer" room - the room was just ok. The bathroom was awful - the shop was like a drip and it looked like the bathrooms definitly needed rennovated! Used the pools a few times and they also seemed ok. I think this hotel is changing into some kind of time share property though - we had a woman who tortured us ringing the room offering free cash, free attraction tickets for 3 hours of our time which was annoying - we just stopped answering the room phone. In summary its not bad but its definitly not a 3 star!! So if its a 3 star your after i would try somewhere else!

Reviews.Title: “A little rough, but sufficient accommodations”
Reviews.Author: smootchick
Reviews.Content: LOCATION/PARKING: The Radisson Worldgate Resort is located in the maingate area of Disney in Kissimmee. Located off Highway 192, it is accessible from I-4 and other main roads. A drive to Disney World is about 5-10 minutes depending on which resort you are visiting. Parking is free, but included in a "resort fee" you will be charged of $4.95 per day. There were generous parking spaces over the weekend I visited, and it was not a problem to find a space reasonably close to a hotel entrance. The area around the hotel is surrounded by other hotels, a few restaurants, gas stations, and souvenir shops. DINING: The Radisson hosts several dining options in-house. The Savannah Grille is a sit-down restaurant with American and Caribbean cuisine. I did not eat there, so I cannot comment on the quality. There is also the Pralines Food Court with Pizza Hut Express, Starbucks coffee, and lots of other "grab-n-go" options like Vitamin Water, sodas, fruit, chips, and other snacks. A Vitamin Water and a bottle of Dasani water put me back over $6, so be prepared if you plan to eat here. Outside the hotel, there are a few restaurant choices including Red Lobster, Angel's Seafood, and Perkins, but there isn't a ton in the area in general. ATMOSPHERE: Pretty basic hotel, nothing fancy, very casual feel. I think this resort is intended for families who want to save a few bucks by not staying on Disney properties. There are two pools to enjoy, basketball and tennis courts, a fitness center, free wireless internet in your room, laundry facilities, and business center. There is a small game room on the lobby level as well as a children's "theater" showing Disney movies for children throughout the day. There is also a sundries shop in case you forgot something. The decor is unremarkable, very simple and no features that really stand out. THE ROOMS: We stayed in a 2nd floor room of the South tower, which is apparently an older section of the hotel. The hallway was clean and vacuumed. When we entered the room, there was a strong scent of cleaner and the room felt a little damp. My boyfriend said the carpet was wet, and he thought maybe they'd just cleaned them. Still, there were very noticeable stains all over the carpet, like juice, soda, and not sure what else. I booked the room for $45 on Priceline so I wasn't expecting their best room. The hotel advertises Sleep Number beds, but they were not in our room. In their guidebook, it says a small percentage of rooms do not have Sleep Number beds. Guess we were in that small percentage. The mattresses were fine, but very springy and you could tell they were slightly older. I'm always paranoid about sheets and bedspreads. The sheets were clean, but the velour blanket had many black hairs all over it. I didn't inspect the bedspread but pushed it back so that it only covered my legs. The bathroom was quite small, and to maneuver around to the shower you had to shut the door. The shower itself had seen better days. It was an oversized garden tub with white cloth shower curtain. There were a ton of chips on the bottom surface and also where the soap goes. The handle where you adjust water temperature needed some caulk as there was a gap between it and the wall. Included in the room was a TV (DirecTV was advertised as a hotel feature, but we did not have it in our room- in fact, some of the channels had moderate interference and weren't really watchable), small refrigerator, wall unit air conditioner, coffee pot with coffee and tea selections, desk with executive chair, alarm clock, hair dryer, shampoo, conditioner, lotion, shower cap, and bath mitt. Overall, I wasn't really impressed with the room. It was worn around the edges, the hairs on the blanket freaked me out a little and I've seen much better rooms for the same price in Orlando. SERVICE: Checking in was a breeze and the person behind the counter was very courteous and friendly. I can't comment on maid service because we had the Do Not Disturb sign up all weekend. We didn't use many of the hotel's services so it's difficult to say how you will be treated. OVERALL: Location is good if you want to be close to Disney but not pay $300 a night at their resorts. Good for families with lots of activities and features. Might be worth it to pay full price for a Sleep Number room, as they are probably renovated.

Reviews.Title: “I was terrified by your review however was fooled”
Reviews.Author: dhelmintoller
Reviews.Content: I was terrified after reading the reveiws written about this hotel however you shouldnt always beleive everything you hear as i was fooled. The front desk people were very nice and pleasant and helpful. The rooms were fine. I admit there was a few nicks and dings here and there but it was nothing like you people make it out to be. I never seen a bug, trash or anything out of the ordinary. The housekeeping was great also. They came and did their thing everday. I even heard them a couple of time vacuming the hallways. We ate at the restuarant as well as the pizza hut inside and they were both great. The pool was fine too. We stayed at the hotel for 7 nights and was very impressed.

Reviews.Title: “Horrific Stay!!!!! Please take the time to read this!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: mwells426
Reviews.Content: We (family of four) were only to stay here one night after returning from our cruise. We arrived late (9pm) to check-in. Upon checking in we were directed to pull around and park near the north tower to access our room. We were never offered any help with our baggage. Taking my own baggage to my room is never a problem but on this night there was a constant heavy rain and the walk from the parking lot to the north tower entrance was about 120 feet with no canopy. I pulled back around to the main entrance to unload my baggage. I requested help at the front desk but was told there was no bellperson available at the moment so we were on our own. When we got to our (first) room we started to get comfortable and realized our room was already occupied by ANTS!!!! My wife called the front desk to tell them about this problem and they offered to come and SPRAY the room. My nine year old son has asthma so this was not an option for us. After putting my wife on hold for about five minutes the front desk reluctantly offered us another room. They said they would send a "Bellman" up with the keys to our new room. Fifthteen minutes earlier there was no "Bellman" available. We waited in a ANT infested room for about ten minutes before the "Bellman" knocked on the door with our new room keys. We gathered our baggage and lugged it up to the 4th floor with no help from the "Bellman" that just gave us a new set of keys. We opened the door to the new room and it had a very strong mildew smell. Once I sat on the bed I then realized everything in this room was WET!!! Comforters, beds, carpet, everything DAMP!!!! It was if it had rained in the room!!! I went down to the front desk to have this problem corrected. With no apology, I was given the keys to another room with no offer to help move my baggage. As I was walking back to the (second) room to gather our things to move to "another" room, the front deck manager approached me and said "the keys that he had just given me was to a room that was already occupied". He asked me to please be patience and he would have the "Bellman" bring me up "another" set of keys. The "Bellman" rushed right up with our new set of keys but never offered to help move our baggage. Lucky for us the new (third) room was only four doors down the hall. The new (third) room had no ants and was not damp so we were OK until we showered and got in bed. Very worn and very uncomfortable beds!!!! We were so tired and beaten that we made the best it. This is a very true story so you have been warned, NEVER AGAIN!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great”
Reviews.Author: wonderlife
Reviews.Content: I stay at the radisson worldgate and I must said that my stay was awsome the staff was the best I have ever seen upon check in the front desk greeted me with a smile and a warm weclome I felt like I was home the housekeeping dept was great refresh all items daily! I must say I will be back to this hotel my overall stay was wonderful great staff in every dept.

Reviews.Title: “Close to the parks, worn around the edges”
Reviews.Author: Buckfalfa
Reviews.Content: After reading the horror stories on TripAdvisor, I was relieved to find that, while the hotel really isn't in anything resembling a 3-star condition maintenance-wise, it was a perfectly adequate place to stay if you were willing to overlook the imperfections. I was impressed by all of the hotel staff (although none of the front desk staff were willing to cut me a break on the absurd extra "resort fee" charge that they added to my priceline reservation.) The beds were always immaculately remade every day and everyone was friendly and helpful. Our first room was on the seventh floor- we quickly asked to move as the popcorn-type ceiling had water damage bubbling. Our next room on the sixth floor was fine, though almost everything in the room felt worn or water-damaged (with the exception of the sleep-number beds and nice bedding.) The AC worked fine, the beds were comfortable, and the TV had a nice selection of channels. The central pool was fun- they had tiki-torch lights at night and there was constantly nice island-style music playing throughout the day. The South Tower pool, however, looked to be in need of a good cleaning- we skipped it entirely. I have to say that the lack of bright outdoor lighting in the surrounding neighborhood and the "open door" feel of the side entrances to the hotel didn't exactly inspire me with a safe and secure feeling late in the evenings. We didn't test the shuttles buses, but I would recommend that anyone who doesn't plan on renting a car while at Disney stay on-Disney-property if only for the superior bus services. One nice thing we found was that there is a "back entrance" road to the Animal Kingdom theme park just one block over from the hotel. Getting back and forth to the parks for afternoon breaks was a snap, and provided a nice opportunity for our young ones to get a second wind during the day. All in all I wouldn't rush my friends or family to go and stay at the Radisson Resort Worldgate, but I wouldn't tell them to worry too much if they got stuck with a Priceline reservation for this hotel (I just hope they didn't pay much more than 50 bucks a night!)

Reviews.Title: “Horrible! Beware!”
Reviews.Author: pinklady08
Reviews.Content: I had to stay here because this was the host hotel for my family reunion. This was, by far, one of the worst hotels I've ever stayed at. Although you can tell that this hotel was once very nice, it hasn't been well-maintained, and it is undergoing a conversion to a timeshare property. For this reason, there is very little customer service offered. It takes 15 min. to get your car valet parked or to get a bellman to assist you with bags. Each time I had to call the front desk (for questions or to ask for extra towels), I had to call at least twice just to get someone to answer the phone. The rooms were equally bad. Fortunately, I was in an upgraded room attached to the hospitality room. The other rooms, from my observation when I visited my family members, had warped mattresses; worn carpet, musty smells, and the bathrooms had rusted fixtures, constantly-running toilets, and stained upholstery on the furniture. My own room was in better condition, but I did note that the curtains were dusty, there were some stains on the carpet, and some of the bathroom fixtures were beginning to rust. The tub in my room also had patches, from being previously repaired. There is not enough room for all guests to eat breakfast. For that reason, I felt a bit rushed by the wait. It was a common practice, as almost every room-purchasing adult in my family received one, for the hotel to give out food tickets and free night stays when there was a problem. and there was a plethora of problems. Many of my family members' rooms were not ready when they arrived. I saw many people sitting for hours waiting on their rooms to get ready. I arrived at the hotel at 3:00, and my room was not available until after 8:00. I received a free night and a food voucher. I could go on and on with the problems encountered here: an extensive power outage, long waits for the elevator, bland restaurant food, ripped sheets, etc., but I simply don't have enough time. I will NEVER stay at this hotel again. The next time we have a family reunion, everyone will just have to be willing to pay more money...more than the $79 nightly rate we were charged!

Reviews.Title: “Stay Away”
Reviews.Author: msmall
Reviews.Content: I spent 3 nights at this hotel. We chose to stay here because we brought a group on a charter bus and they had accommodations at a villa that did not allow charter bus parking. Our first night in Orlando we stayed at the Best Western Kissimmee Inn, which was great, but on the other side of Hwy 192 and we felt it was a bit too far from our group. The room at the Radisson was a king room with sleep number bed. The carpet was filthy. The bathroom shower had mold and mildew everywhere. I had to go and buy a gallon of Clorox to clean the shower before we could use it. After cleaning four times, the shower did become clean - imagine that, all it needed was some cleaner. The furniture had a lot of water damage where I assume the air conditioner had somehow leaked water on it - it had rotted a lot of the wood. The room had a musty smell, hallways were extremely warm, and guests side entrances smelled of urine. We were in room 108. The staff was very friendly and helpful but the property and accommodations were substandard. If this hotel had rates for 19.99 then I would say it's a great deal; anything above that and you need to make a reservation at the Best Western Kissimmee Inn (formerly Baymont suites).

Reviews.Title: “Nice staff, bad everything else”
Reviews.Author: Canechick82
Reviews.Content: We decided to stay at this resort based on the hotel's website, the pictures on said website, and its close proximity to the conference we were attending. Positives: the friendly and courteous staff, reasonably priced cafe and restaurant, Sleep Number beds Negatives: not the cleanest of hotels, not in the nicest area I have to say that the staff was wonderful. Our requests for extra pillows and towels were promptly met, with phone calls to follow-up and make sure the items were delivered to our satisfaction. The room we were given had a sleep number bed which, although not the most comfortable bed, is not common in other hotels. Our bathroom was spacious but not very clean. The large Roman bathtub had a rusty drain and mildew ring around the base of the tub, and even a couple of hairs on the rim of the tub. The water temperature was ridiculous....the knobs are not marked and it is impossible to tell which way to turn the knobs to make the water warmer or colder. There was a large blue stain on the yellow carpet in the corner, the lightbulbs are so dim you might as well work by candlelight, the mini fridge was broken (as was the safe), and the wireless highspeed internet would not work. While our stay was not horrible, it was not the best. I wouldn't recommend this hotel, but it's definitely not the worst I've stayed in.

Reviews.Title: “Bang on the money! Location supurb!”
Reviews.Author: traceysow
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel as part of a 2 week holiday with TravelCityDirect. It was marked up as a 3* 'HI-5' property. For the price we paid we were not expecting a stay at the ritz, but after reading reviews were dreading what we would find. On arrival we were pleasantly suprised. The rooms were spacious and clean with daily maid service. The staff were all extremely friendly and polite and the restaurant was moderatly priced. The location to Disney is absolutly fantastic and there are lots of restaurants/shops close by. If you want to visit Disney on a low budget, but still acceptable, then I would definitly recommend a stay at the Radison.

Reviews.Title: “Free Lizards With Each Room”
Reviews.Author: toyotamatrix91
Reviews.Content: This is one of the worst resorts I have ever stayed at. It's location off of SR-192 tucked in between rip-off dollar stores and gift shops was ultimately unappealing. Trying to get out of the resort and/or trying to turn into the resort is also an obstacle of its own. As I arrived at the "resort" I was instantly turned-off by it. I hadn't even gone inside yet. Our room was on the 3rd floor of the North Tower. (I would advise you to avoid the North Tower). The place was unbelievablely dirty. Everywhere I looked was dirt and utter filth. The rooms were so outdated. The carpets were dirty and stained, the furniture was worn and dilapidated looking. The beds were like sleeping on the ground. (I did pay for a hotel room, not a camp site). Didn't I? And the bathroom was dirty. There was mold on the shower and overall, it was just dirty. The outside of the resort, like the inside of the resort, was nothing to look at either. The pool looked dirty as did the people inside. I was not interested in going in. I did not try the hotel restaurant, but I did try the Pizza Hut, which was not as bad as I expected it to be. Another issue would be the lack of safety. The door on the outside stairs leading to the parking lot could easily be opened by just reaching at the top (where there was a large gap) and pulling it open. And the few lights in the parking lot was not too appealing either. One other safety issue would be the flyers constantly being thrown under the doors. Why do they continue to allow this? A hotel employee hasn't noticed a man or women with a large stack of flyers in their hands throwing them under each door? One would think that the hotel is in business with these scam-artists. With these "unknown" people walking through the hotel (at all hours of the night), I did not feel safe walking through the hotel alone. But this isn't even the point of my review. On the last day I decided to stay in the room. I was watching television and I happened to hear an odd noise in the room. I glanced over towards the closet and saw a lizard, yes a lizard, running in and out of the closet. Although seeing lizards are commonplace in Florida, I certainly did not expect to find one in my room. I was most certainly not pleased. This hotel, not a resort should be rated 2 or less stars. It's condition is appaling and all should avoid this place. And I would hope that no one would pay full price for this hotel. You can stay at so many other nice places that are actual resorts in the area. (For a similar price). Avoid this hotel at all cost!

Reviews.Title: “Not my favorite”
Reviews.Author: Leoli70
Reviews.Content: Previously posted reviews scared me enough to contact Hotwire about whether or not this hotel should be considered a 3 star property. They assured me it was. We stayed 8/24-8/29. Upon arrival, we were sent to room 418. It was damp, cold and looked like it was last furnished in 1975. The air conditioning wasn't alleviating the humidity problem after the first night so I went down to the front desk and was immediately given a new room. The new room was better. It had been slighlty upgraded with sleep number beds, new linens and a new working air conditioner. The stay we had was satisfactory now that the room was dry, but the hotel was still a bit runned down. The side doors are opened all the time with no security locks. The whole place has a wet musty smell. I found out later that because it was slow season, we got upgraded to the "renovated" room without charge. It normally would have cost $10 per night to upgrade. The hotel also charges a "resort fee" for any rooms booked through a third party vendor such as Hotwire, as we did. It amounts to about $5 a day. Location was great if you're going to Disney, but I would not stay here again. I think this is a 2.5 star property at best. At least we didn't have any bedbugs.

Reviews.Title: “Absolute Nightmare”
Reviews.Author: hartopp
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel based on the brand Radisson which generally has a good reputation. We arrived at the hotel late in the evening with two children after a long flight. We were shown to our room, which was supplied with a double bed, a cot and single bed for my 5 year old son. The room was smelly, the furniture was tired, the walls were scuffed and the carpet was torn. I demanded a room change but was told nothing could be done until the next morning. We reluctantly stayed 1 night in the room. The manager Keith went out of his way to ensure our room was changed the next day. We were grateful to be given a junior suite which was of a definite better standard. However, we found the pools to be dirty, the staff running the restaurants did not seem interested and generally we had a higher expectation of hotels in Orlando which this did not meet up to. Also, the closing of restaurant at 10pm was not helpful. The Radisson brand attached to this hotel is misleading.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad for the money”
Reviews.Author: bullmercdw
Reviews.Content: This is an honest review, both good and bad. We had 3 rooms booked. Check in is at 4pm? Really, 4pm? We got checked into one room at 3pm, one at 4:30pm, and the 3rd wasnt ready until almost 7pm. It says sleep number beds, but they are not in every room, and cost an additional $10 a night. The pool was nice but needed to have all of the lotion/scum scrubed from the water line. The rooms were average. The bathrooms were below average. I wouldn't let my daughter take a bath in our tub due to the grime. I asked to have it cleaned twice. I finally bought some Comet and a scrubber. It appears the tubs have been refinished because all I did was remove some of the finish. The staff was extremely friendly all around. The food in both resturaunts was pretty good, although I did find a short curyly black hair in one of my salads. Room service was great. The bus service to the parks is a pain. Limited run times and often standing room only. They did switch bus companies 2 days before we left. Overall, it was not a bad hotel for what we paid ($60 a night per room). We have decided that next time we go to Disney, we will stay at one of their resorts. The monorail is the way to go for easy access to the parks and back, and the hotels were spotless there. Living by this hotels bus schedule pretty much means you have to leave before 8am, and are lucky if you get back by 11:15pm. That makes for a long day if you have young kids. It would be nice to be able to go back to the hotel for a break now and again and then return to the parks. You get what you do, or don't, pay for!

Reviews.Title: “nice but wet”
Reviews.Author: hubert49
Reviews.Content: the staff at the hotel were as friendly as possible. That is the ones who worked there who had been in this country for a week or two, This would be about 2 or 3 in total. Our room was neet but wet. The floor against the far wall from the bed was soaking wet .it was from condensation leaking from the small refridgerator on the floor.. The brochure stated that the hotel was equiped with a starbucks and pizza hut. The starbucks consisted of now {now prepair for this!} two hot pots of coffee. One pot decaff and one regular. What a hoot. I have had alot of coffee in my life but none could prepair me for the fluid I had attempted to drink that morning. We had two coffee's and three muffins that came to $25.00ish . we ended up throwing that alien brew out in the parking lot on our way to disney. The pizza hut area had pictures on the wall but at no time during our stay had I seen any movement or smell anything that would make me think that it had existed. The keys for the room were magnitized and they were always needing to be reprogramed. There are sometimes when comming back from disney that one might need to enter your room in a hurry , If you know what I mean. The time next time ,we attempt disney and orlando , I may have found employment and can afford a dry hotel. These are the fact's as I saw them. I do hope that you can bennefit from this and no matter what , you have a safe and happy vacation

Reviews.Title: “Had a Great Time”
Reviews.Author: lovetotravel058
Reviews.Content: I recently attended a wedding held at the Radisson WorldGate Resort, and I was very impressed not only with the sleeping rooms, which were very spacious, clean and comfortable, but with the hotel staff overall. Everyone was very friendly, and most of the hotel employees walked through the foyer and the hallways with smiles on their faces, and they were not afraid to say ‘hello.’ The ballroom where the reception was held was beautifully and elaborately decorated. I was told that one man does most of the decorations, and he is truly gifted. Accent lights were used to feature the cake table and the gift table, and the head table was festooned with a string of lights muted by lace fabric. The banquet staff was sharply dressed, and the service was impeccable. The overall quality of the food was outstanding, and when I ate in the restaurant, I was pleased to discover that my meal there was just as good, if not better, than my meal in the banquet hall. I used to work in the hospitality industry, and I know that working with the public day after day can sometimes be a challenge, but the staff at the Radisson WorldGate seemed to understand the concept that the customer came first, no matter what. I have recommended this hotel to my friends, and would definitely return there again if the opportunity ever presented itself. Perhaps for my next vacation. . . D. Lansdale

Reviews.Title: “Not a place i would ever stay at again!!!”
Reviews.Author: AnnaBoston_Mass
Reviews.Content: My family and i decided last minute that we wanted to take the kids to Disney. I searched around and got a great deal on "save on resorts.com" Biggest mistake i tell ya.. This hotel is definitely not a 3-Star hotel. The room we were staying in was absolutely dirty. The bathroom floor looked like it had not been mopped or waxed for a very long time. We wore our sandals the entire time we were in the room. Not only was the bathroom tiny it also had no ventilations, so it gave off an awful smell. My biggest pet peave is finding other peoples hair on the bedding. That was the absolute last straw. We tried calling around to other hotels for vacancies, but given that this was the peak of the season for Disney we were unsuccessful. This was not a relaxing vacation for me at all. Honestly, i'm not big on complaining but i had to voice my opinion on this one. So take it from me, this is not a place i would spend my hard working money on. Not really kid-friendly either..

Reviews.Title: “Almost worth it”
Reviews.Author: hd112596
Reviews.Content: We checked into this hotel after checking out of the disgusting Ramada across the street. The rooms were ok. They were clean and everything worked well. I don't know that it's worth the $85/night we paid, but the service was good. I don't recommend the restaurant. The food is mediocre for the price, although again, the staff is great. We had some issues with the shuttle transportation. It was always late. I highly recommend a rental car. Avis is on site. They also have a very good taxi service on site if you don't want to deal with parking charges. Overall, it was good, but if you are going for the theme parks then I recommend staying at Disney or Universal for the money.

Reviews.Title: “are you kidding”
Reviews.Author: alwaysprn
Reviews.Content: I have to say after reading the reviews booking this hotel made me alittle nervous. What are peoples expectations? I found this hotel very clean, staff very pleasant and always had a smile and hello as they walked by. The manager ROB was a visable person walking around checking out areas and the staff. I actually saw him pitching in and helping the staff a few times clearing tables, stocking towels. I witness one guest being very inapproiate and yelling at this manger and it amazed me how professional he remained. All in all I would give the staff a 9/10. People reveiws complained that the back pool was dirty. That would be the guests fault, it amazed me how guest would leave trash by their chairs and walk away. Of course there are some leaves in the pool trees surround the pool for shade. This is a Radisson property not the Dolphin Disney resort. I realize that consumers always want alittle more than what they pay for and in my opinion I got this with the price I paid for hotel. We visit Florida every few years and this was our first time at this resort and we would not hesitate to stay at this resort again.

Reviews.Title: “Very Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: runaway1Kissimmee
Reviews.Content: I have always thought of the Radisson Hotel as quality chain of hotels. After my stay at this location, I beg to differ. Upon my arrival, the initial room was extremely dirty, the carpet was soiled, and the bathroom was a digrace. I requested another room which was not much better. I would've left if I had not made reservations and was familiar with the area. This hotel was totally misrepresented online. The beds were not sleep number as was indicated online, and housekeeping forgot to replenish the towels in the room one day. I had to call the front desk twice before I received towels. The fitness center left alot to be desired; the equipment was outdated and damaged, and I had to request towels for the fitness center. I would not recommend this hotel to anyone until the renovations that were indicated to be already done online are completed.

Reviews.Title: “don't stay here”
Reviews.Author: sun_11
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Radisson for two nights with another couple from July 5 - 7. We travel every few weeks and have stayed at countless hotels, and I can say with total confidence that this was THE WORST stay that we have ever had. This will be lengthy, but you guys should definitely read through it. Our friends booked a standard King room and we got an executive suite. Day #1: After checking in, we went to settle in. My husband and I realized right away that we had been given a standard king room, NOT the suite we had booked. I called our friends' room to let them know that we'd be switching rooms, and was disgusted to hear that the front desk had messed up their room as well (They were given two TWIN beds.) We went down to the front desk to complain, and were told that our friends could just take our room, but that the only available suite was still being cleaned. We decided to wait in our friends' room, and the front desk people said they'd call us there when our suite was ready. Key thing here: WE WEREN'T APOLOGIZED TO - EVEN ONCE, BY ANY OF THE FRONT DESK STAFF. We waited for nearly an hour before calling down to inquire about our suite. We were transferred from person to person to person, because no one knew what I was talking about. Finally, I went down to inquire in person - and it's a long walk from the elevator to the front desk. I got there, and the women I had spoken to earlier were gone. Apparently, they'd left to eat, without telling anyone that we were waiting. Again, I got no apology, but we were told that our room was ready. Here's where it gets even WORSE. We were pretty satisfied with the suite... until we went to bed that night. The suite is RIGHT in front of the elevators. All night, we heard the elevator dinging and teens running through the halls, and around 6 AM, we heard people wheeling their luggage around, housekeepers vacuuming, etc. We got NO sleep. In the morning, we were told that the only other available room (not even a suite) was also right in front of the elevator. Our friends didn't sleep either, and their room was a little further from the elevators. Other complaints: We gave the housekeeper a big tip, yet he didn't do anything but make the bed. He left the trash right where it was... MORE DISGUSTING, THERE WERE HAIRS AND BUGS ON THE BEDS IN BOTH OUR ROOM, AND OUR FRIENDS' ROOM. The A/C is ridiculous. The elevators have no A/C, and are very worn down. They jump occasionally, and take forever. (It's faster to walk down, but the stairs are smelly). THe SUITE HAS NO TEMPERATURE CONTROL. You can't change the temperature. Don't eat breakfast in the hotel. The a la carte choices are almost the same price as the buffet, so we all opted for the buffet, but there was no food left. We waited 20 minutes for them to bring new food out, but there still wasn't much to eat. Bottom line: Stay somewhere else. People go to Orlando to experience youthful magic... don't ruin your trip. If you don't mind horrible conditions, there are plenty of motels for under $50. Don't stay at the Radisson.

Reviews.Title: “An OK Stay”
Reviews.Author: Terry9
Reviews.Content: We got a great rate for this hotel through Hotwire, so we decided a few disappointments still made for a decent value. After reading other reviews about this hotel having an older section and a newer section and the rooms being much better in the newer, I did ask (at check in) if our room would be in the newer section based on this. The desk person didn't really answer me, but did seem to put me into a different room (based on computer activity). This room wasn't too bad, but if the older side was much worse, then I would be really concerned about them. I didn't feel the desk staff was very concerned one way or the other about our stay. The room was ok, but worn. The mattresses were sagging and the edges of the room did not seem to be very clean. The in-room fridge and complimentary bottled water were nice. However, we stayed three nights, and the water was not replinished the second night, as were not the coffee packages and used toiletries. The pool was nice, and free computer use is available (with long lines and slow downloads). It wouldn't be awful to stay here again, but I'd probably look for decent deals elsewhere first.

Reviews.Title: “Not a three star”
Reviews.Author: EVETIL
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in June after making the mistake of booking on HOTWIRE. It's website stated this was a three star hotel and a customer favorite. The Radisson's site says this hotel has sleep number beds but we were not lucky enough to recieve one. When I asked for one I was told they were all sold out and no rooms were left. Anyway, the room we had had problems. The blankets had holes and the springs in the mattress could be seen through the sheets. The vanity in the bathroom was about to fall to the floor and just alot of cosmetic problems. View the pictures. Stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Some Issues.... but tolerable”
Reviews.Author: NewJerseyMcFamily
Reviews.Content: We stayed Sat. thru Wed. The directions from hotel website from airport to hotel got us lost. We stopped at another Raddisson for directions to this one. We arrived at 10:30am and they gave us our room immediately... website states check in is 4pm. We were thrilled. The front desk personnel was friendly, and nice. We had to pay $5.00 per day to park our rental car. There is no parking lot security... there should be if your paying a fee to park. The elevators are scary and hot. We werent sure if they were gonna break down. The room had 2 double sleep number beds. I dont know what the hipe is about these beds.... I couldnt find a comfortable number... 30... 40...50...60 ??? Linens looked new and nice, pillows were new and nice. AC worked great. Refridgerator worked, safe.. fine, coffee pot was a 2cup style... but they did also have Starbucks booth downstairs. The bathroom is very small.. big mirror and round garden tub. The tub/shower faucet needed caulking and it only turned 1/4 way. The water wasnt very hot but pressure was okay. It did have slight draining problem..It also needed a good scrubbing... the tub had a ring around it and the grout was begining to mold. The bathroom floor was tiled and needed moping. It has a hair dryer and a retractable string for hanging wet clothes. The maid service was great about setting our stuff up on the counter neatly. They also set up our childs stuffed animals on the bed nicely. They promptly changed our sheets and gave us fresh towels and such. I dont believed that they touched any of our things and when we saw them in the halls they were friendly. We left a thank you note and tip everyday and she responded back... which made it personal and nice. The carpets definetly need replacing in the room, had stains. Heres our biggest ISSUE..... There was a spider the size of a 50cent piece on the ceiling one night!!!! Scared the heck out of me. My husband took a picture and then he killed it. I keep waking up the next two nights looking for more. The windows are large and we had a view of the 192 highway. There were spider webs behind the curtains also. The toilet did run all the time but we shut the bathroom door and didnt hear it. It was overall quiet there. There was a WARNING on the TV about the pizza scammers in the area. Everyday we got flyers under our door about pizza deliveries from different companies. But we ignored them. The carpet in the hallway was new. Pizza Hut Express was downstairs, game room.. okay. They have a gift/store well stocked, but I did catch the clerk cat napping in her chair at 11pm one night. They have a main pool area with hot tub and music... seemed okay. Pool Was open pass the posted 10pm closing time. We used the other pool in the back of hotel. Water was too warm and it needed a good scrubbing and some of the concrete copeing was broken. But it got us wet and our child liked it. Pool towels provided. Lots of chairs... but they needed a good scrubbing to. It is super easy to get to Disney parks from here... we had a rental car. Loads of Resturants in area and shopping galore. Stores everywhere. Would we stay here again??? I say maybe... if they continue to refurbish. My husband says no way! We love Disney and try to visit every year.

Reviews.Title: “Just OK - Good Price”
Reviews.Author: ycp1996
Reviews.Content: Not bad, Not Good! Nothing really exceptional. For price paid through Pricline, not upset. The hotel was relatively clean, the room was spacious, OK and clean for sleeping etc. As other reviewers stated, very bad deal with hidden 5 per day resort fee / charge? Why was not told about by priceline? Not good practice...

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: lisa702
Reviews.Content: Pleasantly surprised! I booked this hotel thru Priceline for 35 dollars a night and was VERY worried after reading the terrible reviews. The staff was very helpful and the room was newly carpeted and very clean. Mattresses on the beds were not sleep number but new. Pools were clean. Main pool was loud and crowded but the other at the South Tower was much quieter. For 35 dollars a night, I cannot complain! It however is not a 3 star hotel. We did not eat there so I cannot comment on the food. Very convenient to restaurants, souvenir shops and grocery shopping. Took us 5 minutes to get to Disney's Animal Kingdom. Overall a positive experience!

Reviews.Title: “Average Hotel with Hidden Charges”
Reviews.Author: wroughtironron
Reviews.Content: We booked three rooms for one night, and the hotel put a $5-59 "service charge" on each room. Apparently they feel able to do this to incorporate fridges and safes in rooms (you get no choice whether you want these or not), self parking (certainly not "free") and access to shuttle buses. - Was I impressed ? Nooooo ! I find this type of back-door charging infuriating, and the Radisson Worldgate won't be seeing me ever again.

Reviews.Title: “Recommend Avoiding This Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Kirk87
Reviews.Content: We took our chances in booking through Priceline but never had problems with a three star rated hotel until this one. The room we were given in my opinion was definitely not a three star. After asking for another room seeking Sleep Number beds which they advertise as having, it was made clear to us by the staff that since we had booked this hotel by Priceline we could only stay in certain rooms. They showed us another room that was very much the same as the one we had originally been given - same types of beds. Our room had very dated furniture, a very small bathroom, old beds, flat pillows, and lesser quality linens. We found out they had better quality pillows and linens when we requested extra pillows that they brought up for us. We could not find a luggage cart. My family ended up making a couple of trips about a block in distance both to unload and load back up. One day I saw a person with a cart but never saw another one the five days that we were there. I read earlier reviews of elevators not working. First two days we were there, the building wing we were staying in only had one elevator out of three working. A couple of days later all three were up and running. On our last night there our room was not restocked with new towels and wash clothes. We called to have them bring up what we needed. An employee showed up with some of what we needed. My wife did not like the fact the male staff person wanted to come into our bathroom to restock them instead of just handing them to her at the door. A couple of minutes later we heard a noise of someone trying to enter our room. When looking through the peephole, we could see that it was another staff employee trying to enter our room with their card. They had not knocked at our door or announced who they were! Luckily we had it locked from inside as my wife was changing her clothes. The morning of checkout, we were billed for "resort fees" that included on site parking, refrigerator, and shuttle service. No forewarning that these resort fees existed. All three of these items are listed as complimentary or standard on the radisson.com website for this hotel. I can not find any mention of additional resort fees on the Radisson website. After a pointed discussion on this with staff, they removed the charges from my credit card. The items I've listed above are very troubling to me thus prompting me to write my first hotel review in hopes of warning others of what your experiences might be at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Never Again!! Beware when using Priceline!”
Reviews.Author: RJN74
