Reviews.Content: Awful experience. Booked through Priceline...this is the second consecutive hotel stay that we've used Priceline and had unsatisfactory results.....we will never use them again. After receiving the hotel name from PL, checked out the Radisson website. Looked very good. Sleep Number beds, fridges and microwaves. After check-in, went to the room. The carpet was stained in several places. Couldn't find the microwave. Also, no Sleep Number bed. Called guest services and found out it was $5 extra daily to have a microwave. Also found out it was $10 extra daily to have a room with a SN bed. Our reservation was actually two reservations. We added two additional nights to original res. through 'special offer' from Priceline. On Sun. morning, original check-out day, I called front desk and confirmed that everything was in order for our two additional days. Went out for the day, and when we returned, our key would not open our room door. Had to go to front desk to have keys re-keyed. Didn't receive an explanation or apology or anything. Can't forget to mention the HORRIBLE beds. Hard as concrete!! Terrible. Awful. Worst I've experienced. Was also charge an additional $5 daily 'resort fee'. We've never stayed at a Radisson before, and I can't imagine we ever will again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: sandylm
Reviews.Content: We booked our six night vacation through Priceline for $60 per night. We were disappointed not to get the Sheraton Safari and were a little worried after reading the reviews. We had absolutely no problem with this hotel. The room was clean. All the staff we encountered was friendly. The front desk was adequate. We were helped when asked--just the service didn't come with a smile. You kind of felt like they were waiting for you to walk away, so that, they could talk about you. The cleaning staff was great. One day we slept most of the day and didn't leave the room until dinner time. I called the front desk and our room was cleaned while we went to dinner and the pool. We stayed in the South Tower. Overall, it was a great trip. We also used Super Sitters for an evening out. They are the preferred sitter of the hotel. Debbie was great and I couldn't have felt better leaving my two year old with anyone else. The staff working the concession area was great. We only encountered two problems during our stay. One was that we could not rent pay-per-view movies on the tv. There was one night that we were just extremely exhausted and wanted to watch a movie. Unfortunately, they do not have movies for rent like most hotels. The second was that I caught the sales staff complaining about wanting to work for other places when I went to get coffee one morning. This was after we had purchased a time share with the hotel. It made us rethink our decision and we sent a cancellation before we left town. If the sales people aren't happy-it must be a crappy place to buy.

Reviews.Title: “Sleep in your car it will be cleaner and more comfortable!”
Reviews.Author: Makeawish3
Reviews.Content: Don't let priceline fool you--this is absolutely no 3 star hotel. After I had the misfortune to "win" two rooms for one night, I read the terrible online reviews and immediately called the hotel. I spoke with the manager who assured me that the hotel was 70% completed with a remodel and she would upgrade me to their better rooms with the "sleep number" beds at no extra charge. I felt somewhat reassured, but I should have known better. The beds were doubles, and the sleep number mattresses are nothing more than air mattresses with electronic controls. The instructions showed that queen sized sleep number beds have dual controls so that each side can be adjusted, but the doubles only have one control and I guess one air chamber so when two of my teenagers were on one bed they were left with a big hump in the middle and neither side was comfortable. My back was killing me after spending one night on the beds too, since I could never get the air adjusted correctly. When we checked in, one of the two rooms had a terrible pet odor and some kind of hairs all over and in one of the beds, so I requested we be given another room. Management complied immediately; but the new room smelled even worse, like mold or mildew. The bathrooms were nasty with peeling walls and missing caulk. This was a terrible experience, not anywhere near the standard I would expect from a Radisson and I would never stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Overall Great Experience at Worldgate!”
Reviews.Author: bassigirl
Reviews.Content: We booked through Priceline --- and in Orlando, we've always had great luck --- almost always getting the Wyndham or Sheraton Safari. So we were a little scared by other reviews of this hotel. First things first, the phone service was terrible --- we tried calling 4 times to let them know we'd be late and to put in on request for a king bed non-smoking. Each time we were routed and rerouted or put on hold for 10+ minutes. When we arrived at 11 p.m., we were exhausted --- but front desk was friendly and valet was attentive. We did not make our requests or complain about the phone at that time. Then we got what seems to be the typical worst room possible. The beds were basically cots (barely full size) and the air conditioning didn't work. The fridge was leaking and making a horrible noise and the bathroom was clean but very old and leaky. I was concerned about how our complaint would be handled, but it was unfounded! The front desk was great! We were immediately moved to a newer king room --- with a sleep number bed that worked great and we weren't charged any extra. I am ultra picky, and we found everything to be very clean. The one thing I noticed was that the fridge leaks and they have them always in these older wooden cabinets which were rotting through at the bottom. I let management know. We also used the pool --- which was clean and nice on our stay and the bar was friendly. We did not try the restaurants (the one time we tried after 10 p.m., the pizza place was closed). We were most impressed by the valet who was very attentive (the poor guy on duty was almost always on duty when we called for our car) and at $6 a day, it was great for curb service. Also we had no problems getting extra pillows and towels late at night. I would still prefer staying at Wyndham or Safari --- the only other drawback about this resort is the surrounding neighborhood is rather low-rent and a bit scary at night.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience!”
Reviews.Author: lkscales
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for five nights from April 19 - 24. Our room was clean, roomy and was, most impressively, quiet. It was the most quiet hotel I have every stayed in. There were kids staying in the rooms all around us...and we never heard a thing. We didn't have any plumbing noise either, which is usual in a hotel in my experience. The staff was extremely friendly and went out of their way in the two or three instances we had requests for. The staff seemed very organized and well informed. I love the fact there is a Starbuck's and a Pizza Hut right in the lobby that stayed open until midnight. There is also a general store in the lobby that sells EVERYTHING, and is also open until midnight. The internet connection was instant and fast. The housekeeping service was impressive. No matter what time we left for the day, they always managed to get to our room somehow. There were always fresh sheets, clean glasses and fresh towels waiting on us when we returned. We ordered room service one morning and it was great. Loads of food and the order was exactly what we asked for with little extras such as jams, butter, and an extra plate for sharing. There were some differences however. For instance, there was no "fan" in the bathroom. The shower didn't seem to be the best design, but had great water pressure and was quite enjoyable...and I'm funny about showers. We had a fridge and coffee maker, but no microwave. The beds were the worst part of the stay. They definately needed to be replaced. My husband and son were comfortable, but I hated them. They were not the "number" beds...just the regular beds. Even with all these unusual things we would stay here again. It was quiet.. and convenient to everything (in our opinion).

Reviews.Title: “Not a problem here”
Reviews.Author: branbran
Reviews.Content: April20,2007 I too was skeptical after reading the negative reviews...Arriving there I waited for 2minutes to check in..The front desk were very personable..Checked in was handed our park tickets and given direction on what side of the hotel we were on..I was located on the 2nd floor..After staying the previous night before at another hotel that was excellent but more pricey I knew not to expect the same.. The beds couldve been a bit softer,but after being at the parks all day a piece of ply wood wouldve been good enough for me to crash on...The bathroom and room itself were very clean..Yes, the bathroom is small but again something one can live with for a week... Expecting to find bugs in the bed like another poster stated I brought 2 comforters from home..needing only one (not because of the bugs) because one of their blankets felt very sticky and cheap.. We ate Pizza hut the first night and the second night we tried theSavannah Grill..Service there was excellent and the food was great.. The pools were filled with kids and adults which is nice to see.. Would go to the front desk and ask for towels and washclothes, seeing some days I would have do not disturb up..They would promptly bring up the items, with a smile too...Checking out not only did the one helping me smile and say thank you others at the desk said thank you too... Another thing I was NEVER bothered by anyone trying to offer timeshares... Over all the service,comfort and cleaness of this hotel is good. I would recommend it to others..And if I were to plan a vacation there again with my child Id check into this resort again...

Reviews.Title: “worst hotel experience”
Reviews.Author: xxresyxx
Reviews.Content: Although I did reserve the room through priceline.com, I feel like the condition of the rooms, along w/ the customer service at the hotel was absolutely unacceptable. ISSUES: - Front desk was very cold and not willing to help when I asked to change rooms - Maid service did not clean the room and bathroom well, garbage was left un-emptied - Numerous problems with the room access card and even had to wait for over an hour for maintenance to come fix it - Water temperature in shower was either barely luke warm or scalding hot - sleep number beds were advertised as available in all rooms when they were not, I had to wait for the last 2 days to change to a room that had one. - beds were horrible - had a package waiting for me at the front desk for 4 days and no one ever called or left a message to my room saying that it had arrived. - room service food was disgusting and cold This was the worst hotel experience I have ever had and would not recommend this hotel to anyone, no matter what the price was. I have an upcoming reservation at another Radisson hotel in Salt Lake City next week and am considering canceling that reservation in fear that I may get the same experience as this one.

Reviews.Title: “Better than the reviews”
Reviews.Author: tip_the_canoe
Reviews.Content: I was skeptical after reading the reviews, so maybe that's why I was impressed with the hotel. Service was excellent, all the front desk staff seemed very friendly. There wasn't ever a wait, so it must depend on when you get there and the kind of issues they're dealing with at the time. We had breakfast which was very reasonable, great tasting, and so much food! We ordered off the menu because it was pretty much the same price as the buffet, but included coffee and juice, and there was more than enough food, so i'd say a better deal than the buffet. The room was nicely decorated and had a few unique features such as the garden tub and a nice coffee maker, but was average. The best (and most important) part were the beds. I loved every part of them; the pillows, the duvet, and the bed itself. It was really convient for Disney, so if you have a car it's great, but shuttle schedule is terrible if you want to get there at park opening time.

Reviews.Title: “March 26th 2007”
Reviews.Author: drivesafely
Reviews.Content: after a great day at disney we arrived at the radison worldgate at 10:30pm. we got to room 349 and found BUGS in the bed! called the front desk and they sent us to room 557 without delay. we pulled back the sheets and found BUGS in that room too! the front desk then said they would send security to check the next room first to ensure we got a room without BUGS! we finally got to room 562 without BUGS! this was our first experience with priceline. we booked this hotel three weeks prior to travel. we googled the hotel name and found this site. we considered the potential for trouble and decided to call priceline with regard to issues raised in other comments. priceline said they would refund our money one week prior to our stay. we considered cancelling but decided since it was only a one night stay we would take a chance. all three rooms were nicely decorated. all had filthy carpets. the pool and glowing tiki lights were visible from the first two rooms and looked quite inviting. however, we needed to sleep as micky mouse had worn us down. we checked out as soon as we could the next morning. the scratch marks on our bodies are begining to fade now. the uncontrollable itching sensation is not as strong. this is one hotel we wont ever forget.

Reviews.Title: “It was great”
Reviews.Author: BHornsby
Reviews.Content: We stayed a week and it was great. A very nice room very clean had no trouble at all.Everyone was very nice.Very nice check-in service great room very nice beds.I was very worried after reading all the reveiws but it's very nice will always stay here. B. Hornsby Alabama

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - North Tower with Sleep Number Beds”
Reviews.Author: DisneyTravel
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed our stay at the Radisson Worldgate. We stayed in the North Tower with Sleep Number beds and could tell room had new beds, carpets, linens. The staff were very friendly and fast to respond to our calls. The checkout was fast and had no surprises, we were charged exactly as expected. The pool was nice and clean with towels provided. The short drive on back roads to Magic Kingdom worked out perfect for us. In the hotel, you must pass by timeshare salespeople to get to restaurant downstairs so we only visited the restaurant one time. The first impression of Worldgate was not so great. Parking lot had dim lighting and broken pavement and overgrown shrub trees as you drive up among discounted souvenier shops. The lobby was very crowded and noisy so there was a 20 minute wait to checkin.

Reviews.Title: “Discusting in Every Way!”
Reviews.Author: katiebreen
Reviews.Content: DISCUSTING hotel! We booked this hotel through Priceline. Be careful about Priceline. The idea behind Priceline is that you need to trust that a a class of a hotel you are bidding on is truly one that you will receive and it can be misleading to say the least. In this case, we bid on a 3-star hotel (it wasn't a very low bid) and we ended up with the Radisson Worldgate as an alleged 3-star hotel. No Way! We were extremely disappointed. I would never consider this a 3-star hotel. The hotel was old and run down, dark and gloomy and very depressing. The staff that we encountered was rude, not a smile among them. One of the two pools was filled with dirt and leaves from the trees and was out of commission. The other was passable but the lounge chairs were filthy. The room we were in was smelly and dark and the beds were hard as a rock. The carpeting was stained and there were waterspots on the walls. We immediately tried an "upgrade" at an extra cost ($10.00 per night) to the Sleep Number beds and the beds still were uncomfortable and the mechanics of the bed didn't work correctly and made a high-pitched noise whenever we tried to adjust them. Even with the "upgrade" the beds weren't near the quality of, say, a Hampton Inn or Embassy Suites or Marriot. Both of my kids woke up the next day with what appeared to be a rash on their legs. I don't want to even consider what that was! Needless to say, after one night, we left the hotel and found a wonderful place (see my review on Magical Vacation Villas) right down the street. This move saved our week-long vacation. The Radisson was pre-paid through Priceline and we had to assume the loss, but we had no other option. After we moved to the new hotel, we discovered that we left some clothing behind in the closet. We called immediately and asked the staff to check the room and they insisted our stuff wasn't there. It wasn't until we spoke with many staff members and told them we would come down ourselves to search for our things, did our stuff magically appear! It had been in that closet all along, they were just too lazy to check the room. I don't understand how others gave this hotel even a mediocre rating. It really isn't worth the savings in Orlando. There are far better choices at this price range. Do your research and you'll find something better, we did and it made all the difference in the world.

Reviews.Title: “Make sure you get Sleep Number rooms”
Reviews.Author: FormsanRunner
Reviews.Content: Just got back from this hotel last night. Stayed four nights there. Like many of the reviews before me. You can only consider this hotel a 3 stars if you get the rooms with SleepNumber beds. Also, book the hotels from priceline.com. If you pay anywhere near the "suggested" price, you are going to hate yourself. 1. Shuttle service was not too bad. Minor inconvenience that you can be on the bus for 1 hour for a 10 mins bus ride. They go from park to park to pick up people. In the morning, from hotel to hotel to pick up passengers. 2. Ask for SleepNumber rooms. The first two nights, they gave us a room with two twin beds. The beds barely have any springs. 3. Front Desk is very helpful. Friendly people. 4. Good location. Walking distance to restaurants. Sizzler, Ponderosa and BlackAngus. 5. If you booked your flight from United. Better make sure you go to airport early. We booked our flight from Orbitz, and United oversold their tickets. The United staff were as rude as they can be. When passengers went to the desk asking them any questions, they just told us to go sit down and didn't let us finish our questions. They sounded like it was us who were giving them the troubles.

Reviews.Title: “older hotel,needs some updating”
Reviews.Author: picturechick
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel on priceline and the only reason I dont feel to bad is because I got it cheap.If I had paid full price I would not have been happy.Its obvious when you pull up that its an older establishment.The common areas are ok but the rooms are really dated.It was listed as a 3 star but I would only give it 2.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the facility; HATED the shuttle service”
Reviews.Author: OhioMooreFamily
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Raddison 12-28-06 thru 1-2-07. What a beautiful facility. We throughly enjoyed out stay, except for the so called shuttle service they provide to and from the Disney parks. We were stranded at Animal Kingdom in a rain storm with 3 children for about 45 minutes. What a nightmare! There was one shuttle run in the morning and one pick-up time in the evening. If you wanted to stay later or leave earlier it was a $30 taxi ride (one way). I would definately recommend this lovely resort. Just make sure NOT to rely on any resort transportation if you plan to visit the Disney parks.

Reviews.Title: “Nicer than I expected”
Reviews.Author: pharmacist2000
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for 3 nights over New Year's. Overall, the hotel is nice - the lobby is modern and in very nice shape, and depending on if you luck out on your room or not, it can go either way. Some rooms are indeed in much better shape than others. We started off in the South tower in a room with two double beds. It was OK. The main complaints we had were that the bathroom was too small and the shower wouldn't drain properly. We realized we couldn't sleep well on a double bed, so we very politely asked to be moved at about 11:00 the next morning to a king if possible. We went to one of the many breakfast buffets around on US 192, then came back to a much nicer, larger room in the North tower with a huge, glorious Sleep Number bed. The bathroom was huge and the shower was a lot larger (and drained properly). So, you just have to luck out sometimes. That seems to be the case with this hotel. We found the activities desk to be very helpful in helping us decide what to do and buy tickets to attractions. We had to go to a timeshare presentation, but since we already owned timeshare they were pretty easy on us. Just stick to your guns and you'll be fine. The hotel is nicely situated off of crazy US-192. It's not 10 minutes from Disney, and about 20 minutes from Universal (depending on traffic and congestion on US-192 and I-4). For the price you pay, it serves the purpose. We could stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “good value”
Reviews.Author: bready
Reviews.Content: Overall I liked this hotel but mattress was not comfortable as a 3 star.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!”
Reviews.Author: DuaneSM81
Reviews.Content: Amazing place. Took 7 minutes to get from Disney parking lot into my hotel room. Wonderful rooms, wonderful pools, great staff, amazing people and very helpful. Pet friendly. Will return next time I go to Orlando!

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Customer Service, Much deferred maintenence”
Reviews.Author: Scotus
Reviews.Content: Just got back today from a four day stay at the Radisson Worldgate. There were a number of problems encountered by myself and my group. First, the Hotel refused to honor the room selection we made at the time that the guaranteed reservations were made. BE ADVISED, THE HOTELS POSITION IS THAT THEY ARE UNDER NO OBLIGATION TO HONOR THE RESERVATION. This includes the choice of a smoking or non-smokin rum, the type of bed and whether your room has a sleep number bed. The hotel staff was completely unsympathetic toward this issue. Second, the view from our room was a wall about eight feet away (the convention center). Be aware that a number of firsy floor rooms have NO VIEW. Third, there were maintenence issues, including a refrigerator that froze everthing in the refrigerator, causing one canned beverage to explode. Fourth, the hotel shuttle failed to pick us up at EPCOT for the 9:50 pickup. When I called at 10:05 I was told the shuttle was on its way. When I called at 10:20, the hotel staff changed the story and said the shuttle had been there at 9:50, but no one was there to ride. I told them that was not true, we were there, along with another couple. Finally, after arguing with the staff for 5 minutes, thehotel agreed to send another shuttle. We were not picked up until 10:40. In general, the hotel has much deferred maintenence. In our room, wallpaper was peeling away. Also one cabinet had water damge. The water temperature in the shower would get very hot and then very cold, then hot, then cold, etc. The staffs attitude was worse than any hotel I have ever stayed in, including budget motels. If you have any problems, you will have to fight to get any satisfaction. My advice, find another hotel in Orlando. This hotel is not worth the rack rate they charge. There are many better choices.

Reviews.Title: “Tired Property in need of TLC”
Reviews.Author: PSUDanO
Reviews.Content: The Radisson Worldgate is a 3-star property that has slipped to 2-star status due to a lack of needed capital spending. After finding the hotel (not very good signage on SR-192), we arrived to a cheerful and efficient front desk that checked us right in. The lobby area is in great repair, a great contrast to the quite worn room we were assigned. All the furnishings were in need of replacement, the matresses were too soft and lumpy, and the pillows uncomfortable. The carpet was spotty and torn, and the bed spreads showed tears and wear. The bathroom showed numerous areas that needed caulking/tile repair, and the A/C unit was loud and inefficient. We did not use the food service or recreational facilities as this was a "buffer night" stay prior to staying at a Disney resort. To put things in perspective, I am not one of those who dons the "white gloves" and expects a cleanliness/repair level better than my own home. However, much of this 3-star property is in desperate need of refurbishment, and a chat with the morning desk manager indicates that all they plan to do is replace matresses and carpet. Bottom line--if you are staying here for $45 on a Priceline bid, this is passable. If you are paying their normal rack rate or even a discount, this would be a bitter disappointment.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, good for the money”
Reviews.Author: Korinp30
Reviews.Content: The Radisson Worldgate was nice. Good quality for the money. We had issues, but they were resolved quickly. After traveling all day, I just wanted to relax in a hot tub, which they have round garden tubs, and that made it all the more better, but on the back of the bathroom door was a dirty washcloth with pubic hairs on it. Not knowing if that was indicative of sloppy housecleaning, we asked to be moved and they upgraded us for free. (BTW, the upgraded rooms are so worth it just for the comfortable beds and nicer linens!!) We gathered our belongings and headed to our "new" room. After taking my hot bath, I crawled into bed only to lift the pillow and 2 pennies were laying there. I don't know what that means, but I wasn't taking any chances...... I called housecleaning and had them bring new linens - comforters and all for both of our beds. Both housekeeping and front desk were pleasant and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Yuck.”
Reviews.Author: toddling40
Reviews.Content: I don't know if you will remember me, but earlier this year, I had a Priceline hit at the Worldgate and expressed quite a few concerns about the experience that I had to shout my head off to even have acknowledged. At that time, it was arranged for the first time in my 8-year history of Priceline to have a stay refunded. I was told at the time that TripAdvisor reviews (quite a few of which I have written myself over the years) were not accurate and that "many of your competitors make fake posts." It turns out that my fears were well-founded. First, I did online check-in through Radisson when I started out. At that point, I requested a King Room. Next, I had a friend express a desire to join me, so I called the hotel's reservations department to say that I was needing to change to a double/double configuration. This was at 8am on Tuesday. Upon getting a recording that the office was closed and did not open until 8am, I called back at 8:05, 8:10, 8:15, and finally got someone at 8:20. She was rude. She very curtly told me that since I had a Priceline reservation, my request would have been ignored anyway. Let me interject here that at true 3- and 4-star hotels, I am used to having simple requests honored and being treated like any other guest even when booking through Priceline. When we arrived at the hotel on Saturday night, there was no one manning the Radisson Express Yourself desk at the front desk anyway. And, there were no keys waiting for us. We had to do normal check-in. Your desk clerk was very quick to foist the check-in slip under my nose and tell me to initial where it said I owed nothing, then have me sign the bottom. He quite deliberately avoided drawing any attention to the small print. More on that later. When we got to our room, room 559, I was almost sick. The beds were like rocks, the linens were the same ones that they had been when I wrote an actual positive review of the then Doubletree Kissimmee Worldgate Resort for Rita Aero's Walt Disney World guidebook SEVEN years ago, the bottom of the cabinet holding up the refrigerator was quite literally almost rotted away, the bathroom had peeling fixtures, and the carpet was a mess. The next morning, I went to the desk and asked to be moved. To be fair, this was the one positive experience. I was moved to one of your Sleep Number bed rooms (which should now be in ALL of your rooms...comptetor hotels such as Sheraton and Hampton Inns now have all of their beds changed over to ones that don't leave the guest in pain). The rest of the room, however, is in the same state of disrepair as the rest of the other room. The carpet is shameful, the furniture is the same as it was when I wrote the above-mentioned review, and the bathroom is a mess. I noticed this morning that the dust in the bathroom duct, by the way, was at least a half an inch thick. Yuck. When I checked out this morning, the desk clerk cheerfully told me that I owed nothing BUT THE RESORT FEE. HUH!?!?!?!?! The small print that had been so carefully glossed over when I checked in was very rudely waved in my face. I was firm and kept repeating, "No." She removed it, and then proceeded to give me a lecture about Orlando hotels and resort fees. Sir, I have stayed in every single 3- and 4-star property in the Orlando area, many multiples of times. This is the first time that anybody actually tried to sneak the resort fee past me...and these are tantamount to highway robbery, anyway. I will of course not be bidding 3-star for the area again, and I will definitely urge others to avoid doing so. My favorite property, which is in a much better location and actually belongs in the 3-star class, the Sheraton Safari, is one I'm quite willing to pay the actual price for. Yours stinks. Literally. I will also be posting this letter verbatim on TripAdvisor, just so you know it's not "made up"

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay at the Radissson”
Reviews.Author: Peppyuga
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Radisson Worldgate while at a conference. The rooms were wonderful. My bed was large with wonderful plush linens. The room had a large desk and a small refrigerator. My colleague received a complimentary bottle of water every night, however, it seems my housekeeper forgot mine each night. The business center was very convenient, and staff was very helpful in helping us find our way around. I didn't use the pool, but it seemed like many children were enjoying it. The only problem I had was the noise. My room was right next to the elevator, so I heard "ding" "ding" all night long and luggage rolling on the hard floor. Luckily the bed was comfortable or I would have been upset!!

Reviews.Title: “good value for money”
Reviews.Author: lulworth
Reviews.Content: Having read many reviews on trip advisor about the Radisson Worldgate, after we had made our booking, we had mixed feelings, however, upon arrival, the receptionist was very efficient, informative and friendy, as was all other staff within the hotel. Our rooms exceeded our expectations, very clean, comfortable, above average decor, quite and the housekeepers could not do enough for you. The food in the restaurant/breakfast area IS good value for money, you paid around $10 for the buffet breakfast or you could opt for $7 cold buffet breakfast. 'Hummingbirds' bar, around the pool area, well, you could not ask for better service and again very reasonable. A tip for future travellers, along side the Radisson Worldgate there is a road called 'Maingate Lane' follow this road, at end turn right onto 'Sherberth Road' straight into Disney, what a time saver, no traffic, total travel time around 5mins. We would recommend this hotel to anyone and would definately stay here again. Child friendly, teen friendly, adult friendly, pocket friendly, what more could you ask.

Reviews.Title: “Adequate. Not much more.”
Reviews.Author: Kramerica
Reviews.Content: Was in town for a business conference, and had to stay at the Worldgate since the conference hotel was full. The hotel ran a shuttle to and from the conference hotel, and the shuttle ran on time several times daily. The hotel itself was adequate, but not what I would consider a resort quality motel. It is very close to most of the Disney attractions, so if that's what you're in town for then that would be a definite plus. It is also along a main strip with plenty of businesses and eating establishments. Our check-in was very slow. It was 4 in the afternoon and they only had 1 person working the desk, with about 5 or 6 people waiting in line in the seemingly un-air conditioned lobby. They also messed up our reservations which had been pre-paid by our company. We had all of the paperwork confirming this, but the computer did not have the rooms as being pre-paid so we eventually had to put this on our own credit cards (to be reinbursed later). Once we got to our room, we saw both good and bad. The bathroom was clean but small. The room itself was pretty clean, although there were several stains on the carpet. The beds were great. Extremely comfortable adjustable sleep number beds. The property had 2 pools. The one which we used was small, but adequate. It had a whirlpool and a poolside bar which was nice, and the whole pool area was lit with tiki torches at night. Overall it wasn't a bad hotel, but if I wanted a real vacation and could afford to stay elsewhere, then I would. It just had a bit of a dirty feeling to it, and did not seem like a top-level establishment.

Reviews.Title: “Don't bother”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: when we drove up to the hotel we thought great it looks like it does on internet, different story when we got into our room. It stunk of smoke, we asked for an airfreshner in the room but was told they didnt have any so they would give it a wee spray. no sign of anyone so after another phone call and a trip to the front desk someone came. smelt better for bout an hour but that was that. Bathroom was very dirty, ceiling around shower was black and when u did use the shower the floor outside the bathroom was soaking. free transport 2 disney was no good, went once a day so we decided to get taxis. so expensive, if u r going anywhere it is $20 min. Best idea would be to spend a bit more and stay in one of the hotels in the disney resort where you get excellent free transport

Reviews.Title: “The worst”
Reviews.Author: musicdude001
Reviews.Content: This place reeks.........elevators broken,scalding hot shower, and to top it off a swimming pool that had so much chemical in it that it literally shreded my childrens swimming suits. I called the manager twice about the pool because the rest of the stuff was'nt a huge safety issue like burning skin and watering eyes. This place is nowhere near a 3 star hotel and I would never stay in another Radisson hotel. To top it all off as were leaving to check-out I do my search of the hotel room because I hate to leave stuff behind, I lift up the mattress and there are several pornagraphic magizines. Makes me wonder if the maids ever changed the sheets!!!! Don't stay here it is definitely not worth your time or money.

Reviews.Title: “It was really just OK--by no means a resort!”
Reviews.Author: DeeCSW
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 7 nights on a Priceline bid. I was not happy when I received this hotel as it is in Kissimmee, off of 192. 192 is not my favorite area; it is overcrowded with people, restaurants and hotels, etc. At least this hotel is far enough off the main road that you are not disturbed by traffic. We received a Priceline room, Room 310, (also known as a non-renovated, run down room without sleep number beds in the North Tower). Our bathroom faucet leaked the entire week and our tub was worn and chipped. The housekeeping staff was good, they kept the room as clean as possible, but had little to work with. We used the pool on our second evening, and it was filled with bugs and twigs and flowers. The next morning the pool was better as it had been cleaned, however, we noticed that there were hair clips, garbage and even someone's hair extension left laying around the pool area. I informed the front desk about the debris but no one ever came to clean up the area and the hair extension was STILL THERE the next day. Gross! I guess this is a decent hotel for those on a budget, but overall it is nothing special. We did not use the hotel shuttle as we rented a car. The hotel is convenient to Animal Kingdom and the rest of the Disney property (you can catch Sherbeth Road through the Radisson parking lot), but it's a long drive to Universal and Sea World as you are essentially at the end of 192 (West). . No more Priceline in Orlando for me, too risky!

Reviews.Title: “We loved it!”
Reviews.Author: nalaa
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for 5 nights. we liked this hotel very much. room was large, clean and cosy. our king-size bed was great. no problems with sheets and stuff. you could even adjust the softness of the mattress with a remote control. our fridge made no noise at all though it was working. Staff was really friendly. Pool was good. There's cute store in the lobby. So we really really liked this hotel. Especially for this price - it's perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Agree Completely with the April 30 Review”
Reviews.Author: JTSchneider
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed in room 403 also, and it was just as bad as the previous reviewer stated. Their bullet points matched almost word-for-word what I planned to post. That was actually the room we were transferred to when we complained about the first room. Plus we were charged an additional $10/night because 403 had the "Sleep Number" beds. From other reviews, there are obviously some nice rooms in this hotel, but I would never risk staying here again to find out. Actually, we were so displeased with the experience that we will not be staying at a Radisson - anywhere - again. The only plus was the pool area, which was by no means "resort" level but was pleasant and clean.

Reviews.Title: “Great property and location for the money!”
Reviews.Author: Aaronius1974
Reviews.Content: My friend and I went to the Radisson Worldgate Resort as a last-minute, ‘booze-and-buffet’ getaway vacation. This is the second time that I’ve booked this hotel blind on Hotwire.com, and each time I have been more than pleased with the property. Let’s get the weak points right out of the way. Like many hotels in the area, the Radisson Worldgate Resort has thin walls, so one can hear kids crying, or an exceptionally large person thumping on the ceiling above you. It’s not worse than most Disney-area hotels (and many Disney World property hotels), but really guys, a little investment in thick insulation would go a long way towards customer satisfaction. Like most off-property Disney-area hotels, the Radisson offers free bus transport to the Disney parks, but most guest I knew weren’t happy with the erratic nature of the buses. Cab it or drive it yourself is the mantra. And while most of the property is top notch, there are a few ‘loose ends’ that mar the experience: a worn tub floor, a rusty, scary looking stair access door, some loose fitting hall light fixtures; again, a little time and investment would work wonders and eliminate these minor critiques. Here’s the good-to-great stuff. The rooms are exceptionally large for ‘standard’ rooms, with very comfortable beds and clean bedding. The design is quite clever, with the A/C unit being contained in a shelving/entertainment center/fridge/safe unit along one wall. This frees up a great deal of space (and yes, every standard room has a TV, mini-fridge, safe, desk and tons of storage. By far some of the largest, best space-planned standard rooms in all of Orlando. The facilities are also very complete. There are two pools (non-themed, unless ‘pool in Florida’ counts as a theme) and spas, a fitness center, a full-service restaurant, a quick-service food court, convention center, business center, and gift shop. If you just want to spend a day at the hotel, eating and drinking the hours away, this is an ideal and affordable locale to set up shop. They even had a live (if horrible) cover band out by the main pool during the evening. In addition, the management has done a great job renovating and maintaining the hotel. The carpets are new and plush, the lobby is airy and beautiful, and the walls are clearly freshly painted (or scrubbed clean, in any case.) As I said, some ‘loose ends’ spoil the overall effect, but in general, this is a very clean, very well-kept property (especially considering the other places off 192.) Ah, the great location. This Radisson has a great plot of land. The access street to the hotel is right off 192, so you’re within walking distance of a wide variety of tacky tourist traps and substandard buffets…but you’re not right off of 192…the Radisson is behind a small strip mall and its own parking lot. The grounds are covered with manicured trees and bushes, so it feels much more removed than it really is…and you don’t have to deal with the noise from the zillions of cars on 192. Also, it’s right at the entrance to Disney World, so the parks are a short cab/bus/car ride away. But it’s the staff that makes this hotel stellar. Every request we had, every question, every little thing we were looking for (such as the location of a ‘MAC Cosmetics’) was handled quickly and happily by the staff at the Radisson Worldgate Resort. Kudos to them for their stellar service and work ethic. The property itself is quite nice, kind of like an un-themed Moderate Disney World Resort (for about ½ the cost), but the staff here makes all the difference. There is another Radisson on the other side of the 192/I-4 interchange (Radisson Resort Parkway or Orlando-Celebration, depending on what they are calling themselves this week) that is arguably the nicer property, with more stylish rooms featuring duvet bedding and a massive, tropical pool with waterfalls facility, but the staff there is not anywhere near as attentive and friendly as the casual professionals at the Radisson Resort Worldgate. Rack room rates list for around $100-$120 a night during May, but you can get them for around $80 (and if you book it blind on Hotwire, around $65!) At $120, it’s not too bad. At $100, it’s a nice place to stay. When it drops below that, by all means, book a room here. You won’t be sorry. We’ll be back!

Reviews.Title: “OK for the price, but not a bargin”
Reviews.Author: Kelton
Reviews.Content: Fair for the price. Good points: GREAT Beds, good location. Bad points: Lots of time-share activity in the lobby. Hot tub was not hot. Prefer the HAMPTON INNS we've stayed in while in Orlando m ore. Will return to the Hampton in at this price range, not this property.

Reviews.Title: “Good overall experience!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: When we arrived they stuck us in a nasty smoking room and wouldn't move us- they claimed that ALL of their rooms were booked (even though I'd made the reservations in Feb for a non-smoking rm). Everything smelled awful, the floor was FILTHY and the beds were like boards. It was on the first floor and there were about a hundred teenagers running around screaming and being rude, and we have 2 small children. So we weren't off to a great start. Finally my husband complained again at 3 in the AM to a different person at the front desk who was very apologetic and he kindly moved us to a very nice non-smoking room on the 3rd floor. This room was much cleaner and the beds were a dream (even had remotes to the beds) with big, fluffy feather pillows. We stayed 5 nights total. The hotel is within walking distance of IHOP, McDonald's, several gift shops, and a grocery store (if you don't mind crossing a busy street). They have a little gift store, a nice pool (which was open quite late), and a place where you can get a hot dog, fries, salad, pizza, etc. I had no problem using the internet in the "business center" - there are 2 computers in there, although as a female I felt a little unsafe because the room locks from the outside and it's in a remote location in the hotel. I saw some complaints on here about the AC not working or making annoying sounds but we had no problem with that. The shower was excellent- great water pressure! The maid service was pretty good. You can get AVIS and Disney tickets in the lobby. Overall, it was a nice place to stay after the initial problem of being put in a very dirty room. (If you are a smoker, don't expect a comfortable bed or a clean room). Very short drive to Disney and especally Animal Kingdom- just take a right going out of the parking lot and a right at the end of that street (Sherberth Lane) and you're practically there.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place and Value”
Reviews.Author: FloridaFamily2005
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a nice weekend at the Radisson Worldgate. These people that make these negative posts are crazy. All of the staff we encountered were wonderful, friendly and very helpful. I did manage to get on a wrong elevator and came across a section that was being renovated. It was pretty messy but from what I could tell, there were no guests staying in that section. If you ask me, it’s good to see places renovating because if they weren’t, there would be a lot more negative posts on here complaining about how dated everything looked. We will be going back to the Orlando area in a couple months and we plan on booking at the Radisson again.

Reviews.Title: “Seemed like a 2 star hotel, not 3”
Reviews.Author: Tandem40
Reviews.Content: I will start off by saying that, though our stay was negative, the Radisson has compensated my husband and me by sending complimentary gift certificates for 3 nights. We had multiple issues during our stay. Cleanliness-shower floor had ground-in dirt you could remove with your fingernail. Bed sheets did not extend to the end of the bed, so one's feet rested directly on the bedpad. Luckily we had 2 double beds and only needed 1 (why not queen in this day and age?), so I took off the top sheet of one bed and used it to cover the bottom half of the mattress on the other bed. This was only done after receiving no response from our request to the front desk for properly fitted sheets. Towels were replenished incompletely. Toilet paper barely lasted for our 3 nights. No extra rolls were provided in room. The noise between rooms was horrendously loud, sounded like the people next to us were in our room. I did like the furniture, but not the bedding. There was a fridg, but we didn't use it because it was so loud. We unplugged it for our stay. The drapes did not reach the bottom of the windowsill or all the way to the sides, so light shined right on our faces all night. We could find no way to block it even with towels etc. The safe was closed when we checked in and we waited several hours for maintenance to get it open so we could use it. Stood in the hallway next to the fitness room waiting for someone to unlock it for 30 minutes. Staff was preoccupied with selling timeshares or something. Lots of people and activity and tons of noise in the too bright, poorly decorated lobby. Staff in our experience did not seem friendly at all. They seemed busy and preoccupied. Long walk into building from parking lot. Grounds very attractive with fountain and all. We had a wonderful first impression when we saw it. Too bad the rest of our stay did not live up to that initial impression.

Reviews.Title: “Very helpful and very friendly. Nice relaxing atmoshpere.”
Reviews.Author: rnparker
Reviews.Content: Congratualtions to the staff! While staying at the Redisson Worldgate we were welcomed by their very friendly staff. The check in and out ran smoothly as did our whole stay. We loved the fact that the hotel wrapped around the pool providing a sense of privacy and security. A very relaxed atmoshpere made the trip more enjoyable. Any questions were answered by the knowledgable staff. The room was average but clean. The windows were foggy and we had a view of the parking lot. The location of this hotel is about 10 to 15 minutes drive from all theme parks. Shuttle service is provided on a schedule. If you remain longer at the parks (Shuttle service picks you up around 7pm) just take a cab back to the hotel. For those who do not rent a car, the average cab ride back from the theme parks was around $12 to $15 dollars. There is always a cab available and they are convenient for your own personal schdule. Avis Car Rentals is located right in the lobby of this hotel. There is a tourist booth right in the hotel lobby as well. They sell theme all kinds park tickets to you right there so you don't have to wait in the long entrance lines at the park. A huge convenience and time saver. The evenning entertainment by the pool was a nice touch. The pool was open to the air and the hours were 6 a.m. to 1:00 a.m. So the kids and ourselves were able to take in a swim and stare at the stars before bed. Thank you Eddy, our waiter who greeted us in the dining room with a smile, humour and conversation. You made our stay that much more comfortable. Great service. Our glass was never empty. The restaraunt is great and the buffet topped all buffets along our way. If they do not have it, they will make it for you. If you want an omlette, they will ask you what you want in it and make it right there in front of you. The dinner menu has many options and the food was wonderful. Mostly the cleanliness and the friendly staff made our stay a nice one. One inconvenience was the lack of an ATM machine. Especially for tourist or out of town guests who do not have a vehicle to rely on. There were ATM machines within a walking distance or at the theme parks. It would have been nice and more secure having one right in our hotel. The gift shop is great. Lot of options at a reasonable price. This hotel also has a small gaming room for the kids to enjoy. A great bang for the buck. We would definately return!

Reviews.Title: “Not a good experience”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just returned home from 4 nights at the Radisson Maingate in Kissimmee. I was in Orlando on business. The hotel is severely lacking in maintenance and service. When we arrived at our room, there was a strong odor of cigaret smoke in the room and the strong odor of pot coming from the adjacent room. I went to the front desk and asked the assistant manager for another room non-smoking room. He said he could move us to another non-smoking room, but there was nothing he could do if guest smoked pot in their room. The toilet in our room did not flush properly. It usually took 8 or 9 flushes before the toilet would completely empty. The entrance door to our room would notlatch unless it was forcably pulled shut. One day after our room was cleaned by housekeeping, we returned only to find the room door half way open. Don't waste your time or money on the Radisson Maingate.

Reviews.Title: “Twilight Zone”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: It took 2 1/2 hrs (9-11:30pm) to finally get into a room. Three of the previous four rooms they sent us to, were already occupied. Yes, we had a keyed entry into someone else's property. Not cool. The last room (#5) they sent us to had the crappy full sized beds. When explained that I paid extra for the nicer beds I was told that because I went through a third party I was at the bottom of the barrell. We weren't the only ones. Each time we'd return to the front desk someone else was stopping by to say "our phone doesn't work", "the air cond. didn't work", our keys don't work". I thought, while waiting for yet another room: "What have we entered into here?!" We were also staying on the "under construction" tower. Then, they over charged our credit card for two meals we had there on our first full day. Through VISA and dealing with their food service manager, who denied any wrong doing, VISA told me Radisson reversed the over charged amount. This was a hell hole. Their staff was completely unapologetic. NEVER STAY HERE, YOU'LL REGRET IT.

Reviews.Title: “Beware of construction!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Worldgate for two nights during our vacation. Overall, the hotel is clean, the staff is friendly and the location is very convenient to the WDW complex. My only complaint - when we originally checked in we were given a room on a floor currently under construction (this was not mentioned during the check in process). When we stepped off the elevator (to our surprise) there was no carpet in the hallways and they were filled with a cloud of dust (the crew had apparently just finished with the drywall); there were also pieces of wood scraps with nails lying in the hall. We initially thought we were given the wrong room number, but sure enough, our key worked for the room. The room itself was in fine condition, just very dusty. We returned to the front desk and were assigned a new room on a non-construction floor (the woman at the desk was not as friendly as she had been when we first arrived) and the rest of our stay was fine. I just have to wonder why they would assign people to construction areas when the hotel was clearly not at full occupancy??

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Radisson Worldgate for 5 nights. The room was excellent value for money - comfortable and spotlessly clean. Staff frendly and helpful. Location very convenient for Disney attractions (we also preferred it to the International Drive/Universal Boulevard area where we spent a couple of nights).

Reviews.Title: “What happened to the good room?”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel while in town for a wedding, and was quite disappointed with the somewhat run-down conditions of this hotel. I was fooled into believing that I was going to be getting to stay in one of the beautiful rooms that are featured in photographs on this website, but instead I had a room with 2 full beds and old decor. I know that most visitors are in town for Disney, however since I had to spend most of my stay at the hotel, I was hoping that the accomodations would have been a bit more truthful in regards to the way it was was represented on the website. As it turns out, the luxe rooms do exist - - After speaking with another guest, I was told because she booked her reservations with her Hilton credit card, she was put up in a renovated room on the other side of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, fabulous rooms.”
Reviews.Author: muppetx
Reviews.Content: The Radisson Worldgate was a teriffic value for the priceline price we paid. The King size room we had was spacious, clean, and had great goose downed bedding. The only bad things about the hotel were the halls were a bit dirty because of some work on the window coverings, and the ice machines were dead on three floors. Don't rely on their shuttle service to and from disney, as it is almost non existant.. it's best to rent a car to get around. Park at downtown disney for free and hop on a disney bus.

Reviews.Title: “It sucks!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Not worth Staying.... I had read so many gud reviews about this hotel on the tripadvisor but was disappointed. We reached the hotel on a Friday afternoon n checked in..V had coffee in our room, that was complimentary. And after an hour we left for the Epcot Center. When v came back at nite, the room service people had fixed the beds but our coffe cups were still on the table, not cleaned. And these cups were not cleaned and moved from the position we left them on the first day after having coffee. Another biggest negative point about this hotel is that they do provide free shuttel to the theme parks but their pick up times r soo bad that if u take these shuttles on the way back u wud miss all the fireworks. I mean u dnt cme so far to miss the biggest event of the theme parks.SO DON'T rely on the free shuttles they offer.All in all i feel this hotel is not at all worth staying.

Reviews.Title: “Two weeks spent at the Radisson Worldgate”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: After reading some earlier reviews I had real concerns with my pre-paid stay at the hotel. Also whilst checking in, another guest was trying to check out because he couldn't access the Internet. Ok I thought, lets see the room first. First impressions, very good. On the 6th floor in the North Tower. Very clean and spacious, great sleep number beds, clean linen, ample towels, fridge small but did the job. TV very good, plenty of stations, no pay tv but who spends that much time in the room on holiday !. The A/C was excellent, chilled the room. Whilst there I used the laundry facilities, $2 per wash/dry seemed a little high. The Business centre should just be renamed the internet room. One PC had a burnt out screen but the connection speed was good and as long as no one else was waiting no time limit on use. Swimming pool was ok, loungers had seen better days, but towels put out each morning. Don't be scared of lizards ! you'll see a few near the pool, they don't bother you. Parking is great, never a problem finding a space. I normally stay at the Radisson Celebration, ok it's a far better hotel, but if I'm paying I'll always opt for the Worldgate. One more thing, if you drive out of the hotel, take a right, then the next right, it takes you straight to Osceola Parkway and Disney, cuts out the 192 and about 5 mins off the journey.

Reviews.Title: “Okay for vacationers, not for business travellers”
Reviews.Author: Belasaria
Reviews.Content: If you're looking for a basic hotel with a decent pool that is close to a lot of chain restaurants and the Disney theme parks, this hotel works fine. Business travellers? Look elsewhere. Express check-in? Didn't happen for me. Wireless Internet? Only in hotspots. Outlets to plug in chargers for laptops, cell phones and Blackberries? Only one in open view. Business center for copies, faxing, and printing? Not really. Secured entrances? No. I was booked here at the last minute by my travel agent to attend a conference held on the Disney properties. The most appealing part of the property was free wireless internet. I arrived early at the property at noon, hoping to check in, but was told I had to wait until their normal check-in time of 4 p.m. The front desk then offered to pre-register me, which meant all I had to do was show up later at the Express counter and they would assign me a room. Realizing the lines may be long at 4 p.m., I did so. When I returned to check in, they couldn't find my pre-registration information (the girl who had taken it had already gone). It was frustrating, because I had already gone through the process once and I was very concerned that my credit card would be charged twice. Once that was over, I was given a room on the first floor of the North Tower. Since I was lugging things back and forth for the conference, the first floor didn't bother me. The view, however, was the back of a building. What concerned me was that the access door to the North Tower from the parking lot didn't close all the way. So much for needing your key card to gain access to the Tower. The room was a decent size, with a couch, desk and a floor cabinet that kept the fridge and microwave from plain sight. However, every time I opened the cabinet for the fridge, there was a musty smell and I had to lift the fridge door to get it to clear the bottom of the cabinet. The fridge never got completely cold even when set on Hi. The A/C unit was in full view, and it was loud when used. The entire room had an odd smell to it and sometimes I could smell stale cigarettes although it was supposed to be nonsmoking. There was only one additional outlet at the desk; a plug at the base of the lap. I had to search for the other outlets and I had to move the couch to get to it. I was stuck with rotating my equipment for charging. The Wireless Internet, which I had been looking forward to, was a joke. I didn't get a signal in my room. I had to go to the business center or the lobby areas to get one. When I asked to be moved to another room for the WiFi, I was told they were completely sold out and couldn't change my rooms. Which was odd, since it was only 7 p.m. on a Wednesday. Another guest later revealed that she didn't have WiFi on the fourth floor, close to the elevator. So I was stuck in a room without WiFi and I had to go to the bar, business center, or lobby to get a signal. It wouldn't have been an issue if they offered a LAN connection. I don't have a modem in my laptop. As far as the business center, it consisted of three PCs (one with screen burn so bad that the screen itself was always green) and a fax/scan/copy machine. It looked like the converted registration area from their convention area. Again, you were supposed to swipe your keycard to gain access, but the door was never locked. While there was no charge for printing, copies, scans, or using the workstations, there were none of the usual business center amenitites such as pads of paper, fax cover sheets, office supplies and pens. And when I tried to fax three things long-distance, none when through. Without any signage stating rules of use -- except that you were limited to 15 minutes on the PC -- it was frustrating. The Hummingbirds bar was a little run down but the bartender very nice. I had lunch there twice and the food was decent and at the normal, bloated hotel prices. The pool area was clean. As I said, there was great access to the Disney properties -- just one exit down and about 10 minutes with traffic from Downtown Disney. There were gift shops, grocery stores, and restaurants around the property, which would be perfect for vacationers looking to save some cash by not staying at Disney properties. For $79/night, I got what I paid for. I'm due back in Kissimmee in February for another confernece, and I'll be definitly finding a better hotel to fit my needs.

Reviews.Title: “Close to parks”
Reviews.Author: KimGordelier
Reviews.Content: We stayed here 9th to 15th September. Had two rooms in the south tower. Pretty average hotel. No atmosphere at all. One of our rooms had bugs every day (looked like ants). We told reception and they sent someone up, but said they could not do anything about it. Really close to all Disney stuff and Discovery Cove. Busch Gardens about an hour away. Pizza bat was always closing before its due time and never had any cappuccino. Had one meal in the restaurant. Ordered starters and mains but for some reason the young lad working there decided we wanted all our food at the same time. Always had a little side table under his arm but never used it. Strange. Pool was always empty apart from us (bonus). Funny smell in lobby though.

Reviews.Title: “An honest review.”
Reviews.Author: stinkypinky
Reviews.Content: After reading some of the reviews I was a little apprehensive about staying here, but I needn't have worried. The hotel is easy to find if you know what to look for. From pretty much anywhere (except if your coming in from the Gulf Coast) you need to head West on the 192 and you will find the hotel located on the right between Markers 5 and 6. The neon sign on the main road says 'RADISSON CONFERENCE SUITES' and not Radisson Worlgate. We arrived late on a Saturday, the lobby was pleasant and check-in was swift. We were given a map to our room and sent on our way. We were in room 739 on the seventh floor. As we were only paying £16 each per night for the room we were not expecting much. But we were pleasantly surprised by the nice airy room with big TV, mirrored wardrobe, two firmness adjustable beds, air-con and plenty of drawer space. The bathroom was a nice size, clean and with a big corner bath/shower. As we were unpacking we noticed a couple of things that needed fixing and quick! There were some strange looking little bugs (possibly termites) crawling about in the top drawer on the right under the window. I kept most of my non-creasing clothes in my case after that! The safe was also locked when we arrived so we were unable to set it afresh. We reported both of these issues to reception the next day but they were not fixed during our 10-day stay! But there were a lot of good points about the hotel. The pool stays open until 1am so we were able to go for a midnight swim and hot-tub which was really nice. The maid always left our room really nice and even placed all of our toiletries on little towels. There is an alarm clock, fridge, ironing board and iron in the room which was really helpful. We wanted to eat breakfast at the hotel but they were only serving the breakfast buffet (which was $10) and we didn't fancy that. So we bought some cereal, milk, plastic bowls and spoons from the supermarket down the road, which was healthier, quicker and cheaper. If you fancy it though, there are plently of diners and fast food places within a couple of minutes either way. The hotel is really close to Disney and only 5 mins from MGM, 15 from Magic Kingdom. But it is a bit of a way from Universal so we din't bother with City Walk as taxis were quite expensive. Taxis to Plaesure Island were about $20 - $25. There isn't any security at the back doors and anyone could walk into the boiding but all rooms have a door chain and peep hole so you'll be ok!! Some useful tips: Girls - my GHD's wouldn't work properly over here (they use half the voltage we do so they weren't as hot) and the hairdryer provided isn't very good so be prepared, I just went with the frizz! No-one cares what you look like over there so it was pretty liberating! Check out the Dsney boardwalk near Epcot and Downtown Disney. It's beautiful and has a cool bar where all the Disney workers go, it's called Jellyrolls. There's loads of coathangers so I wouldn't bother taking any! Anyway all, enjoy your stay here, it is great value and despite not being perfect, it is better and cheaper, than your average Premier Travel Inn in England and and it has a pool!!!! I would definately stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: newfietraveldiva
Reviews.Content: We spent five nights at the Radisson Worldgate in August. We paid about $60 a night and certainly felt that the hotel was worth that. The front desk staff were courteous and helpful. The hotel is large with a video arcade, bar, pizzeria/cafe, two pools. The grounds are nicely landscaped and the hotel is located back off the road, so that it is quiet and feels secluded from the constant traffic of the I94. The rooms are spacious and clean and have a small bar fridge which is convenient. The location is also terrific. However, there is room for improvement. The room felt older and slightly worn. The carpet had some small stains, the walls needed a coat of paint, the bathtub was worn with enamel peeling off it in places, and the bathroom itself sometimes had an odd odour. Overall, we were pleased with our stay; we spent little time in the room itself and it certainly suited our needs. I think with a few minor cosmetic repairs, the Radisson Worldgate could be a first class resort.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our Second Stay Here...And Was Very Pleasant”
Reviews.Author: Skylark1265
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned home from a delightful four-night stay at the Radisson Worldgate Resort. ... This was our second visit to this full-service hotel within the past year, and we were as equally satisified during this stay was we were previously. ... As last year, our room was located in the North Tower, and was well appointed, very clean ~ and we had no complaints, whatsoever. During this stay, we were delighted to find the room featured an impressive upgrate ~~ the new "Sleep Number" bed. All we had to do was dial a number to select the comfort and firmness of the mattress. The matress could be adjusted to individual comfort on BOTH sides of the King-size bed. The pillows were wonderful ! And we both enjoyed a comfortable, pleasant night's sleep each night. ... As during our previous stay, the bathroom was immaculate ~ not even a water stain on the polished tile floor or vanity... and the shower was spotless. .... Being Floridians, we enjoy the room being a bit cooler than perhaps most visitors from other areas. Our request that the temperature in the room be adusted to our preference was immediately met, and we were relaxing in 73 degree comfort within minutes of our arrival. Note: We did not notice any "noise" from the air conditioner, nor was there even a hint of a "foul" oder ~ anywhere. The lobby and other public areas were clean and well appointed. And the staff was friendly. Breakfast in the Savannah Grill each morning was a perfect start to a busy day. The hostess remembered us from our previous visit and her warm, friendly smile added a special touch to our dining experinece. As mentioned by other comments, this is NOT a five-star hotel. Yes, it is newly owned and oeprated by Radisson, but it is NOT the Radisson Parkway Resort ! ... Yet, for the price, it is a fine hotel and we recommend it highly. ... One final note: Most negative reviews came from folks who obtained their reservations via a discount website. No doubt they were unrealistically expecting "a whole lot of something ~ for a whole lot of NOTHING." ... IF folks want to stay in a five-star hotel, there are many to choose rom within the Disney area. But, they should be prepared to pay Five-star prices!!

Reviews.Title: “Great choice, could not have been happier!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Me and my traveling buddy just returned from a trip to Disney World from the week of July 5-11, and it was more than anyone could ever ask for. Okay, yes, one of the three elevators makes a noise when you reach the very top floors (or maybe when it stops, I don't know) but I promise it is nothing anyone could not handle. Other than that, (which did not bother me), the hotel was beautifully decorated, with a neverending lobby and all the amenities you could ever ask for. They have in-room movies that are still in the theater for less money than two people would pay at a real theater. I visited two of the pools and they were both awesome, the big one has a bar. The location was great, it was very close to disney, which made afternoon breaks a breeze. We never used the shuttle service, we drove our car to the theme parks and parked everyday for about eight or nine bucks. It was worth it to be able to come and go as you please! Anyway, the rooms were my favorite part. They were big and the AC made the whole room comfortable in about five minutes (which is heaven after a day in the parks in July). I read in other reviews that the furniture seemed outdated and dingy, ours seemed above any hotel average I've ever seen (and we travel a lot). Upon checkin, I randomly decided to see if I could get a king size bedroom, and it was no problem at all. My room had a huge bed with a sleep number mattress, a fluffy white comforter, all the amenities people mentioned below, and a small linen love seat that turns into a bed. The artwork was actually decent (not just a picture of plastic flowers) and I found the rooms to be tasteful and very clean. We stayed for a week, did not request room service but once, and never saw a bug. The bathtub is huge, and it fills up nice and deep, and after a long day of walking in the elements, you will be very grateful. The staff was very friendly, there is definately a reason this place was picked as a 'disney good neighbor' hotel. We only ate once at the breakfast bar, and it was good, but there are too many golden corralls and ponderosa's that are practically across the street to justify eating there everyday. I never smelled any gross smells anywhere, or saw anything dirty (they clean the place pretty much around the clock). We don't have any children, but they seemed to be having a great time, besides the pool, they have an arcade. All in all, it was a great place, and I will be using radissons any chance I get from here on out.

Reviews.Title: “A fine stay”
Reviews.Author: dleemundy1
Reviews.Content: The Radisson Worldgate was a fine place to stay while visiting Disney this past week. My wife and I stayed three nights. The hotel was not quite what I would expect of a Radisson but not below average. The room was clean, though the airconditioning could have worked better. It didn't cool the room off like good AC should, and it was quite noisy. The light in the bathroom blinked. Other than that, I had no complaints. Room service was prompt and good (dinner and breakfast). They were flexible with my dietary proclivities (I always write in what I really want on those breakfast hanging cards - and they got it right!). The hotel is very close to Disney. Close enough to return for a nap should you so chose (which we did). The pool looked very nice and was open till midnight. Overall, I gave this hotel four stars because it was clean, convenient, the staff was very nice, and it was a good step above economy lodging but not quite what one might expect of a Radisson.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Staff, great service.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My family and I recently stayed at the Radisson Worldgate for the first time in Orlando, and even though I was skeptical because of being new to the Radisson family, I could not have been more pleasantly surprised. We had the pleasure of being greeted by MICHELE, at the front desk, after a very long trip getting there. She was delightful, with a welcoming smile, and very eager to make sure we had everything we needed. The following day this same lovely lady remembered my daughters' name and wished her happy birthday. This made our daughters' birthday very memorable. Again, in the restaurant, wonderful service, and a just a great staff to serve the guests. We will certainly return here to visit again, had a wonderful stay!

Reviews.Title: “Staff Great, hotel worn & torn and A/C never fixed.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My sister and I booked this hotel through Hotwire which worked out to be a $75 per night room, including taxes and other fees. Since we were really only going to be in Orlando for the weekend, we didn’t really need the super-ultra-deluxe resort experience. But we DID want a clean room, decent food, and some quiet. In the late 1970’s/early 1980’s, the Radisson must have been quite the great hotel/resort. All of the facilities are there: big pool with spa, dining options, a great lobby, and large, well-planned and appointed rooms. But the Radisson doesn’t look like it’s seen an update to its overall look, décor or technology (like elevators and the like) since the mid-1980’s. It’s a good hotel, and a clean hotel, with LOTS of wear and tear around the edges (and plastic flowers on a trellis out in front by the porte cochere…what is up with THAT?) Our only major problem with the Radisson was the air conditioning in our room. It just never got cold enough for us, and it was too late in the day (and we were too drunk from Epcot) to request a new room or a room upgrade. Other than that, the room was spacious, had a mini-fridge included at no extra cost, and our room overlooked the fireworks over the Magic Kingdom at Disney World, so we got two shows for the price of one that evening…from the comfort of the seventh floor! The bathroom is especially nice, with an oblong, oval-shaped tub/shower combo (that never had the "how do I adjust the temperature issue" that ALWAYS is a problem with hotels.) What takes away from all of this praise is the wear and tear. The bathroom was nice, but had some scuff marks on the walls. The view from the room was nice, but the furniture looked well-worn and a little beaten up. The lobby was very nice, but also dated and worn. It’s sad that a little bit of money could make this Radisson a real, bona-fide upscale value property…it’s right up the road from Disney, it’s very secluded off the main drag so it’s quiet…and the hotel itself is very roomy and light. If only they could get the paint, furniture and the elevator buttons (I hate when hotels don’t fix their light-up ‘up & down’ elevator buttons. That’s like a five minute moment!) What’s really sad here is that the staff at the Radisson was quite possibly the best hotel staff I have ever had the pleasure of staying with. Seriously…the floks at 4-star Disney resorts could learn a thing or two about personalized service, attention and overall hospitality from the staff here. Very knowledgable, very prompt, and just a great group of people. A great group of people who deserve a hotel better than this one. So, management…what do you say? Throw some money at this hotel and make it world class instead of has-been. I liked your staff so much I didn’t even complain when y’all failed to fix the A/C TWICE! You’ve got the people and you’ve got the overall building…now go and spruce it up and you’ll get that next star. And if you want to see a great example of a mid-priced, value resort done right, you only have to look up the street to your sister property: the Radisson Resort Parkway.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value!”
Reviews.Author: Quinnschoice
Reviews.Content: My family and I checked into the Radisson WorldGate over the very busy Memorial Day weekend! We found the front desk staff to be very friendly and helpful even though they were so very busy! This hotel is a great value for families- Just a quick ride to all of the Disney attractions and they even have scheduled FREE transportation to Disney, Seaworld and to Universal Parks. With the free refridgerators in the rooms you can store all the snacks and juices for the kids. The hotel has a small food court that has everything and the gift shop has even more snacks. Their restaurant is good and has great staff! Or you can walk to all the different restaurants from IHOP, Burger King to Ponderosa Steakhouse to Outback Steakhouse-- They have two great pools, rooms were clean and the food was good! Like I said it is a great value for families, great location! Friendly helpful staff!

Reviews.Title: “Not good!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: i found our room smelling moldy, called front desk they never called back we had to get lysol. shower weak carpet stained bad. door cracked like it was kicked in a police raid. lock was missing screws . poorly managed. i found low to no security. anyone could walk in unnoticed. back door always open. house keeping was good and front desk was nice. never asked about my stay . tv speaker cracked flat pilows and i mean like a envelope. and on and on. would i tell you to stay? I would say if you like to camp . Well this is better. If you like clean and posh this is not it. anyway that's my 2 cents. happy lodging

Reviews.Title: “Fine By Me...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I don't know what all the hub-bub is about. My family and I enjoyed our stay at the Radisson Worldgate. They are gradually upgrading it. We had a king-size room with a new sleep-number bed (I would buy one myself if it wasn't so expensive). Just FYI: When you check in ask if the hotel has any large groups staying in the hotel like business conventioners or school groups. Why you ask? Well....we found out there were buses of kids coming in on the weekend so we took advantage of the heads-up and used the pool whenever we could before they would show up.
