Sure enough 3 days into our stay at the hotel...five busloads of kids pulled up to the hotel! Needless to say we were quite worried about the potential for a LOT of noise. But we were assured that if there were any problems the front desk would send two security guards to quiet them down. Well there was noise with the kids hanging out in the hallways slamming doors and laying on the floors (why someone would want to lay on a hotel hallway floor is beyond me - YUCK!). We called the front desk and security promptly came up and we heard no more ruckus. We also liked the location of the hotel to lots of restaurants like Red Lobster, TGI Fridays, Giordano's (If you can, get to the restaurants before 6pm to beat the crowds coming from the parks and local residents). Overall I would say our stay was good, no major complaints. I think this time of the year is the best time to go. The parks were not too crowded. We did not have to wait in line long for the good rides or shows. Just another FYI: Do your homework! Ask questions - people who have stayed in the area before, locals, people that work in the parks (or as Disney affectionately calls them "cast memebers").

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice - excellent value!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I am amazed at the slagging off this hotel has had recently - especially as my family's experience was really good. The hotel is very large - and grand - ok - it IS looking a bit tired around the edges but we paid around £35/$68 per night and were quite frankly - wowed by the facilities provided for that paltry sum. Rooms were large - there was a bit of an odour in ours thro' out but we didn't find it so bad as to complain. Bathroom was good - with the BEST shower we've ever had in a hotel. The hotel lobby IS large and grand (see photo) and the swimming pool excellent - kids loved it! though a little crowded - but then there was anothe large pool at the rear which was available. The view from our ground floor room was lovely - a huge picture window covering the whole width of the wall overlooking green lawns and palm trees. Yes - it isn't 5* - but then one isn't paying 5* prices...indeed after a week here, we moved to the Baymont Inn, Kissimee a few miles down the road - which had excellent write ups...and although it WAS almost pristine in its decor, there were no real additional facilities - - in fact there were less: it was a much smaller hotel with a minute lobby, a dreadfully small breakfast area, a small swimming pool, no safe in the room...and a small window in the bedroom overlooking a dull rear car - park, and an indeterminably slow lift !! (it took LESS time to travel 16 floors in the Excalibur, Las Vegas, than it took this lift to travel to the next level!!!). So it's a case of which do you prefer?? my whole family preferred the Radisson - because one felt one was in a grand hotel setting as against a mere motel. We let the older kids wander around the Radisson to kill 20 mins - but the Baymont - well 2 minutes if that. Plus to have a pizza parlour (not brilliant tastewise - but convenient and cheap), and ice-cream/coffee, groceries etc available in the foyer -PLUS internet access and cheap phone calls to the UK (4 mins for 50c) in the side lobby was great - oh yes - they also have a table-tennis facility and a games room for kids. Incidentally, we have travelled extensively over the years and stayed at the Sheraton, Luxor, Radisson (Kuala Lumpur), Marriott (LA) - this a week after the Radisson, etc - so we do have an idea of what top notch hotels are like. I would never stay at the Baymont Inn - which was 30% more expensive than the Radisson - that extra money would pay for a full breakfast buffett ot the wonderful Golden Coral for the whole family (of 5) daily - so the 'free breakfast' at Baymont was not really free.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Louiscrow
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel 1 year ago online and paid about £30 a night for a big room that slept 2 Adults and 2 Children, the room was very large, clean and had everything including a safe that we required for 12 nights. We had a room in the north tower that has just been referbished, we would book again and stay in this hotel it was safe and the staff very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Never again!”
Reviews.Author: LisaWar65
Reviews.Content: Let me start out by saying I bid for this hotel room on Priceline and realize there could be some minor problems although never to the extreme that we had. The maid, or someone who came into our room, took money off our dresser. Ok, it was only change, but it clearly was not meant for the maid since we kept putting our change in a pile each nite. We were not offered anything for this except for the Head Housekeeper to clean our room. The room looks much nicer on the internet pictures. Our refrig was broken and the beds were VERY uncomfortable. We had ants in our bathroom each day. Our coffee maker was also broke. The restaurant, not the main restaurant, the smaller one, had hard bagels. When my son returned it for another, he got another...hard bagel. The hot tub was broke 3 of the days we were there. When I complained very nicely about everything listed here, the front desk person (forget the name) was too busy worrying about his personal phone call he put on hold to talk to me. He did NOTHING, I mean no credit, nothing. We have stayed in a Radisson in the past and never experienced these problems. We also have stayed in many other hotels that we won through Priceline without problems. Never again!

Reviews.Title: “Family Unfriendly”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This Hotel proposes to have good beds, the beds we had were rubbish and provided constant backache. Room was is a bad condition, pillows were very soft, and when asked for 4 more so that all of the family could have better sleep, we were told that they could only provide two. The condition of the furniture was bad, and several of the fittings were actually broken. We stayed out as much as possible. The Shuttles only run once a day, and were always full so hire a car it gives you better flexibility. This hotel was part of a package provided by take a Break Travel, and does not do anything for the Raddison name. I would not stay there as a family ever again.

Reviews.Title: “Do not pay full Price for this hotel..”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed over Easter 2005.. I have to say .. very Rude front desk person.. First name begane with a K.. anyway.. When i asked her for the prcedure to get shuttle to parks and where to pick it up in Disney.. she became irate that she had to repeat herself.. so much SO that I had to apologize to her because I did not understand what she was saying.. her coworker jumped in and took control of the situation..nasty.. especially since you have traveled a great distance to be treated that way.. in front of your family.. also thet room reaked of a smell.. we where on the ground level.. had to have cleaning people to do something.. they put an air cleaner in the room.. kinda odd they had that which made me think they have had a lot of complaints about the smell.. pool was okay.. breakfast buffet was okay not worth the 10.95 price they charged.. now to the shuttle service to and from the parks.. OMG.. a man who spoke hardly any english who was very stressed out.. usually arrived 30 minutes late every time to and from the parks.. you had to find some God for saken lane in a dark parking lot outside of whichever park you were at and hope he showed up.. didnt seem very safe to me.. first night it poored and the shuttle was 40 mintes late.. said we had to get on by the hotel we stayeded.. like herded cattle.. I over paid on priceline at 70 dollars a night... I would stay there for 40 bucks a night.. they had a workout room.. and a bussiness center.. over all.. never again... period..

Reviews.Title: “A great time.”
Reviews.Author: mightyjar
Reviews.Content: We stayed here March 20-24 and it was better than expected. The room was decent and kept clean daily by a wonderful maid. The pool was nice and warm as was the hot tub. We paid 60.00$ per night thru priceline and would definetely stay here again. It is very close to Disney and a ton of restaurants are nearby. We needed a cot and we were not charged for the use. I really enjoyed our stay and recommend this hotel for a comfortable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Really Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: dickson_thunder
Reviews.Content: We stayed on March 8th and had bid $59 for a four star hotel on Priceline and were pleased with the hotel. It had a refrigerator in the room and had a very large bathtub that looked like a jacuzzi tub without the jets. The beds were firm without being too hard. Although I'm guessing the hotel was probably 20 years old the room and common areas looked to be in good condition. We spent the next four nights in a Disney Deluxe at 3 times this price and the only difference I saw between the two were two Queens at Disney versus two Doubles at the Radisson. The Radisson is located at the intersection of US192 and Sherberth Road. Sherberth Road is a shortcut into the Animal Kingdom area of Disney and could be used at peak traffic times to get into any area of Disneyworld instead of fighting the traffic on 192. We did not eat at the Radisson but there are several places very close to it to eat from Fast Food to places like Red Lobster. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place”
Reviews.Author: BaldLoonie
Reviews.Content: Spacious, nicely decorated rooms. Well lit, very clean though starting to show a bit of age. Good A/C & TV, nice beds. Free wireless internet worked flawlessly. 2 large pools, tiny hot tub. Front desk was efficient & friendly, didn't eat there, too many lower priced places nearby. Short drive to any Disney site. Not sure I'd pay full rack rate but with a discount I'd surely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value! Would Go Back Again!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We (2 adults, 2 children) stayed at this hotel for 6 nights at the end of January 2005. The hotel is nice and clean, although a bit dated. Pro: Wireless Internet connection, couldn't live without it. Clean room, lots of towels. Frendly staff. Quiet location-we were on the top floor and had an excellent view. Close to Disney, lots of shops nearby. Con: Passed its prime, needed paint job in the elevator, room. Entry door to the south tower wasn't secured. For the price of $49 we paid through eleisurelink, we would definitely come back!

HotelInfo.Name: Worldgate Resort
HotelInfo.Address: 3011 Maingate Lane, Kissimmee, FL 34747
